column1: 4260409286,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-scalapay-4260409286?position=1&pageNum=0&refId=uBpCfe5q2i%2B18hBlyebQZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=ai5FrTLldZe0q0vL0rNeLA%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Scalapay,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Thanks to our innovative BuyNow PayLater payment solution, Scalapay is transforming the way more than 6.5 million customers buy online and in-store, empowering 8,000+ merchants (online and in-store) to give their customers magical shopping experiences.

Being only 3 years old didn’t stop us from becoming a unicorn 🦄 We have raised over $700mln and we did this thanks to a team built around our 4 core values: #MakeItHappen #PlayAsATeam #StayCurious #FocusOnCustomer.
This is where your magic happens. If you love it, Scalapay it ♥

Our data team seeks a Data Analyst who will champion a 'data-first' mindset, ensuring precise measurement and reporting of relevant metrics. This role collaborates closely with Scalapay’s key Business Units such as Product, Marketing and Sales, employing technical expertise to translate concepts into concrete outcomes.
Serve as the data point of reference for our key Business Units, providing them with necessary support
Use advanced analytical tools to assess and interpret sales and marketing data, measuring the effectiveness of activities and pinpointing areas for improvement
Build and maintain comprehensive reports and dashboards for our teams to facilitate data-driven decision-making
Translate business questions into analytical solutions, providing actionable insights
Ensure accuracy and reliability in measuring key performance indicators (KPIs) and the underlying data
Identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement in order to propose data-driven recommendations to optimise marketing strategies and sales processes
Conduct hands-on work with data, including data cleansing, transformation, and validation
Help us extend a data-driven mindset throughout Scalapay
Be an active member of the Data team, helping to develop and enhance our suite of Business Intelligence tooling.
You’ll be great for this role if:
You have a minimum of 3 years of experience in a data-driven role, ideally with a background in startups or fintech
You have strong SQL skills, Python is a plus
You are proficient in data visualisation tools and data storytelling
You have a background in statistics and can conduct experiments or validate hypotheses
You are fluent in Italian and English: you must be totally confident talking and sharing results in English in a sharp and concise way
You demonstrate outstanding communication skills, both verbally and in writing. You excel at simplifying complex topics into straightforward solutions and ideas
You’re more than data-driven, you are obsessed with data!
Attractive packages based on skills and experience - the salary we have for this position is up to 40'000€ (Gross Annual Base)
International environment with significant challenges to be met every day
Lots of opportunities to work with a team of industry tech leaders who are focused on delivering products that offer exceptional user experiences
Personalised support to accelerate your professional growth and take ownership of the products you deliver: we want to help you grow!
Latest technologies and being encouraged to bring your flair to the role.
Initial Chat: A brief conversation with our Talent Acquisition team
Hiring Manager Interview: A deep dive into your experience and motivation for the role
Case Study: A skills-based test with a debriefing session involving key stakeholders
Final Chat with Simone (CEO): An opportunity to discuss Scalapay’s values and assess cultural alignment.
Want to learn more? Don't hesitate to explore our Careers website, our LinkedIn and Glassdoor pages.
Pro tip: send your CV in English 😉
Super Pro tip: we know that application processes can be scary and frustrating but… we look for talent, not people that tick all our boxes.
We believe in the power of diversity: Scalapay is an Equal Opportunity Employer for any minority, disability, gender identity or sexual orientation.

4236567226,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-data-analyst-at-kpmg-italy-4236567226?position=2&pageNum=0&refId=uBpCfe5q2i%2B18hBlyebQZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=YhccJNMqOBzT3HailFaCMw%3D%3D,Junior - Data Analyst,KPMG Italy,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","The chance to build a better future is right in front of you
Do Work That Matters - Il tuo ruolo e le tue responsabilità

Vuoi fare un lavoro che sia davvero significativo e di impatto? In KPMG avrai l’opportunità di aiutare i clienti, la società, le colleghe e i colleghi ad affrontare e risolvere le sfide più attuali e complesse

Il Digital Assurance Team è un team all’avanguardia di KPMG in cui diverse competenze collaborano per dare forma alla digitalizzazione del futuro dei servizi di assurance e revisione contabile. A vrai l’opportunità di lavorare a fianco di revisori esperti sviluppando, attraverso la formazione interna ma soprattutto il training on the job, la capacità di analizzare criticamente i processi aziendali a supporto dell’informativa finanziaria e i dati elaborati dai sistemi informativi delle società identificando elementi di anomalia ed interpretando le dinamiche alla base dei trend economico-finanziari.
Sviluppo di soluzioni di analytics a supporto dei team di audit (transactional analytics, dashboard di analisi di dati contabili, process mining, KPI di processo, ecc)
Sviluppo di tecniche di revisione basate sull’utilizzo di soluzioni tecnologiche innovative
Supporto ai team nell’utilizzo delle soluzioni proposte
Cura di eventi di comunicazione volti a far conoscere il progetto / le soluzioni
Come As You Are - Le tue competenze e caratteristiche
Questa opportunità è perfetta per te se:
Hai una formazione di base economico-contabile
Hai spiccato interesse per l’area del reporting finanziario e per i data analytics
Hai voglia di imparare e metterti in gioco
Vuoi crescere all’interno di un Network Internazionale
Your Future With Us - Cosa troverai in KPMG
Un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, equo e che rispetta, incoraggia e valorizza le diversità
Un contesto stimolante e dinamico che incentiva la creatività e il lavoro di squadra
Modalità di lavoro ibrida, per promuovere un sano equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale
Programmi di formazione e sviluppo avanzati per rimanere sempre aggiornati
Together for Better – I nostri valori e il nostro impegno

Leadership, lavoro in team, rispetto di ogni individualità, approfondimento continuo, trasparenza, impegno verso la comunità, integrità: questi sono i Valori di KPMG che danno vita a un ambiente aperto allo scambio di idee e di conoscenza, che permette ai nostri professionisti di esprimere tutto il loro potenziale.

Grazie all’impegno nel favorire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, il nostro Network risulta conforme agli standard dei requisiti ISO 30415, sul Sistema di Gestione per la Diversità e l’Inclusione, e UNI PdR 125, relativa alla parità di genere.

I tuoi dati saranno trattati nel pieno rispetto delle disposizioni del Regolamento (UE) n. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ""GDPR"") e successive modifiche. Per ulteriori informazioni, consultare l'informativa sulla privacy di KPMG .
KPMG S.p.A. garantisce le pari opportunità.
The chance to build a better future is right in front of you
Do Work That Matters - Your Role and Responsibilities

Do you want to do work that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG, you will have the opportunity to help clients, society, and your colleagues tackle and solve the most current and complex challenges.

The Digital Assurance Team is KPMG’s innovative team which brings together different skill sets to shape the digitalization of the future for assurance and audit services. You will have the opportunity to work alongside expert auditors – through in-house courses and especially on-the-job training – developing the ability to critically analyse the company processes used in financial reporting and the information processed by the companies’ IT systems, identifying errors and interpreting the dynamics underlying financial performance.
Specifically, you will be tasked with:
The development of analytics solutions for audit teams (transactional analytics, dashboards for the analysis of accounting data, process mining, process KPIs, etc.)
The development of audit techniques based on the use of innovative technological solutions
Assistance to the audit teams in using the new solutions
The organization of communication initiatives to raise awareness of the project/solutions.
Come As You Are - Your Skills and Characteristics
This is the perfect opportunity for you if:
You have a business/accounting background with a degree in business subject
You have a strong interest in financial reporting and data analytics
You have a desire to learn and challenge yourself
You want to grow within an International Network
Your Future With Us - What You Will Find at KPMG
An inclusive and equitable work environment that respects, encourages, and values diversity.
A challenging and dynamic environment that encourages creativity and teamwork. [NL1]
Hybrid work arrangements to promote a healthy work-life balance.
Advanced training and development programs to stay current.
Initiatives focused on physical and mental well-being.
Together for Better – Our Values and Commitment

Leadership, teamwork, respect for individuality, continuous learning, transparency, community engagement, integrity: these are the values of KPMG that create an environment open to the exchange of ideas and knowledge, allowing our professionals to express their full potential.

As a result of our commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, our Network complies with the standards of the ISO 30415 requirements, on the Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and UNI PdR 125, relating to gender equality.

Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) no. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - “GDPR”), as amended. For more information, please see KPMG’s privacy policy .
KPMG S.p.A. is an equal opportunity employer.

The chance to build a better future is right in front of you

4259401998,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-data-analyst-milano-cagliari-at-deloitte-4259401998?position=4&pageNum=0&refId=uBpCfe5q2i%2B18hBlyebQZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=4Q%2BCyhIeSSFh51GEuDPf%2BA%3D%3D,Junior - Data Analyst Milano/Cagliari,Deloitte,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Sei pronto a #MakeAnImpactThatMatters nel nostro team Audit & Assurance?

Entrando nel Team di Deloitte Data Analytics Audit&Assurance avrai l’occasione di crescere e sviluppare forti competenze trasversali, lavorando su progetti sfidanti e collaborando con moltissimi clienti.

Con la supervisione dei colleghi e colleghe più esperti, sarai responsabile delle attività progettuali nelle quali sarai coinvolto, e della qualità del tuo lavoro e del tuo allineamento alle priorità, agli obiettivi e alle esigenze dei clienti.
Grazie a questa esperienza, potrai acquisire un bagaglio culturale utile e ampio in questo ambito operando in una realtà leader nel settore.

In quanto Analyst avrai la possibilità di imparare dai colleghi più Senior (attraverso il learning on the job) e sviluppare competenze tecniche e relazionali lavorando in un contesto stimolante, che comporta sfide impegnative con ottime prospettive professionali.
Raccogliere, analizzare e interpretare dati provenienti da diverse fonti, mediante l’utilizzo di strumenti quali Excel, SQL, Python.
Sviluppare report e dashboard tramite i principali tool di BI (es. PowerBI, Qlik Sense, Qlik Cloud,…).
Supportare nell’organizzazione e gestione dei dataset su database relazionali e NoSQL.
Analizzare, interpretare dati e fornire insights per il miglioramento dei processi aziendali
Grazie all’ufficio Learning avrai modo di seguire corsi e attività di formazione che ti permetteranno di ampliare e approfondire le tue conoscenze.

I colleghi del Talent invece, si occuperanno in maniera strutturata del tuo avanzamento di carriera con KPI e obiettivi definiti, che se raggiunti, ti garantiranno la revisione del grade e degli economics.
Laurea in Ingegneria, Informatica, Matematica, Fisica, Data Science
Competenze di base in analisi dei dati, statistiche e metodologie di data mining
Conoscenza dei concetti di organizzazione di un Data Warehouse
Conoscenza di strumenti di analisi dati come Excel, SQL
Conoscenza dei linguaggi di programmazione per l'analisi dei dati (es. Python, R)
Spiccate capacità analitiche e attitudine al problem-solving
Disponibilità a viaggiare in Italia e all’estero
Esperienza su strumenti quali SQL Server, Power BI, Qlik, PowerPlatform
Conoscenza delle principali tecniche di machine learning, deep learning e NLP
Esperienza nell’utilizzo di librerie di machine learning come Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.
Vorresti intraprendere una carriera professionale nel mondo della consulenza, dove la parola d’ordine è: crescita
L’idea di trasformare un problema in opportunità ti stimola
Ti ritieni una persona empatica e quindi disponibile ad accogliere le diverse esigenze dei tuoi colleghi e degli stakeholder interni ed esterni
Ti piacerebbe imparare ad avere una visione progettuale d’insieme, tenendo sempre a mente l’operatività per raggiungere gli obiettivi con integrità e rispetto degli standard Deloitte
Ti piace lavorare in un ambiente sfidante in cui le priorità possono cambiare quotidianamente

Siamo impegnati a ridurre i nostri impatti e incoraggiamo le persone ad assumere comportamenti sostenibili. Per salvaguardare l’ambiente e limitare il climate change, abbiamo sviluppato la strategia WorldClimate, attraverso la quale ci siamo posti l’obiettivo di diventare una Net Zero.
Join our #iAct movement! Fai il quiz per calcolare la tua carbon footprint e scopri come adottare dei comportamenti più responsabili.
Se vuoi scoprire come sarà il processo di selezione, guarda questo video.
Se vuoi prepararti ad incontrare i nostri Recruiter iscriviti alla nostra piattaforma gratuita di orientamento al lavoro.
Si offre inserimento in stage di 6 mesi caratterizzato da un percorso di training ad alto valore formativo.
Sedi di lavoro: Milano o Cagliari
Saranno prese in considerazione tutte le candidature indistintamente, nel rispetto dei nostri valori ed in linea con la nostra cultura inclusiva.

Deloitte è una società leader mondiale nei servizi professionali presente in oltre 150 Paesi. Il suo scopo è fornire ai propri clienti gli strumenti necessari per affrontare le più complesse sfide di business.
Per saperne di più visita il nostro sito:
Deloitte valorizza tutte le diversità come fonte di innovazione e ricchezza individuale e collettiva. Per saperne di più:

Il nome Deloitte si riferisce a una o più delle seguenti entità: Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, una società inglese a responsabilità limitata (“DTTL”), le member firm aderenti al suo network e le entità a esse correlate. DTTL e ciascuna delle sue member firm sono entità giuridicamente separate e indipendenti tra loro. DTTL (denominata anche “Deloitte Global”) non fornisce servizi ai clienti. Si invita a leggere l’informativa completa relativa alla descrizione della struttura legale di Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited e delle sue member firm all’indirizzo www.deloitte.com/about.
Deloitte is an Equal Opportunity Employer. I candidati con l'invio del loro curriculum autorizzano Deloitte al trattamento dei dati ai sensi del D.lgs. 196/03.

  • Analizzare, interpretare dati e fornire insights per il miglioramento dei processi aziendali

Grazie all’ufficio Learning avrai modo di seguire corsi e attività di formazione che ti permetteranno di ampliare e approfondire le tue conoscenze.

I colleghi del Talent invece, si occuperanno in maniera strutturata del tuo avanzamento di carriera con KPI e obiettivi definiti, che se raggiunti, ti garantiranno la revisione del grade e degli economics.

#WinningRequirements

  • Laurea in Ingegneria, Informatica, Matematica, Fisica, Data Science
  • Competenze di base in analisi dei dati, statistiche e metodologie di data mining
  • Conoscenza dei concetti di organizzazione di un Data Warehouse
  • Conoscenza di strumenti di analisi dati come Excel, SQL
  • Conoscenza dei linguaggi di programmazione per l'analisi dei dati (es. Python, R)
  • Spiccate capacità analitiche e attitudine al problem-solving
  • Propensione al lavoro in team
  • Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese
  • Disponibilità a viaggiare in Italia e all’estero

#NiceToHave

  • Esperienza su strumenti quali SQL Server, Power BI, Qlik, PowerPlatform
  • Conoscenza delle principali tecniche di machine learning, deep learning e NLP
  • Esperienza nell’utilizzo di librerie di machine learning come Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.

#LoveWorkingAtDeloitteIf

  • Vorresti intraprendere una carriera professionale nel mondo della consulenza, dove la parola d’ordine è: crescita
  • L’idea di trasformare un problema in opportunità ti stimola
  • Ti ritieni una persona empatica e quindi disponibile ad accogliere le diverse esigenze dei tuoi colleghi e degli stakeholder interni ed esterni
  • Ti piacerebbe imparare ad avere una visione progettuale d’insieme, tenendo sempre a mente l’operatività per raggiungere gli obiettivi con integrità e rispetto degli standard Deloitte
  • Ti piace lavorare in un ambiente sfidante in cui le priorità possono cambiare quotidianamente
  • Ami lavorare in team

#MakeanImpactThatMatters

Siamo impegnati a ridurre i nostri impatti e incoraggiamo le persone ad assumere comportamenti sostenibili. Per salvaguardare l’ambiente e limitare il climate change, abbiamo sviluppato la strategia WorldClimate, attraverso la quale ci siamo posti l’obiettivo di diventare una Net Zero.

Join our #iAct movement! Fai il quiz per calcolare la tua carbon footprint e scopri come adottare dei comportamenti più responsabili.

Se vuoi scoprire come sarà il processo di selezione, guarda questo video.

Se vuoi prepararti ad incontrare i nostri Recruiter iscriviti alla nostra piattaforma gratuita di orientamento al lavoro.

Si offre inserimento in stage di 6 mesi caratterizzato da un percorso di training ad alto valore formativo.

Sedi di lavoro: Milano o Cagliari

Saranno prese in considerazione tutte le candidature indistintamente, nel rispetto dei nostri valori ed in linea con la nostra cultura inclusiva.

About Deloitte

Deloitte è una società leader mondiale nei servizi professionali presente in oltre 150 Paesi. Il suo scopo è fornire ai propri clienti gli strumenti necessari per affrontare le più complesse sfide di business.

About Deloitte

Per saperne di più visita il nostro sito:

https://www2.deloitte.com/it/it/legal/about-deloitte-italy.html



About Audit &
column4:
Assurance

https://www2.deloitte.com/it/it/services/audit.html?icid=top_audit

Deloitte valorizza tutte le diversità come fonte di innovazione e ricchezza individuale e collettiva. Per saperne di più:

https://www2.deloitte.com/it/it/pages/careers/articles/diversity---inclusion---deloitte-italy---careers---life-at-deloi.html

Il nome Deloitte si riferisce a una o più delle seguenti entità: Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, una società inglese a responsabilità limitata (“DTTL”), le member firm aderenti al suo network e le entità a esse correlate. DTTL e ciascuna delle sue member firm sono entità giuridicamente separate e indipendenti tra loro. DTTL (denominata anche “Deloitte Global”) non fornisce servizi ai clienti. Si invita a leggere l’informativa completa relativa alla descrizione della struttura legale di Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited e delle sue member firm all’indirizzo www.deloitte.com/about.

Deloitte is an Equal Opportunity Employer. I candidati con l'invio del loro curriculum autorizzano Deloitte al trattamento dei dati ai sensi del D.lgs. 196/03.

4261992373,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-digital-data-analyst-at-softlab-s-p-a-4261992373?position=10&pageNum=0&refId=uBpCfe5q2i%2B18hBlyebQZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=mHV76PuXsvmpvOx79IbuJA%3D%3D,Junior Digital Data Analyst,Softlab S.p.A.,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Do you enjoy analysing data, but also love to interact with non-technical stakeholders to present business-oriented insights?
Do you strive for excellence, but are also capable to find the right trade-off between time taken to deliver and the quality of the end result?
Do you perform best when working in a team, but are also willing to go solo when needed?

If you answered “yes - that’s me!” to the questions above, then you should join Softlab’s Digital Marketing & Sales Practice as Digital Data Analyst (remote-first role, contractually based in Milano): you’ll be working closely with our clients’ teams to provide key data insights, using state-of-art digital analytics tools, that drive business decisions impacting both online and offline channels.
In Softlab, you’ll be free to express your full potential working with our top-tier clients and having a real impact on the growth of our company.
Bring together data from multiple sources, leverage it to identify unspotted behaviours and drive changes based on actionable insights
Use available digital & non-digital data for answering any analytics-related question coming from business stakeholders
Translate high-level commercial requests into meaningful KPIs, and then in metrics and dimensions that can be measured
Present the results of your analyses being able to summarize the key insights, but also to drill down in the details
Proactively push to improve the status quo by experimenting with data analysis
Good knowledge of SAS, SQL, R, Python or similar solution for data analysis
Preferred: hands-on experience with digital analytics tools usage (e.g. Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics)
Good experience with other office tools (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint)
Attention to details, ability to meet deadlines, manage multiple priorities, and work in a team
Proficiency in Italian and English languages (written & spoken)
Preferred: statistics, mathematics, engineering, or similar STEM university background
Stimulating experience in a dynamic consulting company: you will learn a lot and grow based on your performance
Pleasant environment, where the team generates value for our clients and builds strong relationships: you will always receive support and feel welcomed as a member of the Softlab family
Exciting work with innovative technologies and solutions: you will develop hard and soft skills that will always come handy, and will help defining advanced standards and best practices
Remote-ready work: if the project allows it, you’ll have the possibility to work wherever there is a reliable Internet connection (the role will be contractually based in Milano)
We are a company certified for Gender Equality (Uni/PdR 125:2022). This position is open to all individuals who meet the technical requirements, regardless of gender.
We believe that teams composed of diverse individuals generate better ideas and help us understand and support our clients more effectively. That’s why we ensure equal opportunities for everyone.

At Softlab S.p.A., we accompany every person from the moment they submit their application throughout their time with us, along a career path that does not consider or discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any form of disability.
As a company, we take responsibility for playing an active role in supporting a cultural and social shift that recognizes equal opportunities for all and a life free from discrimination.

4249166385,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-dentsu-creative-italy-4249166385?position=14&pageNum=0&refId=uBpCfe5q2i%2B18hBlyebQZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=V73sGZ2A0H2pXR%2BRX%2B3t8Q%3D%3D,Data analyst,Dentsu Creative Italy,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Dentsu Creative is a global creative agency network designed to unlock exponential growth for clients. We use Transformative Creativity as a differentiating, driving force to bring our capabilities together to positively impact people, business and society.
Established in 2022, Dentsu Creative is integrated with dentsu’s Media and CXM businesses in over 145 countries and regions, to offer Integrated Growth Solutions.
We are looking for a Data Analyst to be employed in our Milan office.

We are looking for Data Analyst with boundless curiosity and a deep passion for data and innovation. Someone who not only sees the numbers, but also understands the people behind them — a professional who blends analytical rigor with a humanistic lens on the world.

As a Data Analyst within Dentsu Creative’s award-winning strategy team, you will dive deep into numbers to decode what’s really happening around us. With a sharp analytical eye and the ability to see connections beyond the numbers, you read and interpret data to uncover the forces shaping culture, behaviours, and brands — turning complex information into clear, strategic insights that inspire bold and impactful thinking and creativity.

You will work closely with all the Dentsu Creative verticals (Brand Strategy, Advertising, Events, Luxury, Gaming, Social, Influencer Marketing, and more) as a true 360º expert of consumer, industry and cultural trends & insights, developing insights and point of views for some of the biggest Global and Italian brands.

From insight reports to sweeping innovation projects, we're looking for someone who’s curious about the world — someone who questions assumptions, challenges conventions, and uses data to reframe challenges and find unexpected answers.
Analyze and present reports on digital and social performance, turning data into clear, actionable insights.
Conduct social listening analysis to identify conversation patterns, audience and brand insight.
Support the design and development of ad hoc surveys to uncover strategic insights and inform brand decision-making.
Monitor key trends and shifts, providing analysis that supports teams across dentsu with culturally informed thinking.
Help develop analysis packages for clients, supporting the creation of tailored research proposals in collaboration with different Dentsu teams.
Strategic thinker with a strong analytical mindset and a deep curiosity constantly exploring trends, conducting desk research, and scouting for cultural signals and emerging behaviors.
Skilled at translating complex datasets into clear, actionable insights that inform creative thinking and shape brand relevance — both for people and algorithms.
Strong communicator who knows how to get to the point — making data feel accessible, relevant, and compelling in both written and spoken form.
Proficient in PowerPoint, with the ability to craft presentations that inform, persuade, and guide strategic decisions.
Collaborative and proactive, with a strong sense of ownership and a habit of going beyond task execution to find smarter solutions.
Strong team player with a talent for listening, mediation, and leading teams and clients with clear, substantiated rationales.
Comfortable working across data tools and platforms, with advanced Excel skills (formulas, pivot tables, worksheets).
Fluent in Italian (written and spoken) and fluent in written English — good spoken English is a strong plus.
Bonus: experienced in data visualization, presenting insights in elegant, visually engaging formats.
2+ Years of proven experience with data and reporting
Skilled in processing and managing data through Excel and pivot tables
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, combined with strong expertise in data visualization and presentation
Ability to effectively balance high quality with strict deadlines
Your mother tongue is Italian, but you’re fluent in English
Proficiency with data & analytics platforms (e.g. Brandwatch) is a plus

Joining Dentsu Creative, you will be part of a creative network, delivering ideas that are brought alive in new ways. Along the way, you will team up with inspiring people across the world and become part of a truly inclusive culture where everyone is given the opportunity to thrive and create the best work of their careers
column2: always learning and always listening to shape ideas, create culture and change behaviour. By bringing together the capabilities, experience and relationships of our collective experts, the opportunities for personal growth and development are endless.

column1: We are united by four signature strengths:

Boundless Creativity – Kitsune Fox: In Japanese culture – the Kitsune Fox sees the future. We run towards the future, forever asking: what’s next? Our imagination has no limit. Our clients seek us out because we believe there is no problem we cannot solve with the power of modern creativity.

Intelligent Scale - Ryujin Dragon: The Ryujin Dragon controls the ocean and the tides. We flow the right talent around the right brief in the right moment, wherever it sits in the world. We scale our unique ideas with precision, using intelligent technology to make personal connections with millions around the world.

Obsessive Craft - Orizuru Crane: The Orizuru Crane carries the soul up to paradise. It inspires the most classic and iconic Japanese origami. We elevate the soul of our work with an obsessive focus on craft, nurturing the next-gen craft skills needed to soar in a modern world.

Radical Collaboration - Kohaku Koi: The Koi swim upstream against the tide, united as one. We chart new territory through the power of radical collaboration. We seamlessly connect Creativity, Media and CXM to imagine new solutions at the intersection of craft, data, culture, and innovation.

We believe our work can only resonate in the modern world if the people behind it reflect the modern work. We can only be truly relevant when we create a truly inclusive culture where everyone can thrive. That means – we are tough on the work but gentle with each other. We lead with empathy and are always listening and always learning. We support each other, we cheer for each other, we win together. We celebrate difference as the only way to make the work that makes a difference.

Dentsu Creative is a global creative agency network designed to unlock exponential growth for clients. We use Transformative Creativity as a differentiating, driving force to bring our capabilities together to positively impact people, business and society.

Established in 2022, Dentsu Creative is integrated with dentsu’s Media and CXM businesses in over 145 countries and regions, to offer Integrated Growth Solutions.


We are looking for a Data Analyst to be employed in our Milan office.


Role Description


We are looking for Data Analyst with boundless curiosity and a deep passion for data and innovation. Someone who not only sees the numbers, but also understands the people behind them — a professional who blends analytical rigor with a humanistic lens on the world.


As a Data Analyst within Dentsu Creative’s award-winning strategy team, you will dive deep into numbers to decode what’s really happening around us. With a sharp analytical eye and the ability to see connections beyond the numbers, you read and interpret data to uncover the forces shaping culture, behaviours, and brands — turning complex information into clear, strategic insights that inspire bold and impactful thinking and creativity.


You will work closely with all the Dentsu Creative verticals (Brand Strategy, Advertising, Events, Luxury, Gaming, Social, Influencer Marketing, and more) as a true 360º expert of consumer, industry and cultural trends &
column2:
insights, developing insights and point of views for some of the biggest Global and Italian brands.

From insight reports to sweeping innovation projects, we're looking for someone who’s curious about the world — someone who questions assumptions, challenges conventions, and uses data to reframe challenges and find unexpected answers.


Key Responsibilities


  • Analyze and present reports on digital and social performance, turning data into clear, actionable insights.
  • Conduct social listening analysis to identify conversation patterns, audience and brand insight.
  • Support the design and development of ad hoc surveys to uncover strategic insights and inform brand decision-making.
  • Monitor key trends and shifts, providing analysis that supports teams across dentsu with culturally informed thinking.
  • Help develop analysis packages for clients, supporting the creation of tailored research proposals in collaboration with different Dentsu teams.


Who we are looking for


  • Strategic thinker with a strong analytical mindset and a deep curiosity constantly exploring trends, conducting desk research, and scouting for cultural signals and emerging behaviors.
  • Skilled at translating complex datasets into clear, actionable insights that inform creative thinking and shape brand relevance — both for people and algorithms.
  • Strong communicator who knows how to get to the point — making data feel accessible, relevant, and compelling in both written and spoken form.
  • Proficient in PowerPoint, with the ability to craft presentations that inform, persuade, and guide strategic decisions.
  • Collaborative and proactive, with a strong sense of ownership and a habit of going beyond task execution to find smarter solutions.
  • Strong team player with a talent for listening, mediation, and leading teams and clients with clear, substantiated rationales.
  • Comfortable working across data tools and platforms, with advanced Excel skills (formulas, pivot tables, worksheets).
  • Fluent in Italian (written and spoken) and fluent in written English — good spoken English is a strong plus.
  • Bonus: experienced in data visualization, presenting insights in elegant, visually engaging formats.


Skills &
column3:
Experience


  • 2+ Years of proven experience with data and reporting
  • Skilled in processing and managing data through Excel and pivot tables
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, combined with strong expertise in data visualization and presentation
  • Obsessive attention to detail
  • Ability to effectively balance high quality with strict deadlines
  • Team working and collaborative attitude
  • Self-motivation and a problem-solving attitude
  • Your mother tongue is Italian, but you’re fluent in English
  • Proficiency with data &
column4:
analytics platforms (e.g. Brandwatch) is a plus


Working with us


Joining Dentsu Creative, you will be part of a creative network, delivering ideas that are brought alive in new ways. Along the way, you will team up with inspiring people across the world and become part of a truly inclusive culture where everyone is given the opportunity to thrive and create the best work of their careers
column5:
always learning and always listening to shape ideas, create culture and change behaviour. By bringing together the capabilities, experience and relationships of our collective experts, the opportunities for personal growth and development are endless.


We are united by four signature strengths:


Boundless Creativity – Kitsune Fox: In Japanese culture – the Kitsune Fox sees the future. We run towards the future, forever asking: what’s next? Our imagination has no limit. Our clients seek us out because we believe there is no problem we cannot solve with the power of modern creativity.


Intelligent Scale - Ryujin Dragon: The Ryujin Dragon controls the ocean and the tides. We flow the right talent around the right brief in the right moment, wherever it sits in the world. We scale our unique ideas with precision, using intelligent technology to make personal connections with millions around the world.


Obsessive Craft - Orizuru Crane: The Orizuru Crane carries the soul up to paradise. It inspires the most classic and iconic Japanese origami. We elevate the soul of our work with an obsessive focus on craft, nurturing the next-gen craft skills needed to soar in a modern world.


Radical Collaboration - Kohaku Koi: The Koi swim upstream against the tide, united as one. We chart new territory through the power of radical collaboration. We seamlessly connect Creativity, Media and CXM to imagine new solutions at the intersection of craft, data, culture, and innovation.


Our Values


We believe our work can only resonate in the modern world if the people behind it reflect the modern work. We can only be truly relevant when we create a truly inclusive culture where everyone can thrive. That means – we are tough on the work but gentle with each other. We lead with empathy and are always listening and always learning. We support each other, we cheer for each other, we win together. We celebrate difference as the only way to make the work that makes a difference.

4238978738,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/sales-data-analyst-at-subito-4238978738?position=15&pageNum=0&refId=uBpCfe5q2i%2B18hBlyebQZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=TwtSIDYko0Kq3AiP%2FfFUEw%3D%3D,Sales Data Analyst,Subito,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","We’re Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

We’re all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities – whether it’s a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.
What You’ll Do & Who You Are

We are seeking a Sales Data Analyst with expertise in data analysis to help optimize sales strategies and support our B2B sales team. The ideal candidate will transform platform data into actionable insights to identify business opportunities, improve sales performance, and inform strategic decision-making.
Analyze data from the company’s digital platform (user traffic, behavior, conversions, etc.) to support the sales team
Identify usage patterns and propose strategies to enhance customer value.
Develop detailed reports and dashboards to monitor sales performance based on platform data
Collaborate with product, marketing, data, and sales teams to align initiatives with insights generated from data analysis
Segment customers and analyze data to support targeted initiatives (e.g., upselling, cross-selling, retention)
Provide sales forecasts using platform data and predictive models
Monitor key performance indicators (e.g., acquisition rate, churn rate) to refine sales strategies
Automate analysis processes to improve efficiency and speed in delivering insights.
Strong ability to communicate complex data insights clearly and effectively to stakeholders
Excellent analytical thinking and attention to detail
Ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams (product, sales, marketing, data)
Adaptability and comfort in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Science, or a related field
Minimum of 3 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within digital platform or e-commerce environments
Proficiency in data analysis programming languages, preferably Python
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
Knowledge of statistical techniques for business-oriented data analysis
Experience with machine learning models for customer segmentation, churn prediction, and sales forecasting
Familiarity with cloud platforms, particularly AWS
Understanding of digital analytics and experience with web analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics)
Opportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisation
Benefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plans
Flexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computer
Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
‘Work from anywhere’ weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more
For each working day, you will be eligible for a €8 meal voucher. You will receive 250 euros on the welfare platform after the birth of your child

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don’t meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don’t meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

We’re Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

We’re all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities – whether it’s a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.

What You’ll Do &
column2:
Who You Are

We are seeking a Sales Data Analyst with expertise in data analysis to help optimize sales strategies and support our B2B sales team. The ideal candidate will transform platform data into actionable insights to identify business opportunities, improve sales performance, and inform strategic decision-making.

Key Responsibilities

  • Analyze data from the company’s digital platform (user traffic, behavior, conversions, etc.) to support the sales team
  • Identify usage patterns and propose strategies to enhance customer value.
  • Develop detailed reports and dashboards to monitor sales performance based on platform data
  • Collaborate with product, marketing, data, and sales teams to align initiatives with insights generated from data analysis
  • Segment customers and analyze data to support targeted initiatives (e.g., upselling, cross-selling, retention)
  • Provide sales forecasts using platform data and predictive models
  • Monitor key performance indicators (e.g., acquisition rate, churn rate) to refine sales strategies
  • Automate analysis processes to improve efficiency and speed in delivering insights.

Your Identikit

  • Strong ability to communicate complex data insights clearly and effectively to stakeholders
  • Excellent analytical thinking and attention to detail
  • Ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams (product, sales, marketing, data)
  • Adaptability and comfort in a fast-paced, dynamic environment

Required Skills And Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Science, or a related field
  • Minimum of 3 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within digital platform or e-commerce environments
  • Strong proficiency in SQL
  • Proficiency in data analysis programming languages, preferably Python
  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
  • Knowledge of statistical techniques for business-oriented data analysis

Nice To Have

  • Experience with machine learning models for customer segmentation, churn prediction, and sales forecasting
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms, particularly AWS
  • Understanding of digital analytics and experience with web analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics)

Benefits

  • Competitive compensation package
  • Opportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisation
  • Benefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plans
  • Flexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computer
  • Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
  • ‘Work from anywhere’ weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
  • Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more

For each working day, you will be eligible for a €8 meal voucher. You will receive 250 euros on the welfare platform after the birth of your child

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don’t meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don’t meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

Creare valore attraverso il ciclo di vita del dato, mantenendo il focus sugli obiettivi di business.

Esperienza nella creazione di report e dashboard interattivi.

Capacità di lavorare in team multidisciplinari e orientamento al raggiungimento degli obiettivi.

Retribuzione competitiva di circa 50000-55.000 EUR annui + variabile.
Ambiente lavorativo stimolante e tecnologicamente avanzato a Milano.
Opportunità di crescita professionale nel settore dei servizi finanziari.
Formazione continua per lo sviluppo di competenze specialistiche.

Se sei interessato/a a questa posizione a Milano, nel settore dei servizi finanziari, candidati ora per entrare a far parte di un team di professionisti appassionati.Fatta eccezione per il caso in cui presenti la tua candidatura per posizioni riservate a categorie protette ai sensi della Legge 68/99 (nel qual caso ti chiediamo di inserire solo conferma della tua appartenenza a tali categorie, senza alcuna ulteriore informazione relativa alla salute o disabilità), la tua candidatura non deve contenere informazioni relative al tuo stato di salute, ivi inclusa l'eventuale appartenenza a una categoria protetta, in quanto non rilevanti per la valutazione della candidatura.

  • Garantire l'allineamento con le normative e gli standard di settore.

Are you passionate about sustainability, life cycle assessment, and data-driven environmental analysis? Join the “Land Resources and Supply Chain Assessments Unit (D3)” at the Joint Research Centre (JRC) in Ispra and contribute to shaping EU policy for a sustainable future 🌍.
📊 Design, develop, and maintain data pipelines and dashboards for environmental metrics.
🔬 Conduct robust LCA studies and PEF-based environmental footprint assessments.
🧠 Provide technical input and sustainability insights for EU policy reports and initiatives.
📚 Support the creation of documentation and data-driven content for policy development.
✅ Ensure all outputs are aligned with EU environmental regulations and sustainability goals.
🎓 PhD in Environmental Science, Sustainability, or a related field with a specialization in LCA and PEF.
💡 Proficiency in Business Intelligence tools (Power BI, Tableau, QlikView).
🐍 Experience in SQL, Python, or R for data modeling and analysis.
⚙️ Skilled in LCA software (SimaPro, OpenLCA, GaBi) and familiar with ISO 14040/14044.
🇪🇺 Solid understanding of EU environmental policies and regulatory frameworks.
🤝 Strong team spirit and adaptability in international/multicultural environments.
🗣️ Ability to participate in multilingual meetings and work on complex, large-scale projects.
📝 Excellent command of English (C2 level preferred).
🔒 High degree of discretion – handling sensitive data is part of the role.
📢 Join us in making data count for a greener Europe!
Apply now and be part of a team that transforms complex environmental data into actionable insights for EU policy.

column2:
Environmental Footprint

📍 On-site – Varese, Italy

🏛️ JRC – Joint Research Centre

🕒 Full-time

🔎 About the Role

Are you passionate about sustainability, life cycle assessment, and data-driven environmental analysis? Join the “Land Resources and Supply Chain Assessments Unit (D3)” at the Joint Research Centre (JRC) in Ispra and contribute to shaping EU policy for a sustainable future 🌍.

🎯 Key Responsibilities

  • 📊 Design, develop, and maintain data pipelines and dashboards for environmental metrics.
  • 🔬 Conduct robust LCA studies and PEF-based environmental footprint assessments.
  • 🧠 Provide technical input and sustainability insights for EU policy reports and initiatives.
  • 📚 Support the creation of documentation and data-driven content for policy development.
  • ✅ Ensure all outputs are aligned with EU environmental regulations and sustainability goals.

🧠 Your Background

  • 🎓 PhD in Environmental Science, Sustainability, or a related field with a specialization in LCA and PEF.
  • 💡 Proficiency in Business Intelligence tools (Power BI, Tableau, QlikView).
  • 🐍 Experience in SQL, Python, or R for data modeling and analysis.
  • ⚙️ Skilled in LCA software (SimaPro, OpenLCA, GaBi) and familiar with ISO 14040/14044.
  • 🇪🇺 Solid understanding of EU environmental policies and regulatory frameworks.

💬 Soft Skills &
column3:
Requirements

  • 🤝 Strong team spirit and adaptability in international/multicultural environments.
  • 🗣️ Ability to participate in multilingual meetings and work on complex, large-scale projects.
  • 🚀 Proactive, autonomous, and results-oriented mindset.
  • 📝 Excellent command of English (C2 level preferred).
  • 🔒 High degree of discretion – handling sensitive data is part of the role.

📢 Join us in making data count for a greener Europe!

Apply now and be part of a team that transforms complex environmental data into actionable insights for EU policy.

4260828811,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/analista-quantitativo-dati-at-ali-professional-4260828811?position=25&pageNum=0&refId=uBpCfe5q2i%2B18hBlyebQZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=H1nTQ6XKEQpuUbEtRSsGAA%3D%3D,Analista quantitativo dati,Ali Professional,Greater Milan Metropolitan Area,"Ali Professional è alla ricerca di un/a Analista Quantitativo Dati con una solida preparazione statistica e passione per l’elaborazione e l’interpretazione dei dati. La figura sarà coinvolta in tutte le fasi del ciclo di ricerca quantitativa, dall’impostazione dei questionari alla produzione di analisi complesse e reportistica strategica.
Progettazione, revisione e ottimizzazione dei contenuti di questionari quantitativi
Digitalizzazione e gestione dei questionari tramite piattaforme dedicate (es. ID-Survey)
Definizione e implementazione di piani di campionamento, inclusa la stesura e l’applicazione di ponderazioni
Monitoraggio delle quote campionarie e verifica della qualità dei dati raccolti
Gestione, organizzazione e armonizzazione di database
column2: progettazione e manutenzione di data warehouse

column1: Esecuzione di analisi statistiche descrittive e avanzate, tra cui:
Redazione di report analitici e presentazioni tramite PowerPoint, Power BI o strumenti analoghi
Supporto alle presentazioni finali dei risultati, incluse analisi da banche dati, studi ad hoc e ricerche custom.
Laurea in Statistica, Scienze Sociali Quantitative, Economia, Data Science o simili
Esperienza pregressa in ambito ricerche di mercato, istituti di ricerca o data analysis
Ottima conoscenza di strumenti di analisi statistica (es. SPSS, R, Stata, ecc.)
Familiarità con software per survey online (preferibile esperienza con ID-Survey)
Capacità di lavorare su database complessi e di costruire data warehouse funzionali
Abilità nella visualizzazione dati e nella creazione di presentazioni efficaci
Precisione, spirito analitico e capacità di lavorare in team multidisciplinari.
Opportunità di crescita nel campo della ricerca e dell’analisi avanzata dei dati
Iniziative formative e aggiornamento continuo su metodologie e strumenti.

Ali Professional è alla ricerca di un/a Analista Quantitativo Dati con una solida preparazione statistica e passione per l’elaborazione e l’interpretazione dei dati. La figura sarà coinvolta in tutte le fasi del ciclo di ricerca quantitativa, dall’impostazione dei questionari alla produzione di analisi complesse e reportistica strategica.

Responsabilità principali:

  • Progettazione, revisione e ottimizzazione dei contenuti di questionari quantitativi

4266636870,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/customer-data-analyst-at-pwc-italy-4266636870?position=26&pageNum=0&refId=uBpCfe5q2i%2B18hBlyebQZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=7idYJXIHYIrzBdPKShHFkg%3D%3D,Customer Data Analyst,PwC Italy,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Trasforma le tue aspirazioni professionali in una storia di successo, entra in PwC come:

Ti unirai al gruppo di Customer Transformation di PwC su sfidanti progetti di Customer Advance Analytics e Data Science in ambito Consumer Markets, Financial Services, Energy&Utilities e Telco&Media, per supportare le organizzazioni nel valorizzare il patrimonio informativo sulla propria clientela, utilizzando i dati a disposizione per sviluppare soluzioni innovative basate su Machine Learning.
Grazie all’accesso alle vaste competenze del nostro network internazionale, potrai dare spazio alle tue idee e fornire il contributo innovativo che hai sempre desiderato.
Sarai Coinvolto Con Crescenti Responsabilità Nelle Seguenti Attività

Disegno, sviluppo, test e misurazione delle performance di modelli di Machine Learning e di modelli statistici in ambito Marketing: segmentazioni, Customer scoring, modelli di classificazione, modelli predittivi, modelli di propensione/raccomandazione
Analisi dati avanzate sul comportamento della clientela sia su canale fisico che digitale attraverso esplorazione di dati strutturati e destrutturati, al fine di derivare insight di business
Sviluppo di analisi quantitative e modelli di Machine Learning a supporto di progettualità di data-driven Strategy & Decision Making
Attività di targeting evoluto e valutazione quantitativo-statistica delle campagne di Marketing
Raccolta dei requisiti progettuali a diretto contatto con la clientela per il disegno e l’elaborazione di soluzioni data-driven
Stai concludendo o hai concluso il percorso di studi o possiedi una laurea magistrale preferibilmente ad indirizzo scientifico (es. Data Science, Informatica, Statistica, Matematica, Fisica)
Hai un’ottima conoscenza di almeno uno tra i linguaggi Python ed R
Possiedi una buona conoscenza dei database relazionali e del linguaggio SQL
Hai forti competenze analitiche e ti interessa usare i dati per trovare soluzioni funzionali, creative ed innovative a problemi complessi
Parli e scrivi in inglese fluentemente
Ti interessa lavorare in team e crescere in un ambiente di lavoro stimolante e positivo
Sei flessibile e hai forte motivazione ad intraprendere una carriera professionale in consulenza
Saranno considerate un plus, le conoscenze, anche a livello base di:
Framework Spark e piattaforme Cloud come Amazon Web Services, Azure e Google Cloud Platform
Artificial Intelligence in ambito Speech Analytics, Natural Language Processing o Computer Vision

Il tuo talento e la tua curiosità avranno tutto lo spazio che meritano e, attraverso l’identificazione delle migliori risorse, contribuirai a garantire la qualità dei servizi che offriamo ai nostri clienti. In questo percorso di crescita sarai accompagnato da colleghi esperti e da una formazione continua e su misura grazie alla quale potrai mettere le tue competenze a disposizione dei clienti interni.

Ci prendiamo cura delle nostre persone mettendole nelle condizioni di crescere ed esprimere al meglio il proprio potenziale. Ci impegniamo a creare valore per i clienti, le persone e la comunità, nel rispetto dell'ambiente.
GIVE YOUR LIFE A DIFFERENT PERSPECTIVE

Trasforma le tue aspirazioni professionali in una storia di successo, entra in PwC come:

Customer Data Analyst

4258311644,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/transport-data-analyst-at-ups-4258311644?position=29&pageNum=0&refId=uBpCfe5q2i%2B18hBlyebQZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=toL7DQBYIX%2FIMm37eY7RZg%3D%3D,Transport Data Analyst,UPS,"Pozzuolo Martesana, Lombardy, Italy","Prima di candidarti per un lavoro, seleziona la lingua che preferisci tra le opzioni disponibili in alto a destra in questa pagina.

Esplora la tua prossima opportunità in un'organizzazione Fortune Global 500. Immagina possibilità innovative, sperimenta la nostra gratificante cultura e lavora con team di talento che ti aiutano a migliorare ogni giorno. Sappiamo cosa serve per guidare UPS verso il futuro: persone con una combinazione unica di competenze + passione. Se hai le qualità e la motivazione per guidare te stesso o i team, abbiamo a disposizione ruoli per permetterti di coltivare le tue competenze e permetterti di progredire.

Siamo alla ricerca di un/a Transport Data Analyst appassionato/a e preciso/a, che supporti il nostro team logistico attraverso l’analisi e l’interpretazione dei dati relativi al trasporto. Il/La candidato/a ideale utilizzerà dati quantitativi per ottimizzare le operazioni di trasporto, migliorare i tempi di consegna e ridurre i costi, contribuendo ad implementare l’efficienza aziendale.
Raccogliere, consolidare ed analizzare dati relativi a spedizioni, percorsi, tempi di consegna e costi di trasporto
Effettuare analisi predittive dei volumi, in base alle stagionalità, per stabilire i mezzi e gli autisti necessari per il trasporto
Sviluppare report e dashboard per monitorare KPI logistici (es. puntualità, utilizzo mezzi, costi per spedizione) e per la condivisione dei dati nelle business reviews
Supportare il team operativo e di pianificazione con insight basati sui dati per ottimizzare rotte e carichi
Collaborare con il management per implementare le modifiche necessarie a raggiungere la riduzione dei costi e il miglioramento del servizio desiderati
Individuare criticità e proporre soluzioni data-driven per migliorare l’efficienza del trasporto, attraverso simulazioni e dati previsionali
Laurea in Statistica, Matematica, Economia, Ingegneria Gestionale o discipline affini.
Esperienza pregressa in ruoli di Data Analysis, preferibilmente nel settore logistico o dei trasporti.
Competenze informatiche avanzate (ottima conoscenza del pacchetto Office con focus su Excel, Power BI - nice to have SQL)
Capacità di interpretare grandi volumi di dati e sintetizzare informazioni complesse.
Ottime capacità analitiche e problem solving.
Attitudine proattiva e orientata al risultato.
Conoscenza della lingua inglese, almeno B2.
Ambiente dinamico e in crescita nel settore della logistica.
Opportunità di crescita professionale e formazione continua.
UPS si impegna a fornire un luogo di lavoro privo di discriminazioni, molestie e ritorsioni.

Prima di candidarti per un lavoro, seleziona la lingua che preferisci tra le opzioni disponibili in alto a destra in questa pagina.

Esplora la tua prossima opportunità in un'organizzazione Fortune Global 500. Immagina possibilità innovative, sperimenta la nostra gratificante cultura e lavora con team di talento che ti aiutano a migliorare ogni giorno. Sappiamo cosa serve per guidare UPS verso il futuro: persone con una combinazione unica di competenze + passione. Se hai le qualità e la motivazione per guidare te stesso o i team, abbiamo a disposizione ruoli per permetterti di coltivare le tue competenze e permetterti di progredire.

Descrizione Impiego

Descrizione del ruolo:

Siamo alla ricerca di un/a Transport Data Analyst appassionato/a e preciso/a, che supporti il nostro team logistico attraverso l’analisi e l’interpretazione dei dati relativi al trasporto. Il/La candidato/a ideale utilizzerà dati quantitativi per ottimizzare le operazioni di trasporto, migliorare i tempi di consegna e ridurre i costi, contribuendo ad implementare l’efficienza aziendale.

Responsabilità Principali

  • Raccogliere, consolidare ed analizzare dati relativi a spedizioni, percorsi, tempi di consegna e costi di trasporto
  • Effettuare analisi predittive dei volumi, in base alle stagionalità, per stabilire i mezzi e gli autisti necessari per il trasporto
  • Sviluppare report e dashboard per monitorare KPI logistici (es. puntualità, utilizzo mezzi, costi per spedizione) e per la condivisione dei dati nelle business reviews
  • Supportare il team operativo e di pianificazione con insight basati sui dati per ottimizzare rotte e carichi
  • Collaborare con il management per implementare le modifiche necessarie a raggiungere la riduzione dei costi e il miglioramento del servizio desiderati
  • Individuare criticità e proporre soluzioni data-driven per migliorare l’efficienza del trasporto, attraverso simulazioni e dati previsionali

Requisiti

  • Laurea in Statistica, Matematica, Economia, Ingegneria Gestionale o discipline affini.
  • Esperienza pregressa in ruoli di Data Analysis, preferibilmente nel settore logistico o dei trasporti.
  • Competenze informatiche avanzate (ottima conoscenza del pacchetto Office con focus su Excel, Power BI - nice to have SQL)
  • Capacità di interpretare grandi volumi di dati e sintetizzare informazioni complesse.
  • Ottime capacità analitiche e problem solving.
  • Attitudine proattiva e orientata al risultato.
  • Conoscenza della lingua inglese, almeno B2.

Cosa Offriamo

  • Ambiente dinamico e in crescita nel settore della logistica.
  • Opportunità di crescita professionale e formazione continua.
  • Contratto a tempo indeterminato
  • Buoni Pasto

Tipo Di Dipendente

A tempo indeterminato

UPS si impegna a fornire un luogo di lavoro privo di discriminazioni, molestie e ritorsioni.

4236864544,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/insights-and-analytics-internship-all-genders-at-sanofi-4236864544?position=30&pageNum=0&refId=uBpCfe5q2i%2B18hBlyebQZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=pV6jkXKFjJZEiwTZJqPmRg%3D%3D,Insights and Analytics Internship (All Genders),Sanofi,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Insights & Analytics Intern

Vuoi iniziare la tua carriera nel mondo HealthCare? Unisciti a Sanofi e avrai l’opportunità di crescere e sviluppare le tue competenze sotto il coordinamento di stimolanti colleghi, contribuendo a fare la differenza nella vita di migliaia di persone in tutto il mondo. Come tirocinante nel team di Insights & Analytics, sarai coinvolto/a nell'implementazione di nuovi tool analitici su PowerBI, che hanno come obiettivo di monitorare e analizzare la performance (market, adoption, brand) attraverso definiti KPI aziendali. Collaborando con i colleghi di diverse funzioni, accrescerai le tue competenze analitiche e imparerai a lavorare con il metodo KANBAN, famigliarizzando con il mondo farmaceutico e le sue dinamiche e portando attivamente il tuo contributo e le tue idee.

Siamo un'azienda della salute, innovativa e globale, e siamo guidati da uno scopo: sfidare i confini della scienza per migliorare la vita delle persone. Lavorare in Sanofi significa appassionarsi al proprio lavoro, crescere di giorno in giorno esplorando tra innumerevoli opportunità, costruire stimolanti relazioni e superare i limiti di ciò che pensavi fosse possibile. Ready to get started?
Le attività che seguirai con il tuo team
sarai coinvolto/a in attività di Project Management (PMO) a supporto del Insights & Analytics Pillar Head - Italy
supporterai i team di change management nell'organizzazione e nel coordinamento dei training da erogare ai colleghi e delle comunicazioni in merito all'utilizzo delle piattaforme
ti interfaccerai sia con i team locali sia con i team Global per la gestione e risoluzione delle segnalazioni e problematiche individuate
supporterai la generazioni di business insights e preparerai presentazioni su Power Point
contribuirai al processo di forecasting supportando i Business Analytics Lead
Laurea o laureando/a in Economia o Ingegneria gestionale
Ottimo uso di Excel e Power Point
Propensione per l'analisi e comprensione dei dati
Organizzazione e interesse per il Project Management
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese (livello B2 o superiore)
Dai vita ai miracoli della scienza entrando a far parte di un team coinvolgente e orientato al futuro
Inizia il tuo percorso professionale sotto il coordinamento di un tutor qualificato che stimolerà la tua crescita professionale e ti aiuterà a muovere i tuoi primi passi nel mondo del lavoro
Avrai l’opportunità di svolgere il tirocinio in modalità ibrida
Ti offriamo un’opportunità di tirocinio di 6 mesi. È previsto un rimborso spese competitivo e buoni pasto

Il progresso non avviene senza le persone – persone con background diversi, con origini diverse, con ruoli diversi, tutti uniti da un desiderio comune: far accadere i miracoli. Tu puoi essere una di queste persone. Segui con noi il cambiamento, abbraccia le nuove idee ed esplora tutte le opportunità che abbiamo da offrirti. Ricerchiamo il progresso e scopriamo insieme lo straordinario. In Sanofi, garantiamo pari opportunità a tutti indipendentemente da razza, colore, discendenza, religione, sesso, nazione d’origine, orientamento sessuale, età, cittadinanza, stato civile, disabilità o identità sessuale
Guarda il nostro ALL IN video e scopri le azioni di Diversity Equity and Inclusion su sanofi.com!

Join Sanofi and step into a new era of science - where your growth can be just as transformative as the work we do. We invest in you to reach further, think faster, and do what’s never-been-done-before. You’ll help push boundaries, challenge convention, and build smarter solutions that reach the communities we serve. Ready to chase the miracles of science and improve people’s lives? Let’s Pursue Progress and Discover Extraordinary – together.

At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

column3:
Analytics, sarai coinvolto/a nell'implementazione di nuovi tool analitici su PowerBI, che hanno come obiettivo di monitorare e analizzare la performance (market, adoption, brand) attraverso definiti KPI aziendali. Collaborando con i colleghi di diverse funzioni, accrescerai le tue competenze analitiche e imparerai a lavorare con il metodo KANBAN, famigliarizzando con il mondo farmaceutico e le sue dinamiche e portando attivamente il tuo contributo e le tue idee.

Siamo un'azienda della salute, innovativa e globale, e siamo guidati da uno scopo: sfidare i confini della scienza per migliorare la vita delle persone. Lavorare in Sanofi significa appassionarsi al proprio lavoro, crescere di giorno in giorno esplorando tra innumerevoli opportunità, costruire stimolanti relazioni e superare i limiti di ciò che pensavi fosse possibile. Ready to get started?

Le attività che seguirai con il tuo team

  • sarai coinvolto/a in attività di Project Management (PMO) a supporto del Insights &
column4:
Analytics Pillar Head - Italy
  • supporterai i team di change management nell'organizzazione e nel coordinamento dei training da erogare ai colleghi e delle comunicazioni in merito all'utilizzo delle piattaforme
  • ti interfaccerai sia con i team locali sia con i team Global per la gestione e risoluzione delle segnalazioni e problematiche individuate
  • supporterai la generazioni di business insights e preparerai presentazioni su Power Point
  • contribuirai al processo di forecasting supportando i Business Analytics Lead
  • imparerai a utilizzare PowerBI

    • Chi cerchiamo

    • Laurea o laureando/a in Economia o Ingegneria gestionale
column5: • Ottimo uso di Excel e Power Point
column6: • Propensione per l'analisi e comprensione dei dati
column7:
• Organizzazione e interesse per il Project Management
  • Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese (livello B2 o superiore)
  • Gradita conoscenza di PowerBI

    • Perché Sanofi?

    • Dai vita ai miracoli della scienza entrando a far parte di un team coinvolgente e orientato al futuro
    • Inizia il tuo percorso professionale sotto il coordinamento di un tutor qualificato che stimolerà la tua crescita professionale e ti aiuterà a muovere i tuoi primi passi nel mondo del lavoro
    • Avrai l’opportunità di svolgere il tirocinio in modalità ibrida
    • Ti offriamo un’opportunità di tirocinio di 6 mesi. È previsto un rimborso spese competitivo e buoni pasto

    #EarlyTalent

    Pursue Progress. Discover Extraordinary.

    Il progresso non avviene senza le persone – persone con background diversi, con origini diverse, con ruoli diversi, tutti uniti da un desiderio comune: far accadere i miracoli. Tu puoi essere una di queste persone. Segui con noi il cambiamento, abbraccia le nuove idee ed esplora tutte le opportunità che abbiamo da offrirti. Ricerchiamo il progresso e scopriamo insieme lo straordinario. In Sanofi, garantiamo pari opportunità a tutti indipendentemente da razza, colore, discendenza, religione, sesso, nazione d’origine, orientamento sessuale, età, cittadinanza, stato civile, disabilità o identità sessuale

    Guarda il nostro ALL IN video e scopri le azioni di Diversity Equity and Inclusion su sanofi.com!

    nullPursue Progress. Discover Extraordinary.

    Join Sanofi and step into a new era of science - where your growth can be just as transformative as the work we do. We invest in you to reach further, think faster, and do what’s never-been-done-before. You’ll help push boundaries, challenge convention, and build smarter solutions that reach the communities we serve. Ready to chase the miracles of science and improve people’s lives? Let’s Pursue Progress and Discover Extraordinary – together.

    At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

4267173864,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-with-power-bi-at-txt-group-4267173864?position=34&pageNum=0&refId=uBpCfe5q2i%2B18hBlyebQZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=2GbntqNVZ%2BoKqqzpEdzGfA%3D%3D,Data Analyst with Power BI,TXT GROUP,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","As part of its team expansion, FastCode S.p.A. is looking for a Data Analyst.

We are seeking a professional with at least 1 year of experience in analytics or reporting, even at the beginning of their structured career, who has a good knowledge of Power BI and is eager to grow in the areas of data visualization, reporting, and business analysis.

The selected candidate will join a team dedicated to analyzing company data and building interactive dashboards, with the aim of supporting decision-making processes through reliable analysis and effective visualizations.

The working environment is dynamic, collaborative, and constantly evolving, with continuous training, hands-on support, and opportunities for growth into roles such as data specialist or business analyst.
Create and update interactive dashboards in Power BI
Analyze data from various sources (databases, Excel files, business systems)
Collaborate with business teams to understand reporting needs and KPI measurement
Turn raw data into clear, decision-oriented visualizations
Ensure quality, consistency, and timely updates of datasets
Document analysis processes and calculation criteria
Solid command of Power BI, including Power Query, DAX, and cloud publishing
Excellent knowledge of Excel (formulas, pivot tables, charts)
Ability to process and transform datasets for analytical purposes
Understanding of key performance indicators (KPIs) and performance metrics
Experience with ETL tools or pipelines (e.g., Azure Data Factory, Talend, SSIS)
Basic knowledge of Python for data analysis (e.g., Pandas, NumPy)
Familiarity with other business intelligence tools (e.g., Tableau, Qlik)
Experience in finance, retail, or industrial sectors
Knowledge of relational databases (e.g., SQL Server, PostgreSQL)
Curiosity, observational skills, and interest in analysis
Ability to communicate effectively and make data understandable
Precision, attention to detail, and quality orientation
Proactivity and motivation for professional growth
Inclusion in an environment that values skills and professional growth
Mentorship, on-the-job training, and development of analytical capabilities
Opportunities to evolve into specialist or strategic roles
Contract and compensation based on experience
The chance to work in a fast-growing, constantly evolving company
Hybrid work model (1 day remote, 4 days onsite)

FastCode S.p.A. actively promotes an inclusive work environment that respects differences. Applications are open to all individuals, regardless of gender, in accordance with Legislative Decree 198/2006. We believe that valuing diversity and ensuring equal opportunities are key drivers of innovation and organizational well-being.

As part of its team expansion, FastCode S.p.A. is looking for a Data Analyst.

We are seeking a professional with at least 1 year of experience in analytics or reporting, even at the beginning of their structured career, who has a good knowledge of Power BI and is eager to grow in the areas of data visualization, reporting, and business analysis.

The selected candidate will join a team dedicated to analyzing company data and building interactive dashboards, with the aim of supporting decision-making processes through reliable analysis and effective visualizations.

The working environment is dynamic, collaborative, and constantly evolving, with continuous training, hands-on support, and opportunities for growth into roles such as data specialist or business analyst.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Create and update interactive dashboards in Power BI
  • Analyze data from various sources (databases, Excel files, business systems)
  • Collaborate with business teams to understand reporting needs and KPI measurement
  • Turn raw data into clear, decision-oriented visualizations
  • Ensure quality, consistency, and timely updates of datasets
  • Document analysis processes and calculation criteria


Required Technical Skills:

  • Solid command of Power BI, including Power Query, DAX, and cloud publishing
  • Knowledge of SQL (basic/intermediate level)
  • Excellent knowledge of Excel (formulas, pivot tables, charts)
  • Ability to process and transform datasets for analytical purposes
  • Understanding of key performance indicators (KPIs) and performance metrics


Preferred Technical Skills:

  • Experience with ETL tools or pipelines (e.g., Azure Data Factory, Talend, SSIS)
  • Basic knowledge of Python for data analysis (e.g., Pandas, NumPy)
  • Familiarity with other business intelligence tools (e.g., Tableau, Qlik)
  • Experience in finance, retail, or industrial sectors
  • Knowledge of relational databases (e.g., SQL Server, PostgreSQL)


Soft Skills Required:

  • Curiosity, observational skills, and interest in analysis
  • Ability to communicate effectively and make data understandable
  • Precision, attention to detail, and quality orientation
  • Proactivity and motivation for professional growth
  • Teamwork and cross-functional collaboration skills


What We Offer:

  • Inclusion in an environment that values skills and professional growth
  • Mentorship, on-the-job training, and development of analytical capabilities
  • Opportunities to evolve into specialist or strategic roles
  • Contract and compensation based on experience


Why Choose FastCode:

  • The chance to work in a fast-growing, constantly evolving company
  • A young, international team environment
  • Training aligned with job-related activities
  • Corporate benefits (Health Insurance, Meal Vouchers)
  • Hybrid work model (1 day remote, 4 days onsite)


FastCode S.p.A. actively promotes an inclusive work environment that respects differences. Applications are open to all individuals, regardless of gender, in accordance with Legislative Decree 198/2006. We believe that valuing diversity and ensuring equal opportunities are key drivers of innovation and organizational well-being.
