4248794872,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-stage-extracurriculare-at-publicis-groupe-4248794872?position=35&pageNum=0&refId=uBpCfe5q2i%2B18hBlyebQZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=2Gu%2BeijQtUZlF1HwGnCIDw%3D%3D,Data Analyst - stage extracurriculare,Publicis Groupe,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Descrizione dell'azienda

Fondata nel 1926 da Marcel Bleustein-Blanchet, Publicis Groupe è oggi il primo gruppo di comunicazione al mondo. Presente in Italia con tre sedi - Milano, Torino e Roma - e oltre 1500 professionisti, il Gruppo agisce come partner strategico per la crescita dei propri clienti, offrendo un’ampia gamma di competenze e soluzioni integrate nelle aree della creatività, media, produzione e business transformation.
La/Il Data Analyst - stage extracurriculare farà parte del Team Buying e fornirà supporto nella gestione dei dati di tutte le campagne media delle agenzie.
Raccogliere, elaborare e analizzare grandi quantità di dati provenienti da diverse fonti (CRM, campagne digitali, social media, ecc.)
Supportare il team nella creazione di reportistica chiara e dettagliata per il monitoraggio delle performance
Collaborare con i team di marketing e comunicazione per fornire insight utili a migliorare le strategie di business
Utilizzare strumenti di data visualization (Power BI) per rappresentare i dati in modo efficace
Contribuire all’automazione dei processi di raccolta e analisi dati
Mantenersi aggiornato sulle tecnologie e best practice di data analysis
Laurea in Statistica, Economia, Matematica, Informatica, Data Science o discipline affini (in corso o appena conseguita)
Buona conoscenza di Excel e strumenti di analisi dati
Familiarità con strumenti di visualizzazione dati (Power BI)
Precisione, attenzione ai dettagli e capacità di lavorare in team
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese, sia scritta che parlata
Interesse per il mondo del marketing e della comunicazione
Benefit aziendali: una piattaforma dedicata alle nostre persone, ricca di offerte, sconti e molto altro
Formazione e Sviluppo: un percorso formativo su misura, un approccio individuale e basato sulle esigenze, sempre attivo!
Benessere aziendale: accesso gratuito a corsi online per il tuo benessere fisico e psicologico.

Sapevi che il nostro motto è ""Viva la différence""? Con o senza D.Lgs. 198/2006, non vediamo l'ora di incontrarti e darti il benvenuto. Scopri di più su Publicis Groupe Italia e sui nostri valori sulla nostra pagina ufficiale Instagram qui.

Descrizione dell'azienda

Publicis Groupe

Fondata nel 1926 da Marcel Bleustein-Blanchet, Publicis Groupe è oggi il primo gruppo di comunicazione al mondo. Presente in Italia con tre sedi - Milano, Torino e Roma - e oltre 1500 professionisti, il Gruppo agisce come partner strategico per la crescita dei propri clienti, offrendo un’ampia gamma di competenze e soluzioni integrate nelle aree della creatività, media, produzione e business transformation.

Panoramica

La/Il Data Analyst - stage extracurriculare farà parte del Team Buying e fornirà supporto nella gestione dei dati di tutte le campagne media delle agenzie.

Responsabilità

  • Raccogliere, elaborare e analizzare grandi quantità di dati provenienti da diverse fonti (CRM, campagne digitali, social media, ecc.)
  • Supportare il team nella creazione di reportistica chiara e dettagliata per il monitoraggio delle performance
  • Collaborare con i team di marketing e comunicazione per fornire insight utili a migliorare le strategie di business
  • Utilizzare strumenti di data visualization (Power BI) per rappresentare i dati in modo efficace
  • Contribuire all’automazione dei processi di raccolta e analisi dati
  • Mantenersi aggiornato sulle tecnologie e best practice di data analysis

Qualifiche

  • Laurea in Statistica, Economia, Matematica, Informatica, Data Science o discipline affini (in corso o appena conseguita)
  • Buona conoscenza di Excel e strumenti di analisi dati
  • Familiarità con strumenti di visualizzazione dati (Power BI)
  • Capacità analitiche e problem solving
  • Precisione, attenzione ai dettagli e capacità di lavorare in team
  • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese, sia scritta che parlata
  • Interesse per il mondo del marketing e della comunicazione

Informazioni aggiuntive

  • Flessibilità: orari flessibili e smartworking

4267734086,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-bending-spoons-4267734086?position=39&pageNum=0&refId=uBpCfe5q2i%2B18hBlyebQZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=wX8%2BTFO%2BHW2VWn9MPeta%2Bw%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Bending Spoons,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","At Bending Spoons, we’re striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.

To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform—which comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor’s attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.

For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That’s our promise to such a candidate.
A few examples of your responsibilities
Collaborate with Product and Business teams to determine the most pressing questions that big data can help answer, and then figure out how to uncover those insights.
Query and analyze massive sets of usage data to identify product-improvement opportunities and actionable insights to profoundly impact our product strategy and roadmap.
Create brief, high-quality reports to explain your findings and discuss their implications with the relevant team members.
Screen the app stores and study competing products in search of insights and ideas we could learn from.
Help direct the development of our technologies devoted to the acquisition, storage, and manipulation of big data, supporting our efforts to constantly break new ground in this field.

Reasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.

Drive. You’re extremely ambitious in everything you do—and your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high—and rising—bar.

Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You’re reliable, honest, and transparent.
Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.
Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You’ll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.

An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential—then, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you’ve got what it takes, you’ll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.

Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of £66,779 in the UK and €63,965 elsewhere. If they possess a few years of relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between £110,389 and £149,636 in the UK, and €105,737 and €143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.

All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.
Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time or part-time.

Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: We're extremely ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. While this tends to lead to fantastic learning, achievements, and career growth, it also requires a significant commitment. So if you like the role and are ready to give your very best, don't hesitate to apply.
If you pass our screening, we’ll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you’re successful with those, we’ll invite you to a series of interviews.

Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested through this form.

Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn’t a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

At Bending Spoons, we’re striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.

To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform—which comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor’s attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.

For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That’s our promise to such a candidate.

A few examples of your responsibilities
  • Collaborate with Product and Business teams to determine the most pressing questions that big data can help answer, and then figure out how to uncover those insights.
  • Query and analyze massive sets of usage data to identify product-improvement opportunities and actionable insights to profoundly impact our product strategy and roadmap.
  • Create brief, high-quality reports to explain your findings and discuss their implications with the relevant team members.
  • Screen the app stores and study competing products in search of insights and ideas we could learn from.
  • Help direct the development of our technologies devoted to the acquisition, storage, and manipulation of big data, supporting our efforts to constantly break new ground in this field.

What we look for
  • Reasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.
  • Drive. You’re extremely ambitious in everything you do—and your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high—and rising—bar.
  • Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You’re reliable, honest, and transparent.
  • Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.

What we offer
  • Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You’ll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
  • An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential—then, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you’ve got what it takes, you’ll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
  • Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of £66,779 in the UK and €63,965 elsewhere. If they possess a few years of relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between £110,389 and £149,636 in the UK, and €105,737 and €143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
  • All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.

column1: <icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 9l5.93-4L15 6.54l-6.15 4.2a1.5 1.5 0 01-1.69 0L1 6.54 2.07 5z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

We want to innovate the financial services offered by commercial/retail banks in Italy in the areas of wealth management, credit lending, risk management and compliance. Building on our consolidated expertise and product offering in the Capital Markets domain, we want to scale our solutions and frameworks to the commercial/retail banking industry. To do so, we start from the quantitative modelling and analysis of the current processes put in place by our customers, so that we can profile opportunities of automation and prioritize client needs on manual/painful workflows. The resource will be involved in business process analyses of Italian commercial/retail financial institutions and is expected to integrate structured information extracted from interviews with the analysis of literature and documentation to build a quantitative picture of the AS-IS. The analysis will then be complemented with a consequent implementation analysis and product roadmap definition to design the TO-BE and drive product evolutions and developments. The project entails modelling complex business contexts, extracting structured information from unstructured sources, performing quantitative analyses, presenting findings and recommendations to external clients and internal stakeholders, contributing to the definition of product backlogs.
What You Will Learn During Your Intern
Codification of customer requirements, needs, activities
Business intelligence with PowerBI/Excel - Packaging high-quality deliverables for external clients –
Data manipulation with Pandas or Spark/Hive
Hands-on experience with BI tools (Excel, PowerBI)
Experience with Python data science libraries (pandas, pyspark, sklearn) is nice to have
We Are Looking For Someone Who
is passionate about modelling unknown business contexts with a quantitative approach
can find a good trade-off between quality and speed of delivery
proactively contribute your insights and ideas in a way that fits existing frameworks of the firm
is fond of sharing knowledge with colleagues and documenting your work

At ION

We want to innovate the financial services offered by commercial/retail banks in Italy in the areas of wealth management, credit lending, risk management and compliance. Building on our consolidated expertise and product offering in the Capital Markets domain, we want to scale our solutions and frameworks to the commercial/retail banking industry. To do so, we start from the quantitative modelling and analysis of the current processes put in place by our customers, so that we can profile opportunities of automation and prioritize client needs on manual/painful workflows. The resource will be involved in business process analyses of Italian commercial/retail financial institutions and is expected to integrate structured information extracted from interviews with the analysis of literature and documentation to build a quantitative picture of the AS-IS. The analysis will then be complemented with a consequent implementation analysis and product roadmap definition to design the TO-BE and drive product evolutions and developments. The project entails modelling complex business contexts, extracting structured information from unstructured sources, performing quantitative analyses, presenting findings and recommendations to external clients and internal stakeholders, contributing to the definition of product backlogs.

What You Will Learn During Your Intern

  • Quantitative modelling of business processes
  • Codification of customer requirements, needs, activities
  • Business intelligence with PowerBI/Excel - Packaging high-quality deliverables for external clients –
  • Data manipulation with Pandas or Spark/Hive

What You Need To Know

  • Hands-on experience with BI tools (Excel, PowerBI)
  • Experience with Python data science libraries (pandas, pyspark, sklearn) is nice to have
  • Fluent English

We Are Looking For Someone Who

  • is passionate about modelling unknown business contexts with a quantitative approach
  • can find a good trade-off between quality and speed of delivery
  • proactively contribute your insights and ideas in a way that fits existing frameworks of the firm
  • is fond of sharing knowledge with colleagues and documenting your work

4265237859,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-marketing-growth-italy-they-she-he-at-glovo-4265237859?position=41&pageNum=0&refId=uBpCfe5q2i%2B18hBlyebQZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=3miN%2FjrGOeV4SKRdg8DDdg%3D%3D,Data Analyst Marketing & Growth - Italy (They/She/He),Glovo,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.
A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.
We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.
🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good.
We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.
Understand business needs and create insightful analysis helping your team to make the right decisions to boost Glovo presence and orders

Identify growth opportunities to increase our user base focusing on traffic, conversion and retention rates and leveraging on levers such as pricing, promotions, events, CRM and other marketing levers etc
Drive projects end-to-end translating business challenges into insights and actions
Identify growth opportunities to increase our user base, step change retention rates and maximize profitability
Take ownership of the reporting of KPIs by creating customized tools and using the available ones
Ensure these tools are scalable and up-to-date
Assist your colleagues in gaining access to the right data, and communicate and simplify concepts to the audience's needs
Drive clarity and solve ambiguity using data-driven approaches

Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how our users interact with both our consumer and business products, identify growth opportunities, and execute projects to drive growth and engagement
What You Will Bring To The Ride
1-3 years of work experience on analytical roles leading analysis and turning insights into actions
Bachelor's degree in Math, Engineering, Business, Stats, Quantitative field or Business
SQL proficiency is mandatory / Python is a plus
Ninja expertise with Excel / Google Sheets is a must
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau and Looker
Business acumen and passion for end-to-end project management (from ideation and analysis into implementation)
A hands-on attitude is a must. You’ll have to roll up your sleeves!

Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.
💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.
Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).
So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?
Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

🤝 Our culture and strong values.

💪 Our career development philosophy.

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

  • Understand business needs and create insightful analysis helping your team to make the right decisions to boost Glovo presence and orders
  • Identify growth opportunities to increase our user base focusing on traffic, conversion and retention rates and leveraging on levers such as pricing, promotions, events, CRM and other marketing levers etc
  • Drive projects end-to-end translating business challenges into insights and actions
  • Identify growth opportunities to increase our user base, step change retention rates and maximize profitability
  • Take ownership of the reporting of KPIs by creating customized tools and using the available ones
  • Ensure these tools are scalable and up-to-date
  • Assist your colleagues in gaining access to the right data, and communicate and simplify concepts to the audience's needs
  • Drive clarity and solve ambiguity using data-driven approaches
  • Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how our users interact with both our consumer and business products, identify growth opportunities, and execute projects to drive growth and engagement

What You Will Bring To The Ride

  • 1-3 years of work experience on analytical roles leading analysis and turning insights into actions
  • Bachelor's degree in Math, Engineering, Business, Stats, Quantitative field or Business
  • SQL proficiency is mandatory / Python is a plus
  • Ninja expertise with Excel / Google Sheets is a must
  • Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau and Looker
  • Business acumen and passion for end-to-end project management (from ideation and analysis into implementation)
  • A hands-on attitude is a must. You’ll have to roll up your sleeves!
  • Proficiency in English
  • Strong consumer understanding skills

Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves

  • 💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
  • 🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
  • 🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
  • 👪 Enhanced parental leave.
  • 🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Da più di 20 anni combiniamo intelligenza umana e artificiale per trasformare ogni contatto in un’opportunità di valore. Le persone sono il focus dei nostri progetti e della nostra quotidianità. Creiamo quindi un ambiente di lavoro aperto e collaborativo, in cui far emergere ogni potenzialità, condividendo competenze ed esperienze.
Raggiungiamo insieme obiettivi d’eccellenza, sostenibili e innovativi, lasciando un impatto positivo nei territori in cui operiamo.
Stiamo cercando un Data Analyst, da inserire all’interno della nostra Service Line CRM Marketing Automation & Data Driven, per i nostri uffici di Milano/Parma/Piacenza e Roma/Napoli.
Ti confronterai con i Clienti per tradurre le esigenze di business in obiettivi analitici
Gestirai, manipolerai ed esplorarerai set complessi di dati strutturati e non strutturati
Estrarrai insight significativi dai risultati delle proprie analisi esplorative e predittive e applicarle ai processi di business per migliorarne l’efficacia e l’efficienza
Da 2 a 4 anni di esperienza nel ruolo preferibilmente in altre società di consulenza e/o aziende
Ottima conoscenza di piattaforme BI e di visualizzazione (MS Power BI, Tableau, Qlik, etc.) e relativi processi di amministrazione, configurazione e gestione
Buona conoscenza delle principali architetture di Data Management e SQL e PL/SQL
Buona conoscenza di soluzioni data intelligence in contesti hyperscaler (GCP, AWS, etc.)
Esperienza con linguaggi di programmazione analitici (R, Python)
Ottima padronanza di strumenti di produttività per effettuare analisi e presentazioni efficaci (Excel, Powerpoint, etc.)
Un percorso di crescita volto alla valorizzazione della tua professionalità
Ambiente di lavoro dinamico e internazionale, costituito da team di progetto eterogenei e possibilità di ampliare le proprie conoscenze multi-industry e sulle tecnologie più innovative del mercato
Opportunità formative interne ed esterne con possibilità di ottenere certificazioni professionali in base al ruolo

4236190640,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-capabilities-insight-analyst-at-mckinsey-company-4236190640?position=45&pageNum=0&refId=uBpCfe5q2i%2B18hBlyebQZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=hActBC5w%2FCrnjTTqn7fs8w%3D%3D,Junior Capabilities & Insight Analyst,McKinsey & Company,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Who You'll Work With

Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.

In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues—at all levels—will invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you'll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won’t find anywhere else.
When you join us, you will have:

Continuous learning: Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.

A voice that matters: From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You’ll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.

Global community: With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm’s diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.

World-class benefits: On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package to enable holistic well-being for you and your family.

You will support consultants and clients developing capabilities to gain insights to solve specific client business problems and will leverage your experience in research to be a thought-partner to teams and clients.

In this role, you will prioritize research activities to make a change that matters. You will develop with time industry knowledge and expertise in various sectors and business functions. You’ll also collaborate with our global research team to share and build knowledge, best practices and relevant new ideas. You will develop knowledge and help support the continuous improvement of our knowledge assets, innovating firm knowledge and delivery through special projects, both with client teams and on a stand-alone basis.
The type of contract and the level of role will depend on your experience and qualifications. Internship contract will be available as well.
You will be based in our Milan office as part of Milan Client Capability Network team.

The Milan Client Capabilities Network is part of the geographic research and knowledge group with analysts covering the main sectors of activity for McKinsey in Italy. The Client Capabilities Network is a global network, which includes more than 7000 research and knowledge professionals who work alongside our consultants and clients to generate distinctive insights and proprietary knowledge.

When you join McKinsey, you will be part of global community of colleagues with diverse backgrounds and expertise who are all working to create positive, sustainable and inclusive growth. We will accelerate your development as a leader to create positive, enduring change in the world.
Master's degree in economics or business engineering with record of strong academic achievement
Interest in research type of work
Up to 1 year of work experience
column2: recent graduates with relevant internship experience will be considered

column1: Demonstrated research experience in an academic or business setting is a plus
Understanding of financial, economic and general business concepts and terminology
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (e.g. Word, Excel and PowerPoint) and knowledge of information providers (Bloomberg, Capital IQ etc.)
Ability to work well in a team setting and across all levels within an organization
Skills to communicate complex ideas effectively in both English and Italian

Who You'll Work With

Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.

In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues—at all levels—will invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you'll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won’t find anywhere else.

When you join us, you will have:

  • Continuous learning: Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
  • A voice that matters: From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You’ll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
  • Global community: With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm’s diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
  • World-class benefits: On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package to enable holistic well-being for you and your family.

Your Impact

You will support consultants and clients developing capabilities to gain insights to solve specific client business problems and will leverage your experience in research to be a thought-partner to teams and clients.

In this role, you will prioritize research activities to make a change that matters. You will develop with time industry knowledge and expertise in various sectors and business functions. You’ll also collaborate with our global research team to share and build knowledge, best practices and relevant new ideas. You will develop knowledge and help support the continuous improvement of our knowledge assets, innovating firm knowledge and delivery through special projects, both with client teams and on a stand-alone basis.

The type of contract and the level of role will depend on your experience and qualifications. Internship contract will be available as well.

You will be based in our Milan office as part of Milan Client Capability Network team.

The Milan Client Capabilities Network is part of the geographic research and knowledge group with analysts covering the main sectors of activity for McKinsey in Italy. The Client Capabilities Network is a global network, which includes more than 7000 research and knowledge professionals who work alongside our consultants and clients to generate distinctive insights and proprietary knowledge.

When you join McKinsey, you will be part of global community of colleagues with diverse backgrounds and expertise who are all working to create positive, sustainable and inclusive growth. We will accelerate your development as a leader to create positive, enduring change in the world.

Your Qualifications and Skills

  • Master's degree in economics or business engineering with record of strong academic achievement
  • Interest in research type of work
  • Up to 1 year of work experience

  • Understanding of financial, economic and general business concepts and terminology
  • Problem-solving and analytical skills
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (e.g. Word, Excel and PowerPoint) and knowledge of information providers (Bloomberg, Capital IQ etc.)
  • Ability to work well in a team setting and across all levels within an organization
  • Skills to communicate complex ideas effectively in both English and Italian

Presente con oltre 25 sedi dirette nel mondo, il Gruppo impiega oltre 1500 persone tra dipendenti diretti e collaboratori che vivono una realtà di respiro internazionale, giovane, dinamica e in costante crescita dove la tradizione si fonde con l’innovazione.

Italmondo Spa, fondata nel 1953, Headquarter del Gruppo ITLM con sede ad Arluno (MI), è leader in Italia e in Europa nel settore dei trasporti e della logistica integrata da 70 anni.


Italmondo è il cuore di un gruppo multimodale che eroga una molteplicità di servizi a valore aggiunto (logistica integrata, trasporto su gomma, marittimo e aereo, soluzioni di e-logistics e di e-commerce, consulenza digitale) ed opera in Europa, Nord Africa ed Est Asiatico


Presente con oltre 25 sedi dirette nel mondo, il Gruppo impiega oltre 1500 persone tra dipendenti diretti e collaboratori che vivono una realtà di respiro internazionale, giovane, dinamica e in costante crescita dove la tradizione si fonde con l’innovazione.


Siamo alla ricerca di una risorsa junior motivata e curiosa da inserire nel nostro team Processi.


La risorsa ideale ha una formazione in Ingegneria Gestionale o discipline affini, con interesse per l'analisi e l’ottimizzazione dei processi aziendali.


Il ruolo:

  • Supporto nell’analisi dei dati per individuare aree di miglioramento nei flussi operativi
  • Partecipazione al ridisegno dei processi aziendali, in collaborazione con i team operativi
  • Mappatura dei processi, stesura di procedure e documentazione operativa
  • Supporto alla creazione di presentazioni efficaci e materiali formativi chiari e strutturati per la diffusione interna delle procedure
  • Collaborazione a progetti di miglioramento continuo, contribuendo con idee e soluzioni concrete


Requisiti:

  • Laurea in Ingegneria Gestionale, Economia o affini
  • Interesse per i temi di organizzazione aziendale e ottimizzazione dei processi
  • Ottima padronanza di Excel, PowerPoint e capacità di creare presentazioni chiare e professionali
  • Esperienza (anche accademica) nella redazione di manuali operativi o materiali formativi
  • Conoscenza base (preferibile) delle metodologie Lean, Kaizen o Six Sigma
  • Attitudine analitica, precisione, autonomia e voglia di imparare


Cosa offriamo:

  • Un ambiente dinamico e collaborativo
  • Affiancamento da parte di figure esperte e formazione on-the-job
  • Opportunità di contribuire concretamente al miglioramento dei processi aziendali
  • Possibilità di sviluppare competenze tecniche e comunicative trasversali


Se cambiamento, efficienza e formazione sono i tuoi fattori guida, potresti essere la persona che cerchiamo.

4255717994,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/consumer-marketing-insights-data-analyst-intern-at-bolton-4255717994?position=49&pageNum=0&refId=uBpCfe5q2i%2B18hBlyebQZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=Z5NPcz5eg9G%2FQLUWfUrS1Q%3D%3D,Consumer & Marketing Insights Data Analyst Intern,Bolton,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Bolton Home & Personal Care
Consumer & Marketing Insights Data Analyst Intern

Siamo alla ricerca di una risorsa da inserire come CMI Data Analyst intern da inserire nella funzione Consumer and Market Insights nella nostra Business Unit Home & Personale Care, divisione Home Care, con sede a Milano.

La tua capacità di analizzare e interpretare dati complessi provenienti da diverse fonti sarà essenziale per fornire insights strategici che aiuteranno i team di Marketing, Trade Marketing e Sales a prendere decisioni informate. Contribuirai a migliorare la comprensione delle dinamiche di mercato e del comportamento dei consumatori, giocando un ruolo cruciale nell'identificazione di opportunità di crescita e nell'ottimizzazione delle strategie commerciali. La tua attenzione ai dettagli e la tua abilità nel tradurre i dati in presentazioni chiare ed efficaci ti permetteranno di facilitare la comunicazione interna e influenzare positivamente le decisioni aziendali.

Sarai responsabile dell'analisi quotidiana dei dati di vendita al dettaglio e dei consumatori, estraendo informazioni chiave da fonti come Nielsen, GfK o Euromonitor. Questi insights ti aiuteranno a generare report che faciliteranno decisioni strategiche per i team interni.

Creerai presentazioni in PowerPoint per comunicare i risultati delle tue analisi ai team di Marketing, Trade Marketing e Sales, garantendo che le informazioni siano trasmesse in modo chiaro ed efficace.

Fornirai supporto operativo ai team rispondendo a specifiche domande di business attraverso l'estrazione e l'analisi dei dati, oltre ad assistere con compiti amministrativi come gli ordini di acquisto.
Riporterai direttamente al Consumer and Market Insights Manager nella divisione Home Care.
Che Cosa Ti Rende Un Buon Fit
Hai una laurea specialistica, o triennale seguita da un master, in Economia, Statistica, Management
Hai un’ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese
Hai un’ottima conoscenza del pacchetto Office e di Excel e buone doti analitiche
Proattività, autonomia, forte orientamento al risultato e capacità di lavorare in un contesto dinamico sono soft skills che ti contraddistinguono
Hai eccellenti capacità comunicative e relazionali
Sede di Lavoro: Milano, Via Pirelli
Orario di lavoro: Full Time con opzione smart working
Curioso di conoscerci? Scopri di più:

Bolton è un'azienda italiana a conduzione familiare, specializzata nel settore dei beni di consumo, che conta 10.500 dipendenti distribuiti in 60 uffici, 17 stabilimenti produttivi, 10 laboratori di ricerca e sviluppo e 14 pescherecci in tutto il mondo. Con un portafoglio diversificato di oltre 60 marchi di qualità, Bolton ha arricchito la vita di milioni di persone ogni giorno per più di 75 anni, rendendo la loro quotidianità più deliziosa, più piacevole, utile e bella.

Bolton Home & Personal Care ha una missione unica: aiutare le persone a prendersi cura delle loro case e dei loro corpi. Attraverso marchi noti e amati da milioni di persone, come Winni’s e Chilly, Bolton rende la vita quotidiana più piacevole, pulita, fresca e bella. La Business Unit è pienamente impegnata nello sviluppo sostenibile con particolare attenzione alla circolarità e all'approvvigionamento delle materie prime.
We are looking for a CMI Data Analyst intern to join the Consumer and Market Insights function within our Home & Personal Care Business Unit, Home Care division, based in Milan.

Your ability to analyze and interpret complex data from various sources will be essential in providing strategic insights that will help the Marketing, Trade Marketing, and Sales teams make informed decisions. You will contribute to improving the understanding of market dynamics and consumer behavior, playing a crucial role in identifying growth opportunities and optimizing business strategies. Your attention to detail and skill in translating data into clear and effective presentations will enable you to facilitate internal communication and positively influence business decisions.

You will be responsible for the daily analysis of retail sales and consumer data, extracting key insights from sources such as Nielsen, GfK, or Euromonitor. These insights will help you generate reports that facilitate strategic decisions for internal teams.
You will create PowerPoint presentations to communicate the results of your analyses to the Marketing, Trade Marketing, and Sales teams, ensuring that information is conveyed clearly and effectively.

You will provide operational support to the teams by answering specific business questions through data extraction and analysis, as well as assisting with administrative tasks such as purchase orders.
You will report directly to the Consumer and Market Insights Manager in the Home Care division.
What Makes You a Great Fit
You have a master's degree or a bachelor's degree followed by a master's in Economics, Statistics, or Management.
You have an excellent command of the English language.
You have strong knowledge of the Office suite and Excel, along with good analytical skills.
Proactivity, autonomy, a strong results orientation, and the ability to work in a dynamic environment are your distinguishing soft skills.
You possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Remote Working: Standard business hours with remote working options available

Bolton is an Italian family-owned fast-moving consumer goods company with 10.500 people located across 60 offices, 17 production facilities, 10 R&D laboratories, and 14 fishing vessels worldwide. With a diverse portfolio of over 60 quality brands, Bolton has been enriching the lives of millions of people every day for more than 75 years, making their everyday more delicious, more enjoyable, useful, and beautiful.

Bolton Home & Personal Care is a Business Unit of Bolton with a single mission: help people take care of their homes and bodies. Through well-known brands that are loved by millions, such as Winni's and Chilly, they make everyday lives more enjoyable, cleaner, fresher and more beautiful. The Business Unit is fully committed to sustainable development with a particular focus on circularity and sourcing raw materials.
Grow Your Future with Us, Apply now

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

Per la nostra sede di Milano (Piazza Trento) siamo alla ricerca di una risorsa da inserire all’interno della struttura Portfolio Planning e Indagini Autorità all'interno della Direzione Sales Planning, Contract Management & Certification.

A2A Energia. Società del Gruppo A2A che fornisce energia a oltre 2,5 milioni di clienti, costantemente ai vertici delle rilevazioni nazionali per il livello di soddisfazione. Presenza costante per i cittadini, in casa e nella città, porta nel loro mondo comfort e servizi innovativi per favorire l’efficienza energetica e la mobilità elettrica. Si impegna ogni giorno per offrire un servizio di qualità, che risponda alle esigenze più diverse, dal singolo alla grande azienda.
Analizzare le richieste di dati provenienti dalle Autorità di regolazione, in particolare da ARERA, e organizzare le attività necessarie per la loro corretta gestione e finalizzazione
Gestire in modo proattivo le richieste di ARERA, collaborando con le strutture interne di A2A Energia, A2A Spa e in particolare con l’area Regolazione
Estrarre ed elaborare i dati richiesti per le raccolte ufficiali, garantendo accuratezza e tempestività

A fronte di evoluzioni normative, formulare i requisiti business verso i Fornitori IT per l’evoluzione degli applicativi utilizzati per l’elaborazione di determinati dati, seguendo l’iter di approvazione BBP, test UAT e rilascio in produzione
Contribuire alla gestione dell’approvvigionamento di Energia Elettrica, Gas e Garanzie d’origine di A2A Energia attraverso la gestione dei flussi massivi verso gli Uffici di Trading della Capogruppo
Supporto nella produzione di reportistiche periodiche verso le Strutture di A2A Energia
Sei la persona giusta se ti riconosci in questo profilo
Laurea in discipline economiche, ingegneria o titolo di studio equivalente
Competenze analitiche nell’elaborazione ed interpretazione dei dati
Conoscenza avanzata del pacchetto Office (in particolare Excel/Power Point)
Rappresenta un plus l’esperienza pregressa di 1-2 anni nel campo dell’analisi dati in aziende del settore Energy/Utility o in aziende di consulenza per clienti finali in questi settori
Rappresenta un plus la conoscenza degli applicativi Qlik View, Qlik Sense, Google Cloud Platform, Power BI o altri applicativi di BI

Completano il profilo: flessibilità, dinamicità, orientamento al teamworking, capacità relazionali con stakeholder interni ed esterni, concretezza e spirito collaborativo, problem solving, proattività e iniziativa, autonomia, gestione dello stress e delle priorità, capacità di analisi e di pianificazione/organizzazione del lavoro.
Flessibilità: settimana lavorativa con venerdì a orario ridotto, flessibilità negli orari di entrata/uscita e pausa pranzo
column2: Smartworking sino al 60% dell’orario di lavoro su base bimestrale

column1: Salute e benessere: assistenza sanitaria integrativa, supporto psicologico attraverso counseling, webinar dedicati al benessere psicofisico e vaccino antinfluenzale

Famiglia: A2A Life Caring, iniziativa a supporto della genitorialità attraverso un mese aggiuntivo retribuito al 100% per maternità/paternità, rimborsi spese per figli, convenzioni con asili nido, team coaching per neogenitori
column2: spazio caregiver, offriamo webinar e uno spazio di ascolto dedicati a chi si prende cura di persone fragili o non autosufficienti

column1: Formazione e sviluppo: programma di induction dedicato ai nuovi assunti, gestione dei talenti, corsi di formazione e possibilità di crescita interna e job rotation tramite candidatura interna

Risparmio e tempo libero: oltre 300 convenzioni, tra cui trasporti pubblici, attività sportive, viaggi, eventi culturali, e offerte speciali per luce e gas. Opzioni per il car sharing e la conversione del premio di risultato in benefit di welfare
Ambiente di lavoro: promuoviamo una cultura che valorizza la diversità, l’equità e l'inclusione (DE&I)
column2: potrai inoltre avere la possibilità di unirti a un team dedicato allo sviluppo di iniziative e progetti su queste tematiche. Sosteniamo l'evoluzione tecnologica e offriamo strumenti e risorse per promuovere il lavoro digitale.

column1: Scopri di più sul Gruppo a2a
Ascolta “Accanto”, il Podcast che racconta cosa significa oggi lavorare in A2A  https://t.ly/pRaU4
Per conoscere il nostro processo di selezione e prepararti al meglio al colloquio
Consigli per l’iter di selezione   https://t.ly/N6pil

Sei la persona giusta? Leggi l’annuncio e aiutaci a conoscerti inviandoci il tuo curriculum.
Il contesto di cui farai parte

Kepleria si configura così come uno dei principali player italiani in questo settore, azienda appartenente ad Altea Federation con una profonda esperienza pluriennale in progetti di Data Management, Business Intelligence e Planning

Attraverso strumenti avanzati di elaborazione dei dati, accompagna i propri clienti nel viaggio per diventare “data driven company”. Tramite soluzioni Analytics, expertise di industry e processo, utilizza le tecnologie più solide e innovative per estrarre valore dai dati e metterli a disposizione a tutti i livelli dell’organizzazione, al fine di liberare nuove potenzialità e orientare le decisioni in un’ottica ispirata alla massima efficacia ed efficienza, oltre che al cost-saving.
Ogni progetto di trasformazione digitale intrapreso utilizza modelli di business agili, sostenibili e adattivi.

Siamo una FREE PLACE COMPANY, quindi operiamo da dove è più opportuno lavorare (casa, ufficio, cliente), in funzione degli obiettivi da perseguire, condividendoli con i propri riferimenti di progetto o di unità organizzativa.
3 cose che devi sapere in 3 hashtag
Sarai impiegato, all’interno di un team di specialisti Microsoft e collocato in una delle sedi italiane di Altea Federation, nello sviluppo di soluzioni basate su tecnologia Power BI.
diffusione in azienda delle cultura del dato
modellare e implementare i requisiti funzionali forniti
fornire supporto al cliente nel processo di adozione di Power BI
disegno report e visualizzazioni grafiche navigabili
relazionarsi attivamente con gli stakeholder di progetto.

Il ruolo richiede una conoscenza basilare dei servizi Microsoft legati al mondo della “Data Intelligence” e delle più diffuse metodologie di Project Management (Waterfall, Agile) applicate attraverso l’utilizzo degli strumenti di configuration management come Azure DevOps. Sarai affiancato da profili senior che ti aiuteranno nel gestire le criticità e potrai dare il tuo contributo avendo una certa autonomia nel ruolo, assicurandoti che il lavoro svolto sia in linea con i piani di progetto, gli standard di qualità e la sicurezza aziendale.

4267671432,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/procurement-data-analyst-at-robert-walters-4267671432?position=54&pageNum=0&refId=uBpCfe5q2i%2B18hBlyebQZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=ckDOiEK5NDGbIiW34LrORg%3D%3D,Procurement Data Analyst,Robert Walters,"Monza e Brianza, Lombardy, Italy","Si è presentata una nuova opportunità per un Procurement Data Analyst di entrare a far parte di un team veramente internazionale con sede a Monza per una nota società in ambito Health Care. Questo ruolo è perfetto per chi prospera all'intersezione tra dati e business, offrendoti la possibilità di avere un impatto tangibile sulle operazioni di approvvigionamento in più paesi. Avrai la piena libertà creativa per introdurre nuove idee e guidare la trasformazione digitale, il tutto all'interno di un ambiente solidale e accogliente che valorizza la flessibilità, il rispetto e un approccio di mentalità aperta. Con una struttura di team piatta e colleghi provenienti da tutto il mondo, ti divertirai a lavorare in una cultura che incoraggia la condivisione delle conoscenze, la crescita professionale e lo sviluppo personale. Vengono offerte modalità di lavoro flessibili, che ti consentono di bilanciare il tuo tempo tra la presenza in ufficio e il lavoro a distanza ogni mese. Se sei appassionato di sfruttare i dati per ottimizzare i processi di procurement e desideroso di diventare un esperto di approvvigionamento, supply chain e finanza, questo è il passo successivo ideale per la tua carriera.
Prepara, analizza e distribuisci report completi sulle spese di procurement per supportare il processo decisionale strategico in più reparti.
Implementare e mantenere indicatori chiave di prestazione (KPI) per le attività di procurement per garantire il monitoraggio continuo delle prestazioni e della conformità.
Supervisionare la rendicontazione dei rischi di procurement (PRR), i calcoli dei bonus dei fornitori e altre clausole contrattualmente rilevanti per mitigare i rischi relativi ai fornitori.
Agisci come consulente di fiducia e partner collaborativo per i team di Category Management, fornendo informazioni utili derivate dall'analisi dei dati.
Coordinarsi strettamente con le funzioni Finance e Controlling per garantire un calcolo accurato e una rendicontazione trasparente delle iniziative di risparmio sui costi.
Promuovere la collaborazione attiva tra i vari dipartimenti a livello nazionale per allinearsi agli standard di reporting degli acquisti e alle metodologie di controllo.
Monitora le metriche delle prestazioni dei fornitori e i rischi associati, raccomandando azioni e implementando misure di controllo secondo necessità.
Supporta il Category Management durante le negoziazioni, i processi di contrattazione e l'eliminazione graduale dei fornitori fornendo un solido supporto analitico.
Identificare le opportunità di miglioramento continuo negli strumenti, nei metodi e nei sistemi di approvvigionamento
column2: guidare iniziative volte ad automatizzare i processi manuali.

column1: Mantieni un archivio di conoscenze aggiornato accessibile alle parti interessate in tutta l'organizzazione per promuovere le migliori pratiche nell'analisi degli acquisti.
Laurea in Economia Aziendale, Finanza, Procurement, Supply Chain Management o campo affine
column2: Master preferito per una maggiore competenza in materia.

column1: Minimo 2-3 anni di esperienza come Data Analyst, idealmente nel controllo degli acquisti, nella reportistica o nell'analisi della catena di approvvigionamento in un contesto internazionale o multinazionale.
Competenza avanzata nella suite MS Office, in particolare Excel (con VBA/Macro) e PowerPoint, per la manipolazione di dati complessi e scopi di presentazione.
Esperienza dimostrata nell'utilizzo di Power BI per la creazione di dashboard
column2: capacità di collegare i report direttamente con i sistemi SAP S/4HANA tramite processi ETL.

column1: Solida conoscenza di SQL per l'esecuzione di query su set di dati di grandi dimensioni
column2: la familiarità con Python è altamente desiderabile per i progetti di analisi avanzata.

column1: Eccellenti capacità interpersonali con comprovata capacità di comunicare in modo chiaro informazioni su dati complessi a pubblici diversi
column2: la padronanza della lingua inglese è obbligatoria.

Leadership Accessibile: Dirigenti disponibili, orientati all'ascolto e al supporto dello sviluppo professionale (mentorship, progetti).

Si è presentata una nuova opportunità per un Procurement Data Analyst di entrare a far parte di un team veramente internazionale con sede a Monza per una nota società in ambito Health Care. Questo ruolo è perfetto per chi prospera all'intersezione tra dati e business, offrendoti la possibilità di avere un impatto tangibile sulle operazioni di approvvigionamento in più paesi.   • Promuovere la collaborazione attiva tra i vari dipartimenti a livello nazionale per allinearsi agli standard di reporting degli acquisti e alle metodologie di controllo.

4255180687,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/digital-analytics-consultant-milan-at-fifty-five-4255180687?position=55&pageNum=0&refId=uBpCfe5q2i%2B18hBlyebQZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=JPFVMBYaM40L8OGNoiW9WQ%3D%3D,Digital Analytics Consultant - Milan,fifty-five,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","About the Company

Rapid shifts in technology have dramatically changed the way people interact and engage with brands. fifty-five is a new kind of data company that helps brands leverage data to improve marketing, media, and customer experience through a combination of specialized consultancy and technology services.
As the strategic data pillar of The Brandtech Group, we offer services that combine strategy consulting, cloud services, media consulting and customer experience.

We are made up of over +320 digital experts. Digital consultants, tracking and media specialists, engineers and data scientists all work in close collaboration to provide senior-level marketing consultancy and technical support to our clients, in every type of industry, all around the world.

As a partner to advertisers from data collection to activation and exploitation, we help organizations become truly omnichannel entities that control the efficiency of their digital ecosystem and its synergies with the physical world.
Headquartered in Paris, we operate across 3 time zones from our 10 offices, located in Paris, London, Geneva, Milan, Shanghai, Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Taipei, Singapore and New York.

We are looking for a Digital Analytics Consultant to join our new Milan-based consulting team. This is a varied role which spans across website architecture, UX analysis, media advisory and digital strategy. As a Consultant at 55, you will be working on marketing analytics and marketing activations as opposed to setting up and optimising campaigns, so we therefore are seeking applicants with some prior experience in marketing or web analytics.

Working as part of a small, collaborative team, you will play a key role in delivering fifty-five's data-led projects to multiple, big brand clients across industries such as luxury, automotive, retail and beauty. These projects will be driven by client objectives relating to data collection, customer acquisition, onsite conversion optimisation and media-mix optimisation and you will be required to promote a customer-centric vision of digital marketing, based on the systematic and methodical use of data to support decisions.

You will report to the Head of office and work alongside other Consultants and technical experts such as Tracking Specialists, Cloud Engineers and Innovation Experts. Led by the Senior Consultant, you will contribute to the timely & professional delivery of our projects. Examples of the sort of project work you will be part of delivering within the first year of your role include but are not limited to
column2: the creation and monitoring of complex dashboards aimed at aggregating findings from numerous data sources
column3: the evaluation of client's existing marketing channel mix and the recommendation of the most suitable attribution model
column4: the implementation of cookie consent management solutions to obtain users consent for data collection, martech audience review and architecture recommendation. This is an exciting, hands-on role within a company that puts collaboration and knowledge sharing at the heart of everything we do.

Approximately 1 year of experience in web / marketing analytics (preferably as a business analyst/ data analyst/ marketing analyst, or with experience in paid media buying)
Native or bilingual english is mandatory
Analytical mindset, keen to apply data to challenges
Detail oriented, proactive and self-motivated, good organisation is paramount
Curious and eager to learn, able to challenge and recommend solutions to problems
Flexible, versatile and works well under pressure

If this sounds like you, please get in touch! We look forward to meeting you.
In return, we are pleased to offer you the following benefits:
Being part of a multicultural, dynamic and fast-growing team
Continuous (and certified) training on the digital ecosystem and technologies (initial training for all new employees, followed by recurring training sessions)
The flexibility to work remotely for part of the week - this will continue post Covid

fifty-five encourages diversity and is committed to guaranteeing equal treatment of all applications, regardless of gender, age, origin, sexual orientation, state of health or political or religious opinion.

About the Company

Rapid shifts in technology have dramatically changed the way people interact and engage with brands. fifty-five is a new kind of data company that helps brands leverage data to improve marketing, media, and customer experience through a combination of specialized consultancy and technology services.

As the strategic data pillar of The Brandtech Group, we offer services that combine strategy consulting, cloud services, media consulting and customer experience.

We are made up of over +320 digital experts. Digital consultants, tracking and media specialists, engineers and data scientists all work in close collaboration to provide senior-level marketing consultancy and technical support to our clients, in every type of industry, all around the world.

As a partner to advertisers from data collection to activation and exploitation, we help organizations become truly omnichannel entities that control the efficiency of their digital ecosystem and its synergies with the physical world.

Headquartered in Paris, we operate across 3 time zones from our 10 offices, located in Paris, London, Geneva, Milan, Shanghai, Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Taipei, Singapore and New York.

About the Role

We are looking for a Digital Analytics Consultant to join our new Milan-based consulting team. This is a varied role which spans across website architecture, UX analysis, media advisory and digital strategy. As a Consultant at 55, you will be working on marketing analytics and marketing activations as opposed to setting up and optimising campaigns, so we therefore are seeking applicants with some prior experience in marketing or web analytics.

Working as part of a small, collaborative team, you will play a key role in delivering fifty-five's data-led projects to multiple, big brand clients across industries such as luxury, automotive, retail and beauty. These projects will be driven by client objectives relating to data collection, customer acquisition, onsite conversion optimisation and media-mix optimisation and you will be required to promote a customer-centric vision of digital marketing, based on the systematic and methodical use of data to support decisions.

You will report to the Head of office and work alongside other Consultants and technical experts such as Tracking Specialists, Cloud Engineers and Innovation Experts. Led by the Senior Consultant, you will contribute to the timely &

4267745939,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-analyst-data-annotator-ml-at-provectus-4267745939?position=59&pageNum=0&refId=uBpCfe5q2i%2B18hBlyebQZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=m1Sxllins9Ijm%2FeUQssMUg%3D%3D,Business Analyst & Data Annotator (ML),Provectus,Greater Milan Metropolitan Area,"As a Business Analyst & Data Annotator, you will play a crucial role in gathering and analyzing business requirements, acting as a bridge between stakeholder needs and technical teams. You will also handle the data annotation process, ensuring the production of high-quality, accurately labeled datasets necessary for training machine learning models.

This role involves close collaboration with ML engineers, data scientists, and business teams to ensure that data aligns with project goals. Your work will center on translating complex business needs and technical specifications into clear instructions, managing data labeling workflows, and maintaining data quality standards.
Develop and implement detailed guidelines and instructions for data labeling and annotation to ensure consistency and accuracy across datasets
Review and validate labeled data, providing constructive feedback to annotation teams to improve data quality and adherence to project standards
Collaborate with data scientists and ML engineers to prepare, organize, and support the creation of high-quality annotated datasets for model training
Manage the annotation workflow, prioritize tasks, and track progress to ensure timely delivery of labeled data
Maintain high standards of data privacy, security, and compliance throughout all annotation processes
Gather and analyze business requirements, workflows, and terminology to understand data needs and improve annotation processes
Facilitate communication between technical teams and stakeholders by translating complex technical or domain-specific language into clear, accessible instructions and explanations
Offer insights into business processes that could benefit from automation or ML solutions, supporting the design and implementation of such projects
Support continuous improvement of data annotation guidelines, workflows, and overall business analysis practices to enhance efficiency and data quality
At least 1 year of experience in the relevant role
Excellent English language skills (B2 level or higher, ideally C1), especially when working with reports containing complex terminology
Strong analytical skills and an understanding of business workflows
Attention to detail and ability to create clear instructions and guidelines for annotation teams
Understanding of data privacy, security standards, and compliance requirements
Basic knowledge of machine learning concepts and data management principles
Familiarity with ML workflows, data pipelines, and MLOps tools
Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure
Experience with data labeling or annotation
Experience in creating markups for AI

4259472646,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-research-analyst-at-osservatori-digital-innovation-4259472646?position=60&pageNum=0&refId=uBpCfe5q2i%2B18hBlyebQZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=GOPMyFTOmmR%2FjZSkdqpArw%3D%3D,Junior Research Analyst,Osservatori Digital Innovation,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","🚀 Unisciti al Team degli Osservatori Digital Innovation!

Hai passione per l'Innovazione Digitale e vuoi metterti in gioco in un contesto di ricerca dinamico e all’avanguardia? Gli Osservatori Digital Innovation della School of Management del Politecnico di Milano ti offrono un’opportunità unica di crescita professionale in un ambiente stimolante e altamente qualificato!

Dal 1999, siamo un punto di riferimento per l'Innovazione Digitale in Italia, integrando ricerca applicata, comunicazione, aggiornamento continuo e networking. Oggi, siamo alla ricerca di un/una Junior Research Analyst per supportare le nostre attività di ricerca nei seguenti ambiti:
HR, Smart Working e Pubblica Amministrazione
In qualità di Junior Research Analyst, avrai l'opportunità di:
🔍 Analizzare la letteratura nazionale e internazionale su temi di innovazione digitale
🎤 Partecipare a interviste con il top management di aziende, sintetizzando i contenuti emersi
📊 Realizzare studi di caso sulle principali iniziative nel settore
📝 Supportare la stesura di survey e l'elaborazione dei risultati
📅 Contribuire all’organizzazione di eventi e workshop tematici
📣 Gestire attività di comunicazione, inclusi social media e newsletter
🤝 Mantenere relazioni con la nostra community di esperti, aziende e istituzioni
Cerchiamo una persona curiosa, smart e intraprendente che possieda:
- Laurea Magistrale in Ingegneria Gestionale, Economia, Management o ambiti affini
- Ottima conoscenza della lingua italiana e inglese (sia scritta che parlata)
- Passione per l'innovazione digitale e la ricerca applicata
- Capacità analitiche e di sintesi dei dati, con spirito critico e attenzione ai dettagli
- Capacità di lavorare in team e di gestire le relazioni interpersonali
Entrando nel nostro team, potrai godere di una stage retribuito con l'opportunità di lavorare in un ambiente giovane, stimolante e altamente innovativo, con accesso a:
🌟 Esperienza su temi di innovazione digitale di eccellenza
🌟 Networking professionale con colleghi, aziende e istituzioni di alto livello
🌟 Un ambiente di lavoro dinamico e orientato alla crescita
Non perdere questa occasione, candidati ora e inizia il tuo percorso con noi! 🚀

Capital One is a leading financial technology company that focuses on data-driven insights and innovative business strategies. They are seeking a Data Analyst Associate to join their two-year rotational program, which offers hands-on experience in various roles while applying strategic and analytical skills to address major company challenges.
• Harness cloud-based tools and platforms to explore structured and unstructured data
• Use data mining techniques to identify fraud rings
• Test the effectiveness of our marketing channels
• Use modeling and analytics to understand how business decisions impact our bottom line.
• Build the data foundation for Capital One’s digital agenda
• Seamlessly integrate data from multiple sources and platforms to generate customer insight
• Explore new data sources to enhance models and build solutions that empower analytics
• Research web activities to drive enhancements to customer engagement sites

• Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a Bachelor’s degree or higher with an expectation that you will complete your most recent full-time degree program before the start date of your cohort, either in February 2026 or August 2026
Capital One is a diversified banking company that offers early and later stage venture, and debt financing investments.

4268209539,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-%E2%80%93-systematic-macro-strategy-at-f-l-search-4268209539?position=5&pageNum=2&refId=KeZVrddoXjNEBeY7l60DeA%3D%3D&trackingId=5N%2Ffz6p2SxpWyMuLIaM4gA%3D%3D,Data Analyst – Systematic Macro Strategy,F&L Search,"New York, United States","A leading alternative investment firm is seeking a Data Analyst to support the buildout of a fully systematic, fundamentally-driven macro strategy. This is a high-impact role working directly with the strategy’s PM/CIO and other senior investment professionals to ensure seamless access to high-quality macroeconomic data. The role is based in New York and offers significant scope to shape a new, institutional-grade platform from the ground up.
Data Discovery: Source, evaluate, and liaise with external providers to identify novel macroeconomic and financial datasets
Data Onboarding: Integrate new datasets into the firm’s broader architecture, ensuring clean ingestion pipelines
Data Curation: Oversee metadata, run integrity checks, and proactively resolve issues across a broad range of macroeconomic data
Data Engineering: Manipulate data to fit strategic needs – including normalization, substitution, and back-casting
Visualization: Build tools and dashboards that bring data to life and enhance the decision-making process
5+ years in a data-centric role within a hedge fund, asset manager, or data provider
Strong command of macroeconomic and market data, with an understanding of how it supports systematic investment strategies
Demonstrated experience working closely with investment management professionals – including PMs, economists, and researchers
Practical experience working with Bloomberg, Refinitiv/Datastream, Macrobond, and similar sources
Proficiency in data science and statistics
column2: bonus points for experience with Python, C#, Kdb, or VBA

column1: A background in small, fast-moving teams or entrepreneurial settings is highly valued
Bonus if you've worked with bitemporal data, built complex data visualizations, or contributed to macroeconomic research

This is an exceptional opportunity to play a foundational role in a new, institutionally backed macro build, working closely with world-class investors on a strategy with significant capital and long-term backing.

A leading alternative investment firm is seeking a Data Analyst to support the buildout of a fully systematic, fundamentally-driven macro strategy. This is a high-impact role working directly with the strategy’s PM/CIO and other senior investment professionals to ensure seamless access to high-quality macroeconomic data. The role is based in New York and offers significant scope to shape a new, institutional-grade platform from the ground up.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Data Discovery: Source, evaluate, and liaise with external providers to identify novel macroeconomic and financial datasets
  • Data Onboarding: Integrate new datasets into the firm’s broader architecture, ensuring clean ingestion pipelines
  • Data Curation: Oversee metadata, run integrity checks, and proactively resolve issues across a broad range of macroeconomic data
  • Data Engineering: Manipulate data to fit strategic needs – including normalization, substitution, and back-casting
  • Visualization: Build tools and dashboards that bring data to life and enhance the decision-making process


Ideal Candidate Profile:

  • 5+ years in a data-centric role within a hedge fund, asset manager, or data provider
  • Strong command of macroeconomic and market data, with an understanding of how it supports systematic investment strategies
  • Demonstrated experience working closely with investment management professionals – including PMs, economists, and researchers
  • Practical experience working with Bloomberg, Refinitiv/Datastream, Macrobond, and similar sources
  • Proficiency in data science and statistics
column2:
bonus points for experience with Python, C#, Kdb, or VBA
  • A background in small, fast-moving teams or entrepreneurial settings is highly valued
  • Bonus if you've worked with bitemporal data, built complex data visualizations, or contributed to macroeconomic research

4267779619,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/specialist-data-solutions-analyst-at-nationwide-financial-4267779619?position=10&pageNum=2&refId=KeZVrddoXjNEBeY7l60DeA%3D%3D&trackingId=o%2B1NmN3IkUxXx5NwXM38pA%3D%3D,"Specialist, Data Solutions Analyst",Nationwide Financial,"Columbus, OH","Company Description

Nationwide is a Fortune 100 company based in Columbus, Ohio, recognized as one of the largest and strongest diversified insurance and financial services organizations in the United States. The company holds an A+ rating from both A.M. Best and Standard & Poor’s. Through Nationwide Financial, a division offering life insurance, retirement plans, annuities, and mutual funds, the company simplifies financial services for professionals with client-ready materials and easy-to-use tools. For more information, visit www.nationwidefinancial.com.

This is a full-time hybrid role for a Specialist, Data Solutions Analyst located in Columbus, OH, with some work-from-home flexibility. The Specialist will play a key role in designing, developing, and optimizing data solutions that support electronic order entry systems, DTCC feed transmission, and file transfer management systems. They'll work closely with our team and business partners to ensure data integrity, performance, and scalability across our platforms.
Proficient in SQL with Java experience
Proficient in designing optimized Data Solutions
Experience in mapping Data Flows and Business Process optimization
Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
Experience in Talend, AWS or the financial services industry is a plus
