4268197823,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/ai-engineer-new-grad-entry-level-at-jobright-ai-4268197823?position=1&pageNum=17&refId=NsHxDWVTVW3XsKdcggIHSw%3D%3D&trackingId=evPGBHhMYY7s5un0NlYJXA%3D%3D,"AI Engineer, New Grad & Entry Level",Jobright.ai,"Texas, United States","Lockheed Martin is a global security and aerospace company that specializes in advanced technology systems, products, and services. The company is seeking a highly motivated and experienced leader to join their Artificial Intelligence Center as an Associate Manager, where the individual will lead a team of AI engineers and collaborate with various stakeholders to drive innovation and achieve business objectives.
Leading a team of AI engineers to set priorities and execute work within the team vision
Collaborating with a diverse team of data engineers, researchers, AI/ML developers, software engineers, MLOps teams, and product managers to drive innovation and growth
Providing technical expertise in artificial intelligence, machine learning, autonomy, and software engineering to guide the team and inform decision-making
Developing and implementing strategies to drive team performance and achieve business objectives
Fostering a culture of innovation, experimentation, and continuous learning within the team
Proven track record of success in leading high-performing teams

Lockheed Martin is a global security and aerospace company that specializes in advanced technology systems, products, and services. The company is seeking a highly motivated and experienced leader to join their Artificial Intelligence Center as an Associate Manager, where the individual will lead a team of AI engineers and collaborate with various stakeholders to drive innovation and achieve business objectives.


Responsibilities

  • Leading a team of AI engineers to set priorities and execute work within the team vision
  • Collaborating with a diverse team of data engineers, researchers, AI/ML developers, software engineers, MLOps teams, and product managers to drive innovation and growth
  • Providing technical expertise in artificial intelligence, machine learning, autonomy, and software engineering to guide the team and inform decision-making
  • Developing and implementing strategies to drive team performance and achieve business objectives

Are you a Data Quality Software Engineer with experience in IT and management of diverse teams?

If so, check out this job!


Vertex is a US-based tech company with 15 years’ experience in Microsoft, Salesforce, BI, AI, and Cloud Computing. We have formed longstanding client relationships as trusted, long-term partners. Every day we inspire, innovate, and implement solutions that solve complex business problems using creativity and technologies that drive results.


What can you expect?

• Professional recruiters with vast industry knowledge

• Expert credentialing

• No-hassle onboarding


What is in it for you?

• An assignment that uses your skills

• Opportunities to advance your career

• Splendid work environment



Position: Data Quality Software Engineer

Duration: Long Term Role

Location: Hybrid in King of Prussia, PA



Job Description :

  • Around 10+ years of experience Expertise in Microsoft SQL Server, Azure PaaS components (Azure Data Factories, Data Bricks, Azure Data Lake Analytics).
  • Experience in developing / implementing data quality framework by using Custom or SaaS tool.
  • Experience in setting up business glossary within the overall data governance program.

  • Strong knowledge of Role-Based Access Control (RBAC), Managed Identities, Purview, and Data Sensitivity Classification to ensure data security and compliance.

4268208080,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-governance-payments-data-catalogues-metrics-metadata-at-u-s-bank-4268208080?position=6&pageNum=17&refId=NsHxDWVTVW3XsKdcggIHSw%3D%3D&trackingId=cF37mJbERBSyzfgKuBB9rA%3D%3D,"Data Governance Payments Data Catalogues (Metrics, Metadata)",U.S. Bank,"Tempe, AZ","At U.S. Bank, we’re on a journey to do our best. Helping the customers and businesses we serve to make better and smarter financial decisions and enabling the communities we support to grow and succeed. We believe it takes all of us to bring our shared ambition to life, and each person is unique in their potential. A career with U.S. Bank gives you a wide, ever-growing range of opportunities to discover what makes you thrive at every stage of your career. Try new things, learn new skills and discover what you excel at—all from Day One.

Brings to the data governance team Data as a Product in service to Data Governance as a Service mindset. This role will initially support our Electronic Payment Services partners in understanding and translating critical data definitions into usable Metric, Transformation, and Metadata catalogue supports. Candidate will partner both internally within the Business Insights & Performance team, and likewise across Operations within a Shared Services Organization supporting Lines of Business, Risk/Compliance professionals, technology, and business line leaders to support and maintain data governance practices and processes within Operations as it relates to data, analytics and reporting. Through knowledgeable application of Business Intelligence (BI) Visualization tools, and data implementation approaches which support requirements gathering and understanding Metrics to Metadata lineage support across Data Engineering Teams, Reporting & Analytics Teams, Compliance Teams, Risk Partners, and will leverage Enterprise Data Governance tools!

SPECIFICATIONS: A senior individual who works independently under minimal supervision and operates in a capability focused matrixed organization. Strong technical/functional understanding of internal and vendor supported systems, with complex data backend systems leveraging Oracle SQL, Microsoft SQL, and IBM SQL to understand technical and business metadata & metrics. Candidate will have demonstrated self-driven continuous improvement mindset and strategically assesses business needs and recommends approaches for both short-term success and long-term success across on-premise and cloud solutions. Strong background in data analytics with excellent problem-solving skills. Communicates strongly across Risk, Technical and Business partners. Strong risk documentation skills and the ability to hold teams accountable for sustaining data governance in the work that they do.

This role does not support visa sponsorship. The role offers a hybrid/flexible schedule, which means there’s an in-office expectation of 3 or more days per week and the flexibility to work outside the office location for the other days at one of the following locations:
Bachelor's degree, or equivalent work experience
Four to five years of experience in data governance activities
Advanced project management/business analysis knowledge and familiarity with the business line processes and/or applications
Advanced understanding of Data Governance principles
Thorough knowledge of data architecture concepts and data governance tooling
Strong verbal and written communication skills
If there’s anything we can do to accommodate a disability during any portion of the application or hiring process, please refer to our disability accommodations for applicants.

Our approach to benefits and total rewards considers our team members’ whole selves and what may be needed to thrive in and outside work. That's why our benefits are designed to help you and your family boost your health, protect your financial security and give you peace of mind. Our benefits include the following (some may vary based on role, location or hours):
Basic term and optional term life insurance
Paid vacation (from two to five weeks depending on salary grade and tenure)
Sick and Safe Leave accruals of one hour for every 30 worked, up to 80 hours per calendar year unless otherwise provided by law

U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, and other factors protected under applicable law.

U.S. Bank participates in the U.S. Department of Homeland Security E-Verify program in all facilities located in the United States and certain U.S. territories. The E-Verify program is an Internet-based employment eligibility verification system operated by the U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services. Learn more about the E-Verify program.

The salary range reflects figures based on the primary location, which is listed first. The actual range for the role may differ based on the location of the role. In addition to salary, U.S. Bank offers a comprehensive benefits package, including incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase 401(k) contribution and pension (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). Pay Range: $98,175.00 - $115,500.00

U.S. Bank will consider qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records for employment. U.S. Bank conducts background checks consistent with applicable local laws, including the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance and the California Fair Chance Act as well as the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. U.S. Bank is subject to, and conducts background checks consistent with the requirements of Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act (FDIA). In addition, certain positions may also be subject to the requirements of FINRA, NMLS registration, Reg Z, Reg G, OFAC, the NFA, the FCPA, the Bank Secrecy Act, the SAFE Act, and/or federal guidelines applicable to an agreement, such as those related to ethics, safety, or operational procedures.
Applicants must be able to comply with U.S. Bank policies and procedures including the Code of Ethics and Business Conduct and related workplace conduct and safety policies.
Posting may be closed earlier due to high volume of applicants.

We are seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join a dynamic team on a contract-to-hire basis. This is an exciting opportunity to make a tangible impact by transforming data into actionable insights that drive strategic decisions.
Analyze large datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and insights.
Build and maintain dashboards and reports to support various business functions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and deliver tailored solutions.
Define and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs).
Present data findings through compelling visualizations and storytelling.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity through rigorous validation and quality checks.
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Mathematics).
Proven experience in data analysis or business intelligence roles.
Proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Looker, Excel).
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to simplify complex data.
This is a trial-to-hire opportunity. Candidates should be open to transitioning into a permanent role after the initial 3-month contract, contingent on performance.

Data Analyst (Contract-to-Hire)


Location: Zurich (On-site)

Start Date: ASAP

Contract Duration: 3 months (with potential for permanent hire)

Workload: 100%


About the Role

We are seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join a dynamic team on a contract-to-hire basis. This is an exciting opportunity to make a tangible impact by transforming data into actionable insights that drive strategic decisions.


Key Responsibilities

  • Analyze large datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and insights.
  • Build and maintain dashboards and reports to support various business functions.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and deliver tailored solutions.
  • Define and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs).
  • Present data findings through compelling visualizations and storytelling.
  • Ensure data accuracy and integrity through rigorous validation and quality checks.


Required Skills &
column2:
Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Mathematics).
  • Proven experience in data analysis or business intelligence roles.
  • Proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Looker, Excel).
  • Familiarity with Python or R.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to simplify complex data.
  • Fluent in English (written and spoken).


Additional Information


This is a trial-to-hire opportunity. Candidates should be open to transitioning into a permanent role after the initial 3-month contract, contingent on performance.

Il prendra en charge les développements et la maintenance des produits de reporting pour plusieurs domaines d’activités de Rolex et/ou Tudor. Il sera le principal interlocuteur de nos répondants métiers sur ce(s) domaine(s).
Analyser et interpréter les données pour en extraire des insights stratégiques et opérationnels, contribuant directement aux activités de Rolex et Tudor
Produire des sources de données et des visualisations avec des outils de premier plan tels que Tableau et Power BI, afin de faciliter la prise de décision
Optimiser ces produits pour garantir une expérience utilisateur conforme aux attentes
Participer activement à l'amélioration de la qualité des données et garantir la fiabilité des analyses
Contribuer à l'automatisation et à l'optimisation des processus analytiques, avec une compréhension approfondie des outils de transformation de données
Collaborer étroitement avec les équipes de data engineering pour garantir l'intégrité et la pertinence des données utilisées dans les analyses

Assister activement la communauté des Data Citizens dans l'élaboration de produits de données qualitatifs, réutilisables et innovants via des communications, accompagnements et formations des utilisateurs
Formation supérieure en informatique ou ingénierie EPF ou HES, avec une spécialisation en analyse de données
Expérience significative dans des postes de Data Engineer et/ou Data Analyst, acquise dans des environnements OnPrem et Cloud
Langue maternelle française avec une bonne maîtrise de l'anglais
Maîtrise de technologies telles que Snowflake, Dataiku, BW4Hana Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse ou Talend, pour optimiser le traitement et l'exploitation des données
Bonne maîtrise des outils de visualisation tels que Tableau et Power BI
Forte culture de l'automatisation, associée à un engagement envers la qualité des données et l'observabilité pour maintenir un contrôle rigoureux
Bonne connaissance des concepts de sécurité de l'information
Sens du relationnel et force de proposition
Haut degré d'autonomie dans la recherche de solutions, capacité à évaluer la qualité des livrables
Fortes compétences interpersonnelles et capacité à travailler efficacement en équipe
Nous vous offrons un environnement stimulant, d’excellentes conditions de travail, des solutions de flexibilisation du temps de travail et des prestations sociales de premier ordre.
Nous vous remercions d'adresser un dossier de candidature complet (CV, lettre de motivation, certificats et diplômes).

Pour notre division Systèmes d'information, nous sommes à la recherche d'un Data Analyst (H/F), dont la mission principale au sein du groupe Data Analytics sera de modéliser, interpréter et valoriser les données dans un environnement technologique en pleine évolution. Il prendra en charge les développements et la maintenance des produits de reporting pour plusieurs domaines d’activités de Rolex et/ou Tudor. Il sera le principal interlocuteur de nos répondants métiers sur ce(s) domaine(s).

Responsabilités

  • Analyser et interpréter les données pour en extraire des insights stratégiques et opérationnels, contribuant directement aux activités de Rolex et Tudor
  • Produire des sources de données et des visualisations avec des outils de premier plan tels que Tableau et Power BI, afin de faciliter la prise de décision
  • Optimiser ces produits pour garantir une expérience utilisateur conforme aux attentes
  • Participer activement à l'amélioration de la qualité des données et garantir la fiabilité des analyses
  • Contribuer à l'automatisation et à l'optimisation des processus analytiques, avec une compréhension approfondie des outils de transformation de données
  • Collaborer étroitement avec les équipes de data engineering pour garantir l'intégrité et la pertinence des données utilisées dans les analyses
  • Assister activement la communauté des Data Citizens dans l'élaboration de produits de données qualitatifs, réutilisables et innovants via des communications, accompagnements et formations des utilisateurs

Profil

  • Formation supérieure en informatique ou ingénierie EPF ou HES, avec une spécialisation en analyse de données
  • Expérience significative dans des postes de Data Engineer et/ou Data Analyst, acquise dans des environnements OnPrem et Cloud
  • Langue maternelle française avec une bonne maîtrise de l'anglais
  • Maîtrise de technologies telles que Snowflake, Dataiku, BW4Hana Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse ou Talend, pour optimiser le traitement et l'exploitation des données
  • Bonne maîtrise des outils de visualisation tels que Tableau et Power BI
  • Forte culture de l'automatisation, associée à un engagement envers la qualité des données et l'observabilité pour maintenir un contrôle rigoureux
  • Bonne connaissance des concepts de sécurité de l'information
  • Sens du relationnel et force de proposition
  • Haut degré d'autonomie dans la recherche de solutions, capacité à évaluer la qualité des livrables
  • Fortes compétences interpersonnelles et capacité à travailler efficacement en équipe

Nous vous offrons un environnement stimulant, d’excellentes conditions de travail, des solutions de flexibilisation du temps de travail et des prestations sociales de premier ordre.

Nous vous remercions d'adresser un dossier de candidature complet (CV, lettre de motivation, certificats et diplômes).

4264621777,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-3-month-internship-at-kfc-europe-4264621777?position=4&pageNum=0&refId=LfhoZWiB664iFqfZzoVdDQ%3D%3D&trackingId=IBXqFAxuE3ImMQOqXM4f6Q%3D%3D,Data Analyst (3-month internship),KFC Europe,"Lausanne, Vaud, Switzerland","Job Description
Support our Commercial Finance Lead in building our regional data & analytics capabilities
Enable common Western Europe product hierarchy and product mix analysis standardization (60%)
Map local product hierarchies to WEBU hierarchy
Enable pricing strategy across Western Europe (20%)
Analyze Items by price ranges & gaps vs competition
Enable Franchisee data sharing (Sales Growth, brand Metrics, Operations metrics 20%)
Test Franchisee user accesses / Test brand & ops metrics
Power BI knowledge is a plus
Ability to connect with cross functional teams

From the centre of the continent to the remote (and not-so-remote) coasts and islands, KFC Pan Europe is the iconic chicken restaurant brand with a unique history of innovation and success. Always original, our passion is high-quality, finger lickin’ good chicken. Yes, we also have a secret recipe. No, we can’t share it. What we can share is our heart-led, welcoming culture, where you can be your best self, make a difference and have fun.

We’re part of Yum! Brands, Inc.—collaborating across the world with our sister brands, Taco Bell, Pizza Hut and The Habit Burger Grill. KFC Pan Europe has three business units: Western Europe, Central & Eastern Europe and France. With more than 30 official languages in 150 different franchises, connecting with us is easier than ever. If you really want to do the math, we’ve also got 2,200 restaurants in 40 countries. Either way, we keep it original.

For us, the future is all about connecting food traditions and tomorrow’s technology to innovate customer experiences, our global brand and the best fried chicken you’ve ever tasted. We exist to feed people’s potential, valuing personal development and an inclusive culture. This also means having a keen social purpose and investing in mentorship, upskilling and food security. Creating opportunities for the most underserved and vulnerable groups in our communities helps grow new roots and strengthen bonds.

We want our people to be their best selves. So, we invest in skills, resources and each other. At our Pan Europe Academy, we develop leadership and train all levels of restaurant and corporate employees. From Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) to Individual Development Plans, we build meaningful careers that have real impact.
The bottom line? We bring it. Curious? We hope so.
Bring your spark, your spice and your original story. At KFC Pan Europe, we’re grounded in winning, celebrating, recognizing, welcoming and belonging. We've got a big table. You have a seat at it.

TieTalent is the #1 career growth marketplace in Switzerland, France, and Germany, connecting top talent in IT and Digital Marketing with innovative hiring companies. With our unique reverse recruitment model, candidates don’t need to apply to jobs or write motivation letters — companies apply to interview them for relevant roles.

As a freelance Data Analyst, you will dive deep into our platform data to unlock insights that help us boost engagement, registrations, and monetization. You’ll analyze user behavior, job interactions, traffic sources, and partner job performance — then translate this into clear recommendations that impact our growth.
Analyze user activity across the platform: clicks, impressions, registration patterns, and engagement trends.
Identify high-performing and underperforming job listings based on job type, location, source, etc.
Assess partner job lifecycle metrics to optimize job listings and partner engagement.
Investigate funnel drop-offs (e.g. click-to-register, browse-to-click) and provide strategies to increase conversion rates.
Segment talents based on location, job preferences, and activity for targeted offers.
Understand traffic sources to inform acquisition and retention strategies.
Deliver clear, actionable reports and dashboards to guide decision-making.
Suggest key metrics to monitor post-project for long-term optimization.
Design and implement dashboards for internal stakeholders (Product, Marketing, Ops) to track key KPIs.
Your Profile: (Apply only if you tick all the must-haves!)
✅ Strong experience in data analysis (min 5 years of work experience).
✅ Proven experience in using using SQL, Python, or similar tools.
✅ Strong skills in data visualization (Tableau, Looker, Power BI, or similar).
✅ Have experience working with job platforms** marketplaces, e-commerce or SaaS tools
✅ Analytical mindset with ability to turn data into business recommendations.
✅ Excellent communication skills and ability to work remotely with cross-functional teams.
Create an account at tietalent.com/signup and complete your profile (make sure to indicate interest in this position)
Send a quick email to apply@tietalent.com to highlight your motivation

🚀 We’re Hiring Internally at TieTalent!


About the Company

TieTalent is the #1 career growth marketplace in Switzerland, France, and Germany, connecting top talent in IT and Digital Marketing with innovative hiring companies. With our unique reverse recruitment model, candidates don’t need to apply to jobs or write motivation letters — companies apply to interview them for relevant roles.


About the Role:

Freelance Data Analyst (Remote) - 1-2 months mission


As a freelance Data Analyst, you will dive deep into our platform data to unlock insights that help us boost engagement, registrations, and monetization. You’ll analyze user behavior, job interactions, traffic sources, and partner job performance — then translate this into clear recommendations that impact our growth.


Your Responsibilities:

  • Analyze user activity across the platform: clicks, impressions, registration patterns, and engagement trends.
  • Identify high-performing and underperforming job listings based on job type, location, source, etc.
  • Assess partner job lifecycle metrics to optimize job listings and partner engagement.
  • Investigate funnel drop-offs (e.g. click-to-register, browse-to-click) and provide strategies to increase conversion rates.
  • Segment talents based on location, job preferences, and activity for targeted offers.
  • Understand traffic sources to inform acquisition and retention strategies.
  • Deliver clear, actionable reports and dashboards to guide decision-making.
  • Suggest key metrics to monitor post-project for long-term optimization.
  • Design and implement dashboards for internal stakeholders (Product, Marketing, Ops) to track key KPIs.


Your Profile: (Apply only if you tick all the must-haves!)

✅ Strong experience in data analysis (min 5 years of work experience).

✅ Excellent English level (C1+)

✅ Proven experience in using using SQL, Python, or similar tools.

✅ Strong skills in data visualization (Tableau, Looker, Power BI, or similar).

✅ Have experience working with job platforms** marketplaces, e-commerce or SaaS tools

✅ Analytical mindset with ability to turn data into business recommendations.

✅ Excellent communication skills and ability to work remotely with cross-functional teams.


Interested? Here's How to Apply:

  1. Apply directly via LinkedIn
  2. Create an account at tietalent.com/signup and complete your profile (make sure to indicate interest in this position)
  3. Send a quick email to apply@tietalent.com to highlight your motivation

4252810584,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-%E2%80%93-bi-visualization-specialist-at-epam-systems-4252810584?position=6&pageNum=0&refId=LfhoZWiB664iFqfZzoVdDQ%3D%3D&trackingId=tMBZAH%2FWmp4oA79XZWBsNw%3D%3D,Data Analyst – BI & Visualization Specialist,EPAM Systems,"Geneva, Geneva, Switzerland","EPAM is looking for a Data Analyst to support the data analytics team of a prestigious client in the luxury sector.
Based in our Geneva office in a hybrid setup, this is your chance to make a meaningful impact in a forward-thinking environment.
Would you like to be a part of this ambitious and innovative project? We look forward to receiving your application.
Develop data products across one or more business domains, in alignment with team objectives
Continuously enhance these products to ensure a seamless user experience and maintain data accuracy and consistency with source systems
Provide Level 3 support for these products
Define and validate data ingestion workflows for the company’s data warehouse and data lakes, ensuring reliability and alignment with business needs
Drive adoption of self-service BI tools by engaging the user community through effective communication, training sessions and ongoing support
Contribute to the design and upkeep of reporting solutions, with a strong focus on developing impactful data visualizations using Tableau
Minimum of 2 years of hands-on experience with the Tableau suite, including Desktop, Server and Prep
Demonstrated advanced expertise in Tableau Desktop, particularly in environments integrating SAP BW and Snowflake as data sources
Excellent skills in data visualization, with a keen ability to translate complex data into clear, impactful insights
Strong knowledge of data modeling and data source development within BW data warehouses and/or Snowflake environments
Solid understanding of data processing techniques (extraction, transformation and loading), with hands-on experience using tools like Control-M and Dataiku
Strong interpersonal and time management skills, with the ability to effectively prioritize and deliver enhancements and new data products in a timely manner
Global business travel medical and accident insurance
Learning and development opportunities including in-house training and coaching, professional certifications, over 22,000 courses on LinkedIn Learning Solutions and much more
*All benefits and perks are subject to certain eligibility requirements
Please note that any offers will be subject to appropriate background checks
We do not accept CVs from recruiting or staffing agencies
For this position, we are able to consider applications from the following:
- Third-country nationals based in Switzerland with an appropriate work permit
- Displaced people from Ukraine who are currently in Switzerland and hold, or have already applied for, S permits

EPAM is looking for a Data Analyst to support the data analytics team of a prestigious client in the luxury sector.

Based in our Geneva office in a hybrid setup, this is your chance to make a meaningful impact in a forward-thinking environment.

Would you like to be a part of this ambitious and innovative project? We look forward to receiving your application.

Responsibilities


  • Develop data products across one or more business domains, in alignment with team objectives
  • Continuously enhance these products to ensure a seamless user experience and maintain data accuracy and consistency with source systems
  • Provide Level 3 support for these products
  • Define and validate data ingestion workflows for the company’s data warehouse and data lakes, ensuring reliability and alignment with business needs
  • Drive adoption of self-service BI tools by engaging the user community through effective communication, training sessions and ongoing support
  • Contribute to the design and upkeep of reporting solutions, with a strong focus on developing impactful data visualizations using Tableau


Requirements


  • Minimum of 2 years of hands-on experience with the Tableau suite, including Desktop, Server and Prep
  • Demonstrated advanced expertise in Tableau Desktop, particularly in environments integrating SAP BW and Snowflake as data sources
  • Excellent skills in data visualization, with a keen ability to translate complex data into clear, impactful insights
  • Strong knowledge of data modeling and data source development within BW data warehouses and/or Snowflake environments
  • Solid understanding of data processing techniques (extraction, transformation and loading), with hands-on experience using tools like Control-M and Dataiku
  • Strong interpersonal and time management skills, with the ability to effectively prioritize and deliver enhancements and new data products in a timely manner
  • Fluent in French


We offer


  • 5 weeks of vacation
  • EPAM Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP)
  • Enhanced parental leave
  • Extended pension plan
  • Daily sickness allowance insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Global business travel medical and accident insurance
  • Learning and development opportunities including in-house training and coaching, professional certifications, over 22,000 courses on LinkedIn Learning Solutions and much more
  • *All benefits and perks are subject to certain eligibility requirements
  • Please note that any offers will be subject to appropriate background checks
  • We do not accept CVs from recruiting or staffing agencies
  • For this position, we are able to consider applications from the following:
  • - Swiss nationals
  • - EU/EFTA nationals
  • - Third-country nationals based in Switzerland with an appropriate work permit
  • - Displaced people from Ukraine who are currently in Switzerland and hold, or have already applied for, S permits

In the context of the Luxury New Retail, Richemont Group is accelerating its logistics transformation reshaping our logistics network across all Regions.
Agility, Flexibility, Speed and Customer-centricity are the key drivers for a successful logistics transformation across our Maisons.

By joining our Group Logistics Business Performance team, you will contribute to the development, standardization, and optimization of our end-to-end logistics reporting and performance KPIs across all regions.
HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?

As a Logistics Data Analyst intern, you will play a key role in modernizing our data analytics ecosystem. You will support the migration of logistics databases to our new data lake in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) BigQuery and help transition all Power BI dashboards to Looker, ensuring seamless data visualization and reporting.
Assist in migrating of logistics databases to the new data lake in GCP BigQuery.
Rebuild and optimize Power BI dashboards in Looker, ensuring accuracy and performance.
Process, clean, and validate data integrity for analytics.
Collaborate with logistics teams to identify and resolve data discrepancies in dashboards.
Document standard logistics performance metrics and best practices for reporting.
Participate in cross-functional logistics projects, contributing to data-driven decision-making.
HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?

You are a student or recent graduate in Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field. You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with an interest in data visualization and business intelligence.
You have experience in data processing, cleaning and validation to ensure data integrity.
You are autonomous, organized, with a proactive mindset to drive improvements and the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders.
You speak English fluently (French is a plus).
You are proficient in SQL and familiar with Power BI, Looker. Experience with Python and knowledge of GCP BigQuery is a plus.
HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING?
This is a unique opportunity to gain deep insights into luxury logistics operations and luxury markets.
Exposure to cutting-edge BI technologies in a dynamic, international work environment
Hands-on experience in cloud data management, business intelligence, and cross-functional logistics teams collaboration.

CONTEXT

By joining our Group Logistics Business Performance team, you will contribute to the development, standardization, and optimization of our end-to-end logistics reporting and performance KPIs across all regions.

HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?

As a Logistics Data Analyst intern, you will play a key role in modernizing our data analytics ecosystem. You will support the migration of logistics databases to our new data lake in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) BigQuery and help transition all Power BI dashboards to Looker, ensuring seamless data visualization and reporting.

Key Responsibilities

  • Assist in migrating of logistics databases to the new data lake in GCP BigQuery.
  • Rebuild and optimize Power BI dashboards in Looker, ensuring accuracy and performance.
  • Process, clean, and validate data integrity for analytics.
  • Collaborate with logistics teams to identify and resolve data discrepancies in dashboards.
  • Document standard logistics performance metrics and best practices for reporting.
  • Participate in cross-functional logistics projects, contributing to data-driven decision-making.

HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?

You are a student or recent graduate in Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field. You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with an interest in data visualization and business intelligence.

You have experience in data processing, cleaning and validation to ensure data integrity.

You are autonomous, organized, with a proactive mindset to drive improvements and the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders.

You speak English fluently (French is a plus).

You are proficient in SQL and familiar with Power BI, Looker. Experience with Python and knowledge of GCP BigQuery is a plus.

HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING?

This is a unique opportunity to gain deep insights into luxury logistics operations and luxury markets.

Exposure to cutting-edge BI technologies in a dynamic, international work environment

Hands-on experience in cloud data management, business intelligence, and cross-functional logistics teams collaboration.

Our company prides itself on fostering a collaborative and dynamic work environment where employees are encouraged to grow and develop their skills. With a strong focus on data-driven decision-making, we empower our team to make a significant impact in the industry while enjoying a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package.

eClerx provides business process management, analytics, and automation services to a number of Fortune 2000 enterprises, including some of the world's leading companies across financial services, cable & telecom, retail, fashion, media & entertainment, manufacturing, travel & leisure, software and high-tech. Incorporated in 2000, eClerx is one of India's leading process management and data analytics companies and is today traded on both the Bombay and National Stock Exchanges of India. eClerx employs 17,000+ people across its global sites in the US, Canada, UK, Australia, Italy, Germany, Switzerland, Dubai and Singapore, along with its delivery centers in India and Thailand. For more information, visit www.eclerx.com

eClerx is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law. We are also committed to protecting and safeguarding your personal data. Please find our policy here

Job Description

Junior Data Analyst – International Banking

____________________________________________________________

Location: Zurich, Switzerland

Type: Full-time

Vertical: Financial Markets

_______________________________________________________________________

Summary

Embark on an exciting journey with us at eClerx Switzerland AG, where you’ll take centre stage as a within eClerx’s growing global delivery organization. Your mission? Help deliver analytics and actionable insights for one of our long term, financial services, clients here in Switzerland.

Key Responsibilities

  • Analyze Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and contractual data
  • Collaborate with colleagues to build data-driven models, reporting and actionable insights
  • Present findings in a clear, concise manner for internal consumption
  • Oversee and track the implementation of actionable insights within a PMO framework

Ideal Experience

  • 1+ years of experience in data analytics or data science
  • Proficiency in programming (Python, SQL)
  • Experience in Financial Services and financial instruments
  • Experience in CRM, financial instruments or contract datasets.
  • Ability to work with structured and unstructured data.
  • Familiarity with cloud services.

Bonus Points

  • Experience using LLMs for data summarization, document intelligence, or research enhancement.
  • Familiarity with vector databases and embedding techniques.

Soft Skills

  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
  • Ability to work in a demanding, fast-paced environment while maintaining accuracy.
  • Excellent communication and problem-solving abilities.
  • Ability to handle confidential and sensitive information with discretion.

CH Work Permit

  • MUST have a valid Swiss working permit or carry an EU national passport
  • CH/EU status must be declared on your CV, otherwise your application will be automatically rejected.

About EClerx

eClerx provides business process management, analytics, and automation services to a number of Fortune 2000 enterprises, including some of the world's leading companies across financial services, cable &
column2: telecom, retail, fashion, media &amp
column3: entertainment, manufacturing, travel &amp
column4:
leisure, software and high-tech. For more information, visit www.eclerx.com

4264183769,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-avaloq-at-cleeven-4264183769?position=16&pageNum=0&refId=LfhoZWiB664iFqfZzoVdDQ%3D%3D&trackingId=pG7UJ0oKDFqFDiOZaGOk%2BA%3D%3D,Data Analyst Avaloq,CLEEVEN,"Geneva, Switzerland","Nous cherchons un.e Data Analyst pour renforcer l’analyse des données issues du core banking system Avaloq. Le poste combine des compétences en analyse de données, modélisation SQL, et compréhension des structures comptables/financières.
Analyser, structurer et extraire les données depuis les bases Avaloq pour les besoins du contrôle de gestion.
Cartographier et documenter les structures de tables pertinentes.
Construire et maintenir des requêtes SQL fiables pour les reportings financiers.
Participer à la production des rapports financiers, analyses ad hoc et contrôles internes.
Collaborer avec les équipes métiers (finance, contrôle de gestion, IT).
Être force de proposition dans l’automatisation et la fiabilisation des flux de données.
Bonne compréhension des bases de données Avaloq (ou d’un système bancaire similaire)
Expérience en contrôle de gestion / finance bancaire
Appétence pour la modélisation des données financières
Forte autonomie et capacité à monter en compétence sans support structuré
Capacité à travailler sous pression dans des cycles courts
Bon relationnel avec les équipes métiers
Expérience dans le secteur bancaire fortement appréciée (banque privée = un plus)
La connaissance d’Avaloq est un atout majeur

Nous cherchons un.e Data Analyst pour renforcer l’analyse des données issues du core banking system Avaloq. Le poste combine des compétences en analyse de données, modélisation SQL, et compréhension des structures comptables/financières.


Missions principales :

Analyser, structurer et extraire les données depuis les bases Avaloq pour les besoins du contrôle de gestion.

Cartographier et documenter les structures de tables pertinentes.

Construire et maintenir des requêtes SQL fiables pour les reportings financiers.

Participer à la production des rapports financiers, analyses ad hoc et contrôles internes.

Collaborer avec les équipes métiers (finance, contrôle de gestion, IT).

Être force de proposition dans l’automatisation et la fiabilisation des flux de données.


Compétences requises :

Techniques

Excellente maîtrise de SQL

Bonne compréhension des bases de données Avaloq (ou d’un système bancaire similaire)

Expérience en contrôle de gestion / finance bancaire

Appétence pour la modélisation des données financières


Comportementales

Forte autonomie et capacité à monter en compétence sans support structuré

Esprit analytique et rigueur

Capacité à travailler sous pression dans des cycles courts

Bon relationnel avec les équipes métiers


Profil recherché :

Expérience dans le secteur bancaire fortement appréciée (banque privée = un plus)

La connaissance d’Avaloq est un atout majeur

4254364404,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-analyst-data-at-qim-info-4254364404?position=20&pageNum=0&refId=LfhoZWiB664iFqfZzoVdDQ%3D%3D&trackingId=9I8MBFUowJoxGr5ShsM1WQ%3D%3D,Business analyst DATA,Qim info,"Vaud, Switzerland","Société d’ingénierie informatique et de services du numérique créée en 2004, Qim info est implantée en Suisse 🇨🇭 (Genève, Lausanne, Zurich & Bâle) et en France 🇫🇷 (Annecy, Lyon & Paris). Appartenant au groupe MoOngy, l’entreprise bénéficie aussi d’un réseau de développement international 🌐.

3e entreprise informatique de Suisse romande (ICT Journal), Qim info c’est surtout un ensemble de consultant.e.s capables d’intervenir à tous les niveaux d’un système d’information sur différents métiers (Études & Développement 💻, Fonctionnel 🔧, Infrastructures & Réseaux 🌐, Data 📊, DevOps 🚀...) et différents secteurs d’activités (Banque 🏦, Finance 💰, Assurance 📜, Luxe ✨, Retail 🛍️, Aéronautique ✈️...).
Avec plus de 650 collaborateurs, nous sommes toujours à la recherche de nouveaux talents ! 🌟
Nous recherchons un Business Analyst Technique / Data Analyst expérimenté ayant un passif développeur ou une solide culture technique.
Analyser et consolider les données à partir de sources hétérogènes (notamment systèmes legacy)
Écrire des requêtes SQL avancées pour extraire, croiser et structurer la donnée
Construire un modèle canonique : classes, héritages, UML…
Produire les spécifications fonctionnelles et techniques des flux de données
Modéliser les processus et flux via BPMN
Définir les contrats d’interface via Swagger Hub (REST / asynchrone)
Assurer la relation avec les parties prenantes (techniques & métiers)
Accompagner les équipes de développement en avance de phase
Ancien développeur ou profil hybride, à l’aise techniquement
Expérience avec les systèmes legacy (bases non relationnelles, documentation limitée…)
Connaissance de la modélisation de données (UML, modèle canonique)
Capacité à faire de l’archéologie fonctionnelle et à reconstituer des logiques anciennes
Bonne communication – capable de clarifier les besoins avec les utilisateurs de la donnée
Systèmes legacy (mainframe ou bases non documentées)
Premier contact : Notre équipe de chargés de recrutement est à votre écoute pour comprendre votre parcours et vos attentes 🎧.
Entretien technique : Échangez avec un de nos collaborateurs pour parler technique 🛠️.
Entretien avec un Business Manager : Découvrez les missions et projets en détail 🎯.
Expertise reconnue : Activité dans une dizaine de secteurs et une connaissance des métiers de l’IT 🌐.
Suivi RH & managérial de qualité : Accompagnement dans votre montée en compétences et vos missions au quotidien 🌟.
Culture d’entreprise : Partagez plus qu’une pause-café ! Qim tech talks, soirées annuelles et trimestrielles, Afterwork Qim... de nombreux événements sont organisés chaque année 🎉.
Satisfaction des consultants : Chez Qim info, on est bien et ce sont nos consultants qui le disent mieux que nous sur Glassdoor (note de 4,1/5) 🌟.
Nous attendons avec impatience votre candidature !

4265226112,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/digital-analytics-consultant-geneva-h-f-at-fifty-five-4265226112?position=21&pageNum=0&refId=LfhoZWiB664iFqfZzoVdDQ%3D%3D&trackingId=2Q0gTZRokqaWa%2BLiEzMr%2BA%3D%3D,Digital Analytics Consultant - Geneva (H/F),fifty-five,"Geneva, Geneva, Switzerland","fifty-five is a new kind of data company that helps brands transform with data and AI to improve their marketing operations through a combination of specialized consultancy and technology services.
As the strategic data pillar of The Brandtech Group, we offer services that combine strategy consulting, cloud services, media consulting and customer experience.

We are made up of over +320 digital experts. Digital consultants, tracking and media specialists, engineers and data scientists all work in close collaboration to provide senior-level marketing consultancy and technical support to our clients, in every type of industry, all around the world.

As a partner to advertisers from data collection to activation and exploitation, we help organizations become truly omnichannel entities that control the efficiency of their digital ecosystem and its synergies with the physical world.

Headquartered in Paris, we operate across 3 time zones from our 10 offices, located in Paris, London, Geneva, Milan, Shanghai, Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Taipei, Singapore and New York. fifty-five attaches particular importance to the well-being of its employees, which enabled it to be included in the Best Workplaces France ranking in 2018.

Within the consulting team based in Geneva, you will actively take part in delivering fifty-five's data-led projects to multiple clients. Those projects will be driven by client objectives relating to data collection, customer acquisition, onsite conversion optimisation, media-mix optimisation and digital business consulting. During these projects, you will contribute to promoting a customer-centred vision of digital marketing, based on the systematic and methodical use of data to support decisions. You will work across multiple industries including luxury, FMCG, sport, and beauty.

You will report to a Local Executive Director and will work closely with Product, Engineering and Operations Teams based in Paris. As a data analyst and consultant, you will follow an action plan, issuing step-by-step the deliverables required for successful delivery of the project. You will guarantee the integrity of analytics data as well as its analysis and interpretation in working with your team and client.

You will be responsible for the content, the format and overall quality of the outputs delivered to the client and for monitoring their operational and technical implementation where required. Based on your good understanding of our projects and our clients' needs, you will collaborate with all our teams to develop fifty-five's offer, both in terms of marketing and in terms of technical and operational delivery.

Deliver projects related to the monitoring of the client's digital activity based on key performance indicators (reporting), to onsite conversion optimization through data analysis and webtesting, to online media buy optimization and CRM
Analyse data and structure relevant information for the client's benefit, in consistency with business indicators specific to their industry (eg. mobile operators, retail, travel, etc.)
Develop a sharp operational expertise on both conversion and online media-buy topics
Meet clients' needs and pay strong attention to the quality of all deliverables
Occasional travel possible, within Switzerland or abroad (including Paris)
Master's degree (business, engineering) or equivalent diploma
Experience in digital marketing, consulting firms, marketing or business intelligence software, or media agencies
Knowledge of the main online acquisition channels: SEO, SEM and bidmanagement, display and programmatic, affiliates, email and social media
Fluent in French & English and excellent communication, oral and written
Strong analytical skills and knowledge of analysis, statistical software and data vizualization tool
Strong interest in new technologies and the digital industry

55 provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion.

4258485879,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-gas-analyst-fundamental-%E2%80%93-switzerland-at-vallum-associates-4258485879?position=25&pageNum=0&refId=LfhoZWiB664iFqfZzoVdDQ%3D%3D&trackingId=JyaeyxHpsioLL94j3JQrTw%3D%3D,"Senior Gas Analyst, Fundamental – Switzerland",Vallum Associates,"Zug, Switzerland","Senior Gas Analyst, Fundamental – Switzerland

A leading and forward-thinking energy company is looking for a Senior Analyst to join their team. This is a fantastic opportunity to work in a fast-paced environment, analysing Gas markets, supporting optimising trading strategies, and contributing to the this PnL driven desk.
Analyse UK and European Gas markets, identifying trends, risks, and opportunities.
Develop and maintain forecasting models for demand, generation, and pricing.
Support power trading activities with real-time insights and data-driven recommendations.
Monitor regulatory and policy developments impacting the energy sector.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to enhance data analytics and reporting tools.
Strong analytical skills with experience in data modelling, coding (Python/R/SQL), or power system analytics.
Knowledge of UK and European Gas markets, including trading mechanisms and regulations.
2+ years of fundamental Gas analytics experience
Proficiency in working with large datasets and visualisation tools (e.g., Power BI).
A proactive mindset, keen attention to detail, and the ability to communicate insights effectively.
A degree in a relevant field (e.g., Engineering, Economics, Mathematics, or similar).

Senior Gas Analyst, Fundamental – Switzerland


A leading and forward-thinking energy company is looking for a Senior Analyst to join their team. This is a fantastic opportunity to work in a fast-paced environment, analysing Gas markets, supporting optimising trading strategies, and contributing to the this PnL driven desk.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Analyse UK and European Gas markets, identifying trends, risks, and opportunities.
  • Develop and maintain forecasting models for demand, generation, and pricing.
  • Support power trading activities with real-time insights and data-driven recommendations.
  • Monitor regulatory and policy developments impacting the energy sector.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to enhance data analytics and reporting tools.


What They’re Looking For:

  • Strong analytical skills with experience in data modelling, coding (Python/R/SQL), or power system analytics.
  • Knowledge of UK and European Gas markets, including trading mechanisms and regulations.
  • 2+ years of fundamental Gas analytics experience
  • Proficiency in working with large datasets and visualisation tools (e.g., Power BI).
  • A proactive mindset, keen attention to detail, and the ability to communicate insights effectively.
  • A degree in a relevant field (e.g., Engineering, Economics, Mathematics, or similar).

Dans le cadre de notre accompagnement pour le secteur bancaire nous recherchons un expert Microsoft Power BI.
· Recueillir et documenter les besoins identifiés auprès des utilisateurs de rapports
· Identifier et communiquer les besoins en données identifiés pour les rapports
· Engagement envers la qualité des données et la promotion d’un service de haute qualité
· Support client pour les problèmes fonctionnels, opérationnels et techniques des systèmes
Master, diplôme d’Ingénieur en informatique ou équivalent,
Connaissance de Microsoft PowerBI et Fabric,
Maitrise du français et de l’anglais,
Créatif, capable de résoudre des problèmes et de travailler en équipe,

Descriptif : Expert Power BI


Contexte


Dans le cadre de notre accompagnement pour le secteur bancaire nous recherchons un expert Microsoft Power BI.


Mission


· Recueillir et documenter les besoins identifiés auprès des utilisateurs de rapports

· Implémentation de rapports avec PowerBI

· Identifier et communiquer les besoins en données identifiés pour les rapports

· Engagement envers la qualité des données et la promotion d’un service de haute qualité

· Support client pour les problèmes fonctionnels, opérationnels et techniques des systèmes

· Excellentes compétences relationnelles.



Profil


  • Master, diplôme d’Ingénieur en informatique ou équivalent,
  • Connaissance de Microsoft PowerBI et Fabric,
  • Connaissance Spark,
  • Connaissance SQL,
  • Maitrise du français et de l’anglais,
  • Créatif, capable de résoudre des problèmes et de travailler en équipe,
  • Capacité d'adaptation,
  • Résidence en Suisse.

4235447029,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/cat-data-and-tools-analyst-6-month-contract-at-partnerre-4235447029?position=27&pageNum=0&refId=LfhoZWiB664iFqfZzoVdDQ%3D%3D&trackingId=dDlOgkJa6gx%2F85wmfaFJng%3D%3D,Cat Data and Tools Analyst (6 month contract),PartnerRe,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","PartnerRe is a leading, privately owned, multi-line global reinsurer with a reputation of financial stability and strength, and a commitment to rebuilding businesses and communities after risk events around the world.

Our mission is to continue to be a financially stable and predictable business partner, supporting our clients with solutions tailored to their needs, delivering superior returns to our owner, providing rewarding opportunities for our people and making a positive contribution to society. To achieve this, we live by our values of Integrity, Performance, Collaboration, Straightforward Communication and Respect and Care.

Core to The PartnerRe Experience is our global nature. No matter where you sit in the company, you are part of something bigger. Our teams represent our truly international mindset, forging connections across office locations and all levels of the organization and building a network of mutual success. The result is a day-to-day experience that will allow you to:
Connect with a community of experts
View Home - PartnerRe Experience e-book to find out more about what it’s like to work at PartnerRe.
We are always looking for bright, proactive individuals to join our team!
Please follow our Careers page for all updates on new positions. We look forward to receiving your application.
PartnerRe is an equal opportunities employer.
Please join our company LinkedIn Page for all updates on new positions that are coming live.

The position is within the Cat Tools and Technology team, which is part of the Catastrophe Underwriting Office responsible for research, modeling, pricing, and portfolio analytics of natural catastrophes (Cat).
The Tools and Technology team is leading the developments of all the Cat applications in collaboration with IT to drive innovation and efficiency in managing risk of natural catastrophes.
This temporary role supports the Cat Tools and Technology team in ongoing projects focusing on improving the reporting and analytics capabilities of the Catastrophe Underwriting Office unit.
In more detail your main tasks are to:
Enhance our existing reporting dashboard to improve efficiency and accuracy in assessing data quality and drivers of portfolio changes.
Replace existing Excel reports and integrate them into R Shiny dashboard.
Automate the production of existing reports through R Markdown.
The role will be based in Zurich.
You are passionate to apply your strong quantitative skills to the development of tools supporting the automation of processes and delivering business solutions.
The ideal candidate would have the following qualifications and personal qualities:
Master degree in computer science, data science, natural sciences (Climatology, Hydrology, Seismology, or similar), or a related quantitative field
Strong programming skills in R or Python and knowledge in databases (e.g., SQL or Snowflake)
Knowledge of R Shiny and R Markdown is a plus
Interest in data manipulation and data visualization
Pro-active, solution oriented with a high level of self initiative
Ability to work well in a team and to contribute towards common goals

PartnerRe provides a working environment in which diversity is valued, where all employees feel welcome, respected, and empowered to perform at their best. We invite you to learn more about D&I at PartnerRe.

PartnerRe is a leading, privately owned, multi-line global reinsurer with a reputation of financial stability and strength, and a commitment to rebuilding businesses and communities after risk events around the world.

Our mission is to continue to be a financially stable and predictable business partner, supporting our clients with solutions tailored to their needs, delivering superior returns to our owner, providing rewarding opportunities for our people and making a positive contribution to society. To achieve this, we live by our values of Integrity, Performance, Collaboration, Straightforward Communication and Respect and Care.

Core to The PartnerRe Experience is our global nature. No matter where you sit in the company, you are part of something bigger. Our teams represent our truly international mindset, forging connections across office locations and all levels of the organization and building a network of mutual success. The result is a day-to-day experience that will allow you to:

Shape your own career

Grow in a supportive environment

Connect with a community of experts

Make an impact

View Home - PartnerRe Experience e-book to find out more about what it’s like to work at PartnerRe.

We are always looking for bright, proactive individuals to join our team!

Please follow our Careers page for all updates on new positions. We look forward to receiving your application.

PartnerRe is an equal opportunities employer.

Please join our company LinkedIn Page for all updates on new positions that are coming live.



Job Description

About this job:

The position is within the Cat Tools and Technology team, which is part of the Catastrophe Underwriting Office responsible for research, modeling, pricing, and portfolio analytics of natural catastrophes (Cat).

The Tools and Technology team is leading the developments of all the Cat applications in collaboration with IT to drive innovation and efficiency in managing risk of natural catastrophes.



About the role:

This temporary role supports the Cat Tools and Technology team in ongoing projects focusing on improving the reporting and analytics capabilities of the Catastrophe Underwriting Office unit.

In more detail your main tasks are to:

  • Enhance our existing reporting dashboard to improve efficiency and accuracy in assessing data quality and drivers of portfolio changes.
  • Replace existing Excel reports and integrate them into R Shiny dashboard.
  • Automate the production of existing reports through R Markdown.

The role will be based in Zurich.



Qualifications

About you:

You are passionate to apply your strong quantitative skills to the development of tools supporting the automation of processes and delivering business solutions.

The ideal candidate would have the following qualifications and personal qualities:

  • Master degree in computer science, data science, natural sciences (Climatology, Hydrology, Seismology, or similar), or a related quantitative field
  • Strong programming skills in R or Python and knowledge in databases (e.g., SQL or Snowflake)
  • Knowledge of R Shiny and R Markdown is a plus
  • Interest in data manipulation and data visualization
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Pro-active, solution oriented with a high level of self initiative
  • Ability to work well in a team and to contribute towards common goals
  • Proficient (written and verbal) in English

Additional Information





PartnerRe provides a working environment in which diversity is valued, where all employees feel welcome, respected, and empowered to perform at their best. We invite you to learn more about D&

Professionelles Consulting-Umfeld auf anspruchsvollem, internationalem Niveau mit namhaften Kunden aus den unterschiedlichsten Wirtschaftsbranchen

Du bist ein Young Professional und suchst eine Herausforderung im Bereich Datenanalyse, Marktforschung und Unternehmensberatung als:


(Junior) Consultant


Pensum: 100 Prozent Stellenantritt: nach Vereinbarung


Aufgaben

  • Betreuung von Forschungs- und Beratungsmandaten über alle Phasen des Projekt-managements

  • Durchführung von Workshops

  • Erstellen von Kunden- und Marktanalysen

  • Teilnahme bei Kundenmeetings

  • Unterstützung bei der Kundengewinnung


Qualifikation

  • Masterabschluss in Sozial- oder Wirtschaftswissenschaften

    (Universität oder Fachhochschule)

  • Zahlenaffin und Kompetenzen in empirischen Methoden sowie R-/R-Stuio-Kenntnisse

  • Sicheres Auftreten und gute kommunikative Fähigkeiten in Deutsch und Englisch

  • Hohes Engagement, belastbar und effiziente Arbeitsweise

  • Erste Berufserfahrung im Bereich Marktforschung, Beratung oder Marketing von Vorteil


Benefits

  • Professionelles Consulting-Umfeld auf anspruchsvollem, internationalem Niveau mit namhaften Kunden aus den unterschiedlichsten Wirtschaftsbranchen

  • Kleines, dynamisches Team im Zürcher Technopark – vernetzt mit Spezialist:innen in der DACH-Region

  • Selbstständige und flexible Arbeitseinteilung mit Möglichkeit von Home Office

  • Einblicke in das gesamte Unternehmen

  • Offenes und entspanntes Arbeitsklima, wo eigene Ideen auf Resonanz stossen.


Wir sind ein international tätiges Beratungs- und Researchunternehmen, spezialisiert auf eine effiziente und effektive Marktbearbeitung. Wir verknüpfen Zielgruppen, Touchpoints und Inhalte und holen so messbar das Maximum aus den Investitionen unserer Auftraggeber.


Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung!

4264119350,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/online-data-analyst-at-telus-digital-4264119350?position=32&pageNum=0&refId=LfhoZWiB664iFqfZzoVdDQ%3D%3D&trackingId=om8iNuRU3P0oAHzMpgbI8g%3D%3D,Online Data Analyst,TELUS Digital,"Geneva, Switzerland","Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.
A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.
Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.
Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

4265338517,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-engineer-intern-at-vf-corporation-4265338517?position=36&pageNum=0&refId=LfhoZWiB664iFqfZzoVdDQ%3D%3D&trackingId=SJkbEsqSs9fFNGQ9tzCgpg%3D%3D,Data Engineer Intern,VF Corporation,"Stabio, Ticino, Switzerland","Be a dreamer, make the difference! Join #VFInternship in our EMEA HQ in Stabio, Switzerland as Data Engineer Intern for Digital Technologies.
Must be graduating within or after November 2025
These requirements are related to local legislation hence there is no flexibility in the application.

As Data Engineer Intern you will build and maintain the data pipelines that power analytics and machine learning, ensuring reliable, scalable access to high-quality data in our Global Data Foundation platform.
By transforming raw data into structured insights, they enable smarter business decisions and accelerate innovation.
Below a list focusing on the most impactful responsibilities:
Build and maintain scalable data pipelines and integrations to ensure timely and reliable data availability for analytics and reporting.
Transform and clean raw data from multiple sources into structured formats to support business intelligence and machine learning use cases.
Monitor and optimize data workflows and storage solutions to improve performance, reduce costs, and ensure data quality.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g., Data Scientists, Analysts, Product Owners) to understand data needs and deliver actionable solutions.
Document and maintain data architecture, processes, and best practices to support team knowledge sharing and onboarding.
Support other initiatives and projects as part of the Global Data Engineering team, contributing to innovation and continuous improvement efforts.
What will make a candidate successful?
Demonstrates strong proficiency in SQL and Python for data manipulation, transformation, and automation.
Understands data architecture principles and is familiar with cloud platforms (Azure) and data platforms Databricks. With modern data frameworks like Spark, Databricks, dbt.
Communicates effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders to align on data requirements and deliverables.
Shows attention to detail in ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and documentation.
Learns quickly and adapts to evolving technologies and project priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Collaborates proactively within cross-functional teams to support data-driven decision-making.
Data modeling intuition: understands how to structure data for performance, scalability, and usability, not just storage.
Pipeline reliability mindset: builds with monitoring, testing, and failure recovery in mind, ensuring robust data flows.
Code quality discipline: writes clean, modular, and well-documented code that others can easily understand and build upon.
Curiosity-driven problem solving: proactively explores data issues and business questions, going beyond assigned tasks.
A master degree in STEM disciplines is required a pre-requisite given the nature of the role.
We are looking for someone who has demonstrated:
The ability to understand the data flow in the VF business processes.
The capability to troubleshoot complex data issues and propose a feasible solution.
An understanding of modern data architecture, cloud computing, traditional AI and GenAI.
An expertise in using SQL and Python like a master.
A keen interest in exploring new technologies for data management and GenAI.

The VF EMEA Internship Program is a 12-month journey designed to develop and empower emerging talent at the start of their careers. As a company committed to unleashing human potential—fueled by the ideas, energy, and dedication of our people—you can expect a structured learning path and rich hands-on experience, including:
Collaborate on an internal consulting group project
Gain on-the-ground insight about our brands during a store visit day
Connect through networking opportunities with peers and senior leadership

In the role of Data Engineer Intern you will work with an international team worldwide, discovering all secrets of how manage data in a successful enterprise. We will support you with ad hoc trainings, coaching and networking opportunities across all VF brands and shared functions.
We want you to focus on what matters, that’s why we offer comprehensive benefits that encourage mental, physical, and financial well-being. You will enjoy:
A supportive feedback-based culture where respect and integrity guide us
An inclusive international environment where people of diverse backgrounds, lifestyles and nationalities work together
Being part of an iconic lifestyle brand in a multi-brand, multi country organization
On-site gym offering health and well-being initiatives, break out areas with complimentary drinks
A discount card with 50% on all VF brands

As an equal opportunity employer, we strive to foster a culture of belonging based on respect, connection, openness and authenticity.We are committed to building and maintaining a workplace that celebrates the diversity of our associates, allowing them to bring their authentic selves to work every day.
If you like what you have read and want to join our team then we would like to hear from you!
ARE YOU IN? Apply now – early application increases your chances!

Be a dreamer, make the difference! Join #VFInternship in our EMEA HQ in Stabio, Switzerland as Data Engineer Intern for Digital Technologies.

Eligibility Requirements:

  • EU / EEA citizenship
  • Must be graduating within or after November 2025

These requirements are related to local legislation hence there is no flexibility in the application.

Let’s talk about the role!

As Data Engineer Intern you will build and maintain the data pipelines that power analytics and machine learning, ensuring reliable, scalable access to high-quality data in our Global Data Foundation platform.

By transforming raw data into structured insights, they enable smarter business decisions and accelerate innovation.

Below a list focusing on the most impactful responsibilities:

  • Build and maintain scalable data pipelines and integrations to ensure timely and reliable data availability for analytics and reporting.
  • Transform and clean raw data from multiple sources into structured formats to support business intelligence and machine learning use cases.
  • Monitor and optimize data workflows and storage solutions to improve performance, reduce costs, and ensure data quality.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g., Data Scientists, Analysts, Product Owners) to understand data needs and deliver actionable solutions.
  • Document and maintain data architecture, processes, and best practices to support team knowledge sharing and onboarding.
  • Support other initiatives and projects as part of the Global Data Engineering team, contributing to innovation and continuous improvement efforts.

What You Bring

What will make a candidate successful?

  • Demonstrates strong proficiency in SQL and Python for data manipulation, transformation, and automation.
  • Understands data architecture principles and is familiar with cloud platforms (Azure) and data platforms Databricks. With modern data frameworks like Spark, Databricks, dbt.
  • Communicates effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders to align on data requirements and deliverables.
  • Shows attention to detail in ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and documentation.
  • Learns quickly and adapts to evolving technologies and project priorities in a fast-paced environment.
  • Collaborates proactively within cross-functional teams to support data-driven decision-making.

Competences Required:

  • Data modeling intuition: understands how to structure data for performance, scalability, and usability, not just storage.
  • Pipeline reliability mindset: builds with monitoring, testing, and failure recovery in mind, ensuring robust data flows.
  • Code quality discipline: writes clean, modular, and well-documented code that others can easily understand and build upon.
  • Curiosity-driven problem solving: proactively explores data issues and business questions, going beyond assigned tasks.

A master degree in STEM disciplines is required a pre-requisite given the nature of the role.

We are looking for someone who has demonstrated:

  • The ability to understand the data flow in the VF business processes.
  • The capability to troubleshoot complex data issues and propose a feasible solution.
  • An understanding of modern data architecture, cloud computing, traditional AI and GenAI.
  • An expertise in using SQL and Python like a master.
  • A keen interest in exploring new technologies for data management and GenAI.

What’s In It For You

The VF EMEA Internship Program is a 12-month journey designed to develop and empower emerging talent at the start of their careers. As a company committed to unleashing human potential—fueled by the ideas, energy, and dedication of our people—you can expect a structured learning path and rich hands-on experience, including:

  • Participate in dedicated skill-building workshops
  • Collaborate on an internal consulting group project
  • Gain on-the-ground insight about our brands during a store visit day
  • Connect through networking opportunities with peers and senior leadership

In the role of Data Engineer Intern you will work with an international team worldwide, discovering all secrets of how manage data in a successful enterprise. We will support you with ad hoc trainings, coaching and networking opportunities across all VF brands and shared functions.

We want you to focus on what matters, that’s why we offer comprehensive benefits that encourage mental, physical, and financial well-being. You will enjoy:

  • A supportive feedback-based culture where respect and integrity guide us
  • An inclusive international environment where people of diverse backgrounds, lifestyles and nationalities work together
  • Being part of an iconic lifestyle brand in a multi-brand, multi country organization
  • On-site gym offering health and well-being initiatives, break out areas with complimentary drinks
  • A discount card with 50% on all VF brands

Free to Be, Inclusion &
column2:
Diversity

As an equal opportunity employer, we strive to foster a culture of belonging based on respect, connection, openness and authenticity.We are committed to building and maintaining a workplace that celebrates the diversity of our associates, allowing them to bring their authentic selves to work every day.

If you like what you have read and want to join our team then we would like to hear from you!

ARE YOU IN? Apply now – early application increases your chances!
