4264113332,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/online-data-analyst-at-telus-digital-4264113332?position=37&pageNum=0&refId=LfhoZWiB664iFqfZzoVdDQ%3D%3D&trackingId=24iOt2EKcQd6gUJgEXhC0g%3D%3D,Online Data Analyst,TELUS Digital,"Lugano, Ticino, Switzerland","Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.
A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.
Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.
Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

4264136745,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-center-operations-analyst-at-servicenow-4264136745?position=38&pageNum=0&refId=LfhoZWiB664iFqfZzoVdDQ%3D%3D&trackingId=WIFEXJ99sJbjboC82jcN%2FA%3D%3D,Data Center Operations Analyst,ServiceNow,"Opfikon, Zurich, Switzerland","Company Description

It all started in sunny San Diego, California in 2004 when a visionary engineer, Fred Luddy, saw the potential to transform how we work. Fast forward to today — ServiceNow stands as a global market leader, bringing innovative AI-enhanced technology to over 8,100 customers, including 85% of the Fortune 500®. Our intelligent cloud-based platform seamlessly connects people, systems, and processes to empower organizations to find smarter, faster, and better ways to work. But this is just the beginning of our journey. Join us as we pursue our purpose to make the world work better for everyone.

Data Center Operations Team manages the planning, hardware installation and configuration, optimization, operations, and ongoing maintenance of the computer/data center. Oversees systems performance, the monitoring of equipment and the management of vendor relationships. Responsible for capacity planning and continual assessments for process improvement to ensure that processes are well-documented, sustainable, and scalable. Monitors ongoing practices to ensure consistency with policies, compliance regulations and control requirements. Selects, develops, and evaluates personnel to ensure the efficient operation of the function. Roles can have an internal or external client focus. May involve company-hosted, Web-enabled solutions or may include project-based jobs in conjunction with Professional Services and outsourcing functions.
This role is primarily based at our data centre facility in Geneva.
What You Get To Do In This Role
Prioritize and assign trouble tickets to data center engineers.
Manage the performance of data center operations with varying skills across Switzerland location.
Ensure effective and efficient management of day-to-day data center operations including queue management, 7/24 shift arrangement and hardware logistics.
Subject matter expert across all aspects in data center operations especially in DCIM integrations.
Ensure all operational KPIs (Key Performance Indicators) and metrics are being measured and met.
Responsible for reporting key metrics to peer teams.
Inspire and guide improvement in team process, technology innovation and automation.
Manage Large Scale Events, Incident management - responsible for communications to executive stakeholders.
Manage and build workflows for data centers operations.
Has a solid understanding of all critical Mechanical & Electrical infrastructure.
Recommend, document, and oversee policies and procedures to meet industry best practices and to meet required SLAs (Service Level Agreement).
Maintain the on-call schedule coordinating absence and vacations.
Be passionate about the quality and quantity of services being provided, and continuously strive to improve our Customer Experience.
To be successful in this role you have:
4+ years of experience in data center operations management
Experience of managing the planning, hardware installation and configuration, optimization, operations, and ongoing maintenance of the computer/data center.
Holistic experience of overseeing systems performance, the monitoring of equipment and the management of vendor relationships.
Experience of capacity planning and continual assessments for DC.
Good knowledge of data center facilities and infrastructure including power, HVAC, structured cabling, rack management and security.
Experience managing vendors in a data center environment.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to multi-task several unrelated issues.
General documentation skills with particular emphasis on technical processes and standards.
Knowledge and experience in ITIL process methodologies a plus.
Proven ability to function in ambiguous situations with a record of success.
Excellent communication, customer focus, problem solving, conflict management, time management and interpersonal skills required.
A deep passion for Sustainability and compliance to support our customers global impact responsibilities .
Some travel would be required--domestically and internationally.
Although data center experience is key, the successful candidate will be self-motivated and positive with a passion for developing new skills.
What You Can Expect From Us

At ServiceNow, we make work better for everyone – including our own employees. We know that your best work happens when you live your best life and share your unique talents, so we do everything we can to make that possible for our employees. Win as a Team is part of our culture, and we aspire to wow our customers. We stay hungry and humble and focus on creating belonging. Sustainability, inclusivity, and diversity are key focus areas within our business framework so that we have transparency, equity, and accountability to deliver meaningful, measurable change. With our vision and dedication for a better future already underway. Join us on this journey!

In addition to a competitive salary, supportive teams, and a real opportunity to progress in your career with a forward-thinking organisation, we provide resources to help you and your loved ones be well. From benefits plans and programs, to mental health resources that offer coaching and 24/7 support, to family support resources and parental leave programs – we want to help you take care of yourself and your loved ones. Below is a glimpse into even more of our offerings or click here for a full list:
Along with holidays, we have company-wide designated global well-being days where everyone is off and can spend time doing what matters most.
Good working culture to support the balance you need in both work and life.
A learning experience platform built using our own technology, to support your learning and development goals as well as a tuition reimbursement program.
We also have team building activities, various employee belonging groups, volunteering, and community outreach programs.

We approach our distributed world of work with flexibility and trust. Work personas (flexible, remote, or required in office) are categories that are assigned to ServiceNow employees depending on the nature of their work and their assigned work location. Learn more here. To determine eligibility for a work persona, ServiceNow may confirm the distance between your primary residence and the closest ServiceNow office using a third-party service.

ServiceNow is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. In addition, all qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with legal requirements.

We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are unable to use this online application and need an alternative method to apply, please contact globaltalentss@servicenow.com for assistance.

For positions requiring access to controlled technology subject to export control regulations, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may be required to obtain export control approval from government authorities for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by relevant export control authorities.

  • Recommend, document, and oversee policies and procedures to meet industry best practices and to meet required SLAs (Service Level Agreement).
  • Maintain the on-call schedule coordinating absence and vacations.
  • Be passionate about the quality and quantity of services being provided, and continuously strive to improve our Customer Experience.

    • Qualifications

    To be successful in this role you have:

    • 4+ years of experience in data center operations management
    • Experience of managing the planning, hardware installation and configuration, optimization, operations, and ongoing maintenance of the computer/data center.
    • Holistic experience of overseeing systems performance, the monitoring of equipment and the management of vendor relationships.
    • Experience of capacity planning and continual assessments for DC.
    • Good knowledge of data center facilities and infrastructure including power, HVAC, structured cabling, rack management and security.
    • Experience managing vendors in a data center environment.
    • Strong analytical skills with the ability to multi-task several unrelated issues.
    • General documentation skills with particular emphasis on technical processes and standards.
    • Knowledge and experience in ITIL process methodologies a plus.
    • Proven ability to function in ambiguous situations with a record of success.
    • Excellent communication, customer focus, problem solving, conflict management, time management and interpersonal skills required.
    • A deep passion for Sustainability and compliance to support our customers global impact responsibilities .
    • Some travel would be required--domestically and internationally.

    Although data center experience is key, the successful candidate will be self-motivated and positive with a passion for developing new skills.

    At ServiceNow, we make work better for everyone – including our own employees. We know that your best work happens when you live your best life and share your unique talents, so we do everything we can to make that possible for our employees. With our vision and dedication for a better future already underway. Join us on this journey!

    Benefits

    In addition to a competitive salary, supportive teams, and a real opportunity to progress in your career with a forward-thinking organisation, we provide resources to help you and your loved ones be well. From benefits plans and programs, to mental health resources that offer coaching and 24/7 support, to family support resources and parental leave programs – we want to help you take care of yourself and your loved ones. Below is a glimpse into even more of our offerings or click here for a full list:

    • Along with holidays, we have company-wide designated global well-being days where everyone is off and can spend time doing what matters most.
    • Good working culture to support the balance you need in both work and life.
    • Parental leave programs.
    • Childcare and caregiving benefits.
    • A learning experience platform built using our own technology, to support your learning and development goals as well as a tuition reimbursement program.
    • A global, cross-functional mentoring program.
      • We also have team building activities, various employee belonging groups, volunteering, and community outreach programs.

    Work Personas

    We approach our distributed world of work with flexibility and trust. Work personas (flexible, remote, or required in office) are categories that are assigned to ServiceNow employees depending on the nature of their work and their assigned work location. Learn more here. To determine eligibility for a work persona, ServiceNow may confirm the distance between your primary residence and the closest ServiceNow office using a third-party service.

    ServiceNow is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. In addition, all qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with legal requirements.

    Accommodations

    We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are unable to use this online application and need an alternative method to apply, please contact globaltalentss@servicenow.com for assistance.

All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by relevant export control authorities.

Nous recherchons un/e Data Engineer afin de garantir la performance, la fiabilité et l’optimisation des pipelines de données sur la plateforme Databricks (intégrée à AWS), dans un environnement exigeant et en constante évolution.
Concevoir, développer et maintenir des pipelines de données robustes sur Databricks.
Optimiser les workflows de données et garantir leur disponibilité, performance et intégrité.
Colaborer avec les équipes Cloud et Frontend pour unifier les sources de données.
Analyser les performances de la plateforme, détecter les points de friction et proposer des améliorations.
Assurer une documentation technique claire et rigoureuse des process ETL.
Maintenir une veille active sur les évolutions Databricks / Spark.
5 ans d'expérience minimum en tant que Data Engineer, dont une expérience significative sur Databricks.
Excellentes compétences analytiques et esprit de synthèse.
Une expérience dans le domaine de l’énergie ou du trading est un plus.
📍 Lieu de travail : Suisse (résidence en Suisse non obligatoire)

🎯 Mission


Nous recherchons un/e Data Engineer afin de garantir la performance, la fiabilité et l’optimisation des pipelines de données sur la plateforme Databricks (intégrée à AWS), dans un environnement exigeant et en constante évolution.



🛠️ Responsabilités principales


Concevoir, développer et maintenir des pipelines de données robustes sur Databricks.

Optimiser les workflows de données et garantir leur disponibilité, performance et intégrité.

Colaborer avec les équipes Cloud et Frontend pour unifier les sources de données.

Analyser les performances de la plateforme, détecter les points de friction et proposer des améliorations.

Assurer une documentation technique claire et rigoureuse des process ETL.

Maintenir une veille active sur les évolutions Databricks / Spark.



🎓 Profil recherché


🧠 Compétences techniques requises


5 ans d'expérience minimum en tant que Data Engineer, dont une expérience significative sur Databricks.

Maîtrise de PySpark, SQL, Python.

Une première expérience sur AWS.


✅ Compétences et qualifications additionnelles


Excellentes compétences analytiques et esprit de synthèse.

Une expérience dans le domaine de l’énergie ou du trading est un plus.



📌 Informations complémentaires


📍 Lieu de travail : Suisse (résidence en Suisse non obligatoire)

🧑‍💼 Expérience : Confirmé (5ans et +)

💼 Télétravail : 1 à 2 jours par semaine



🗣️ Langues :


Français : Courant

Anglais : Avancé (B2/C1)

4264226689,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/quantitative-researcher-intern-at-garda-capital-partners-4264226689?position=44&pageNum=0&refId=LfhoZWiB664iFqfZzoVdDQ%3D%3D&trackingId=D4%2Bx2WDXkTuX%2FuHKaOKiJQ%3D%3D,Quantitative Researcher Intern,Garda Capital Partners,"Geneva, Geneva, Switzerland","Garda Capital Partners (Garda) is a multi-billion dollar alternative investment firm with over 21 years of experience deploying relative value strategies across fixed income markets for institutional investors. Garda's primary offices are located in Wayzata, New York City, West Palm Beach, Geneva, Zug, Copenhagen, Singapore, and Scottsdale.

Garda is looking to hire a Quantitative Researcher Intern to join the Quantitative Investment Research team in Geneva or Zug, for 4-8 months starting in 2025. The candidate will support portfolio managers, help implement solutions for trading and risk systems, and in the course of the internship be exposed to the analytics used in trading while working closely with a mentor for guidance and feedback.
Assist in the development of data driven strategies to complement investment decisions.
Support the team's research process, including data collection and analysis, prototyping, back-testing, and performance monitoring.
Conduct an original research project over the duration of the internship.
Pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's Degree in statistics, financial engineering, applied math, finance, computer science, or similar quantitative or technical discipline.
Knowledge and interest in financial markets.
Intellectual curiosity and motivation to innovate and improve.

Garda Capital Partners (Garda) is a multi-billion dollar alternative investment firm with over 21 years of experience deploying relative value strategies across fixed income markets for institutional investors. Garda's primary offices are located in Wayzata, New York City, West Palm Beach, Geneva, Zug, Copenhagen, Singapore, and Scottsdale.

Garda is looking to hire a Quantitative Researcher Intern to join the Quantitative Investment Research team in Geneva or Zug, for 4-8 months starting in 2025. The candidate will support portfolio managers, help implement solutions for trading and risk systems, and in the course of the internship be exposed to the analytics used in trading while working closely with a mentor for guidance and feedback.

Position Responsibilities

  • Assist in the development of data driven strategies to complement investment decisions.
  • Support the team's research process, including data collection and analysis, prototyping, back-testing, and performance monitoring.
  • Conduct an original research project over the duration of the internship.

Qualifications &
column2:
Desired Skills

  • Pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's Degree in statistics, financial engineering, applied math, finance, computer science, or similar quantitative or technical discipline.
  • Exceptional quantitative &
column3: programming skills (Python &amp
column4:
SQL).
  • Knowledge and interest in financial markets.
  • Strong communication skills.
  • Ability to work independently.
  • Intellectual curiosity and motivation to innovate and improve.

4264120037,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/online-data-analyst-at-telus-digital-4264120037?position=47&pageNum=0&refId=LfhoZWiB664iFqfZzoVdDQ%3D%3D&trackingId=kJZAJqzCftEujEsIDGSWVQ%3D%3D,Online Data Analyst,TELUS Digital,"Schwyz, Switzerland","Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.
A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.
Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.
Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

4267664655,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/energiewirtschafter-in-80-100-%25-m-w-d-at-eniwa-ag-4267664655?position=48&pageNum=0&refId=LfhoZWiB664iFqfZzoVdDQ%3D%3D&trackingId=DKFiasOn7rjyIYB2mTR3Cw%3D%3D,Energiewirtschafter/in 80 - 100 % (m/w/d),Eniwa AG,"Buchs, Aargau, Switzerland","Werde Teil unseres Teams und gestalte die Zukunft der Energiewirtschaft mit!

In dieser Aufgabe stellst du sicher, dass unsere Energiewirtschaftsdaten und Verträge über die gesamte Wertschöpfungskette hinweg eine hohe Qualität aufweisen. Mit deiner Arbeit bist du ein aktiver Teil unseres Teams und leistest einen wesentlichen Beitrag zum transparenten und korrekten Managen unserer Energiewirtschaftsportfolios (Strom/Gas).
Pflegen der Beschaffungen und Kundendaten in den EDM und PFM-Systemen
Tägliche Abwicklung der Marktkommunikation zwischen den Marktakteuren (VNB, BGV, Lieferanten) gemäss den aktuellen Marktregeln
Tägliche und monatliche Validierung der Messdaten, inklusive Füllstandsanzeige, Ersatzwertbildung und Nachforderung von Messdaten.
Du erstellst täglich Top-Down- und Bottom-Up-Prognosen
Aufsetzen und Testen der Kommunikation für den Datenaustausch zwischen den Marktakteuren.
Überwachung und Freigabe der monatlichen Abrechnungsmessdaten
Weiterentwicklung von Instrumenten zur Datenanalyse und -überwachung sowie Erstellung und Interpretation von Datenanalysen (z.B. in Excel, Python, Power BI)
Du übernimmst interne Projekte und hilfst, das Team weiterzuentwickeln
Technische Ausbildung mit erster Erfahrung in der Energiebranche (gerne auch motivierte Quereinsteiger)
Erfahrung in der Verarbeitung und Analyse von grossen Datenmengen und du arbeitest gerne mit Excel, Python, PowerBI und SQL
Interesse im Umgang mit Zahlen und Daten sowie hohe Affinität zu IT-Systemen und analytische Fähigkeiten
Übernahme von Projektaufgaben zur Weiterentwicklung und Optimierung von Prozesse in der Energiewirtschaft
Strukturierte Arbeitsweise, hohes Qualitätsbewusstsein und Zuverlässigkeit
Kundenorientiert, engagiert, teamorientiert und überzeugend durch kompetentes und sicheres Auftreten

Werde Teil unseres Teams und gestalte die Zukunft der Energiewirtschaft mit!

In dieser Aufgabe stellst du sicher, dass unsere Energiewirtschaftsdaten und Verträge über die gesamte Wertschöpfungskette hinweg eine hohe Qualität aufweisen. Mit deiner Arbeit bist du ein aktiver Teil unseres Teams und leistest einen wesentlichen Beitrag zum transparenten und korrekten Managen unserer Energiewirtschaftsportfolios (Strom/Gas).


Dein Aufgabengebiet

  • Pflegen der Beschaffungen und Kundendaten in den EDM und PFM-Systemen
  • Kalkulieren von Kunden-Angeboten
  • Tägliche Abwicklung der Marktkommunikation zwischen den Marktakteuren (VNB, BGV, Lieferanten) gemäss den aktuellen Marktregeln
  • Tägliche und monatliche Validierung der Messdaten, inklusive Füllstandsanzeige, Ersatzwertbildung und Nachforderung von Messdaten.
  • Du erstellst täglich Top-Down- und Bottom-Up-Prognosen
  • Du stellst den Lieferantenwechselprozesses sicher
  • Aufsetzen und Testen der Kommunikation für den Datenaustausch zwischen den Marktakteuren.
  • Überwachung und Freigabe der monatlichen Abrechnungsmessdaten
  • Weiterentwicklung von Instrumenten zur Datenanalyse und -überwachung sowie Erstellung und Interpretation von Datenanalysen (z.B. in Excel, Python, Power BI)
  • Dokumentation von Datenfluss basierten Prozessen.
  • Du übernimmst interne Projekte und hilfst, das Team weiterzuentwickeln


Dein Profil

  • Technische Ausbildung mit erster Erfahrung in der Energiebranche (gerne auch motivierte Quereinsteiger)
  • Erfahrung mit Energiedatenmanagement-Systemen von Vorteil
  • Erfahrung in der Verarbeitung und Analyse von grossen Datenmengen und du arbeitest gerne mit Excel, Python, PowerBI und SQL
  • Interesse im Umgang mit Zahlen und Daten sowie hohe Affinität zu IT-Systemen und analytische Fähigkeiten
  • Übernahme von Projektaufgaben zur Weiterentwicklung und Optimierung von Prozesse in der Energiewirtschaft
  • Strukturierte Arbeitsweise, hohes Qualitätsbewusstsein und Zuverlässigkeit
  • Kundenorientiert, engagiert, teamorientiert und überzeugend durch kompetentes und sicheres Auftreten

Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

  • In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
  • Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.



Qualification Path


No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.

4265987017,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/information-technology-support-specialist-at-avaso-technology-solutions-4265987017?position=2&pageNum=2&refId=sYtKpF0XoYcTuh1clzt11Q%3D%3D&trackingId=g3Nw5LRg%2FQzRtLuhczsRYQ%3D%3D,Information Technology Support Specialist,AVASO Technology Solutions,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Job Opportunity: Onsite Support Engineer at AVASO Technology

AVASO Technology is a global leader in providing IT solutions and services, specializing in offering top-tier support and managed services. We are committed to delivering cutting-edge technology solutions to our clients worldwide. If you’re a passionate IT professional with hands-on experience in desktop support, join us at AVASO to help businesses thrive with reliable and efficient IT services.

We are seeking an experienced Onsite Support Engineer to join our team in Location: Zurich, Switzerland . The successful candidate will provide technical support, troubleshooting, and IT assistance to end users. This role requires someone with strong technical skills and a customer-focused approach.
Provide on-site and remote desktop support for users, ensuring issues are resolved quickly and efficiently.
Troubleshoot and resolve hardware, software, and network-related issues.
Install, configure, and maintain desktop systems, laptops, and peripherals.
Ensure the deployment of operating systems, updates, and software packages.
Work with the IT team to resolve and escalate issues as needed.
Perform routine system audits and ensure systems are up-to-date and secure.
Provide end-user training and technical documentation where necessary.
Collaborate with team members and manage support tickets for various internal stakeholders.
2+ years of experience in Desktop Support or similar roles.
Strong experience with Windows OS, Mac OS, and Linux environments.
Experience with Active Directory for user management, group policies, and security.
Proficient with remote desktop tools and troubleshooting techniques.
Experience with networking protocols (TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP).
Strong knowledge of MS Office Suite and other productivity software.
Expertise in hardware diagnostics, repair, and replacements.
Knowledge of system imaging and software deployment tools (e.g., SCCM, MDT).
Familiar with ITIL processes for incident, problem, and change management.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain technical issues to non-technical users.
Ability to work independently, manage priorities, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Certification: CompTIA A+, Microsoft Certified Desktop Support Technician (MCDST), or equivalent.
Experience with cloud-based applications (e.g., Microsoft 365, Google Workspace).
Knowledge of IT security best practices and protocols.
Join a dynamic and innovative team with a global presence.
Opportunities for career growth and continuous learning.
Work with cutting-edge technologies to shape the future of IT solutions.
Ready to take your career to the next level? Apply now by clicking the ""Easy Apply"" button or send your resume to Neha1@Avasotech.com
AVASO Technology Solutions Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Statement

AVASO Technology Solutions (referred as “Avaso”) do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment on the basis of race, color, sex, creed, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, gender identity, pregnancy, genetic information, disability, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by state or local law, and to provide equal employment opportunity. Avaso is committed to providing a work environment that is free from discrimination and harassment, and we expect all employees to conduct themselves in a manner that reflects this commitment in all employment endeavors. All employment decisions are based on qualifications, merit, and business need.

Job Opportunity: Onsite Support Engineer at AVASO Technology

Location: Zurich, Switzerland

Employment Type: Dispatch

Experience: 2+ years

Language Known: English

Company Overview:

AVASO Technology is a global leader in providing IT solutions and services, specializing in offering top-tier support and managed services. We are committed to delivering cutting-edge technology solutions to our clients worldwide. If you’re a passionate IT professional with hands-on experience in desktop support, join us at AVASO to help businesses thrive with reliable and efficient IT services.

Position Overview:

We are seeking an experienced Onsite Support Engineer to join our team in Location: Zurich, Switzerland . The successful candidate will provide technical support, troubleshooting, and IT assistance to end users. This role requires someone with strong technical skills and a customer-focused approach.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Provide on-site and remote desktop support for users, ensuring issues are resolved quickly and efficiently.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve hardware, software, and network-related issues.
  • Install, configure, and maintain desktop systems, laptops, and peripherals.
  • Ensure the deployment of operating systems, updates, and software packages.
  • Work with the IT team to resolve and escalate issues as needed.
  • Perform routine system audits and ensure systems are up-to-date and secure.
  • Provide end-user training and technical documentation where necessary.
  • Collaborate with team members and manage support tickets for various internal stakeholders.

Required Skills &
column2:
Qualifications:

  • 2+ years of experience in Desktop Support or similar roles.
  • Strong experience with Windows OS, Mac OS, and Linux environments.
  • Experience with Active Directory for user management, group policies, and security.
  • Proficient with remote desktop tools and troubleshooting techniques.
  • Experience with networking protocols (TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP).
  • Strong knowledge of MS Office Suite and other productivity software.
  • Expertise in hardware diagnostics, repair, and replacements.
  • Knowledge of system imaging and software deployment tools (e.g., SCCM, MDT).
  • Familiar with ITIL processes for incident, problem, and change management.
  • Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain technical issues to non-technical users.
  • Ability to work independently, manage priorities, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
  • Fluency in English.

Must Have Skills:

  • Certification: CompTIA A+, Microsoft Certified Desktop Support Technician (MCDST), or equivalent.
  • Experience with cloud-based applications (e.g., Microsoft 365, Google Workspace).
  • Knowledge of IT security best practices and protocols.

Why AVASO Technology?

  • Join a dynamic and innovative team with a global presence.
  • Opportunities for career growth and continuous learning.
  • Competitive salary and benefits package.
  • Work with cutting-edge technologies to shape the future of IT solutions.

How to Apply:

Ready to take your career to the next level? Apply now by clicking the ""Easy Apply"" button or send your resume to Neha1@Avasotech.com

AVASO Technology Solutions Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Statement

AVASO Technology Solutions (referred as “Avaso”) do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment on the basis of race, color, sex, creed, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, gender identity, pregnancy, genetic information, disability, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by state or local law, and to provide equal employment opportunity. Avaso is committed to providing a work environment that is free from discrimination and harassment, and we expect all employees to conduct themselves in a manner that reflects this commitment in all employment endeavors. All employment decisions are based on qualifications, merit, and business need.

4265429111,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-data-engineer-at-nicoll-curtin-4265429111?position=3&pageNum=2&refId=sYtKpF0XoYcTuh1clzt11Q%3D%3D&trackingId=tLo72bmp0gtX6qglnAK5qg%3D%3D,Senior Data Engineer,Nicoll Curtin,"Zurich, Switzerland","We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer to join our client in Zurich who is one of the leaders in the financial industry.
This is a contracting role, with the initial duration of 12 months.
In this position, you will collaborate with data engineers and solution architects and focus on the development of robust data pipelines in PySpark on Databricks.

If you have a degree in computer science or related field, strong software engineering skills, strong experience with Python, PySpark, Spark, Delta Lake, Databricks and Azure, and fluency in English, this opportunity is the perfect fit for you!
If you are interested in this role, apply directly to bojana.bandovic@nicollcurtin.com.

We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer to join our client in Zurich who is one of the leaders in the financial industry.


This is a contracting role, with the initial duration of 12 months.


In this position, you will collaborate with data engineers and solution architects and focus on the development of robust data pipelines in PySpark on Databricks.


If you have a degree in computer science or related field, strong software engineering skills, strong experience with Python, PySpark, Spark, Delta Lake, Databricks and Azure, and fluency in English, this opportunity is the perfect fit for you!


If you are interested in this role, apply directly to bojana.bandovic@nicollcurtin.com.

4264464356,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/ai-engineer-computer-vision-at-flexion-robotics-4264464356?position=8&pageNum=2&refId=sYtKpF0XoYcTuh1clzt11Q%3D%3D&trackingId=%2FIWhSClIff1cEh0GKI2Cwg%3D%3D,AI Engineer - Computer Vision,Flexion Robotics,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","We are looking for a machine learning & computer vision expert to strengthen our team in Zurich.
The goal of this position is to develop and fine-tune state of the art vision and 3D geometric models for scene segmentation and scene understanding.
Experience with developing and training state of the art (transformer-based) vision models. Experience with 3D models to operate on point clouds is a plus.
PhD or master's degree in computer vision or machine learning with relevant project experience (e.g. master thesis)
Excellent knowledge of Python, PyTorch and the training of deep neural networks
Hands-on experience in the training and deployment of 2D and 3D segmentation and environment understanding models
We are looking for a person who enjoys working in a team in a very dynamic and fast-moving environment, and who is able and willing to take ownership of projects and decisions.
We at Flexion Robotics (flexion.ai) are a young company in Zurich working on the next generation of humanoid robot software to enable robots to perform useful tasks autonomously.
We work dynamically and move fast. The team is still fairly small and every new employee at this stage will have significant ownership of their current project.
We offer a competitive remuneration in the form of a competitive base salary and additional components/benefits depending on the specific role and the experience of the applicant.
We are looking for a machine learning &amp
column2:
computer vision expert to strengthen our team in Zurich.

The goal of this position is to develop and fine-tune state of the art vision and 3D geometric models for scene segmentation and scene understanding.

Requirements

Experience with developing and training state of the art (transformer-based) vision models. Experience with 3D models to operate on point clouds is a plus.

Particularly:

  • PhD or master's degree in computer vision or machine learning with relevant project experience (e.g. master thesis)
  • Excellent knowledge of Python, PyTorch and the training of deep neural networks
  • Hands-on experience in the training and deployment of 2D and 3D segmentation and environment understanding models
  • Robotics experience is a plus.

We are looking for a person who enjoys working in a team in a very dynamic and fast-moving environment, and who is able and willing to take ownership of projects and decisions.

Benefits

We at Flexion Robotics (flexion.ai) are a young company in Zurich working on the next generation of humanoid robot software to enable robots to perform useful tasks autonomously.

We work dynamically and move fast. The team is still fairly small and every new employee at this stage will have significant ownership of their current project.

We offer a competitive remuneration in the form of a competitive base salary and additional components/benefits depending on the specific role and the experience of the applicant.

4266724178,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/gis-remote-sensing-specialist-for-hq-or-global-based-in-geneva-link-for-external-applicants-at-impact-initiatives-4266724178?position=9&pageNum=2&refId=sYtKpF0XoYcTuh1clzt11Q%3D%3D&trackingId=f2MQYcYnD12Ep7jV7UJ9KQ%3D%3D,"GIS & Remote Sensing Specialist for HQ or Global, based in Geneva (Link For External Applicants)",IMPACT Initiatives,"Vernier, Geneva, Switzerland","Overview

The global GIS and Remote Sensing team at IMPACT plays a critical role in achieving the organisation’s research and analysis objectives, by enabling the production of timely, nuanced, evidence-based insights that can inform emergency response, resource allocation decisions, and long-term resilience planning in complex humanitarian settings. Working in close collaboration with research and analysis teams across the field and in HQ, the global GIS & Remote Sensing team ensures the collection, processing and analysis of relevant satellite imagery and geo-spatial data to monitor crisis-affected areas, assess needs, map population movements, and identify vulnerabilities among affected populations. Within this set-up, and under the supervision of the Head of Research, Learning and Technological Transformation, the GIS & Remote Sensing Specialist will be responsible for producing global analysis products, as well as technical backstopping to global and country teams for the implementation of relevant programmes, including, but not limited to, humanitarian emergencies and climate response efforts.

The candidate should have a strong technical background in Remote Sensing, GIS and climate data analysis, and prior experience with analysis of satellite imagery with different spatial and spectral resolutions. The candidate should also understand concepts of cartographic design and be experienced in presentation of the results of spatial analysis using static and interactive mapping products.
Co-lead the design of IMPACT’s global GIS & Remote Sensing Strategy, and ensure successful delivery through the development of guidelines, tools, and learning materials
Produce global products in line with IMPACT’s standards and strategic priorities (exact scope and priority areas of focus to be defined)
Provide technical backstopping and support for the successful implementation of relevant research and analysis programmes
column2: including:

column1: Guide global and country teams on planning and design in line with project objectives and IMPACT’s GIS & Remote Sensing guidelines
Support with the drafting and review of research ToRs, with a specific focus on the analysis plan, data management plan, and key remote sensing and geospatial analysis methodologies
Support with the production and review of relevant analysis outputs
Support with the development, maintenance of global partnerships, including:
Coordination with UNOSAT for the planning and procurement of services and satellite imagery
Representation in relevant meetings/ Working Groups and presentation of research findings to third parties to enhance their use and impact
Promote active use of datasets, GIS products, and research findings by partners and the broader humanitarian community for their decision making.
Additional Tasks (on An Ad-hoc, By Need Basis)

Provide other support for the implementation of IMPACT programmes as needed (e.g. data processing and analysis, technical supervision and capacity strengthening support), including in-country or remote surge to support to country teams
Proactively monitor best practices and emerging innovations in remote sensing, and as relevant, undertake research and development to incorporate innovative techniques into IMPACT’s work
Excellent academic qualifications, preferably a Master degree or higher related to GIS, Remote Sensing, Geography or Environmental sciences
At least 5-6 years of relevant work experience with remote sensing and geo-spatial analysis

column2: fluency in French or Spanish also an asset

column1: Integrity i.e. commitment to acting professionally while holding oneself and others accountable by operating with transparency and taking responsibility for one’s actions
Learning i.e. commitment towards personal and professional growth through a perspective of learning and thinking creatively
Resilience i.e. ability to effectively maintain focus on professional objectives while adapting and demonstrating flexibility as contexts, requirements and circumstances change
Interpersonal skills i.e. ability to effectively communicate and build relationships with others, internally and externally
Collaboration i.e. ability to work cooperatively with others from a diversity of backgrounds and viewpoints, engaging effectively internally and externally
Producing quality results i.e. operationalize objectives in an organized manner, delivering results on time and to a high standard of quality
Problem solving i.e. ability to use analytical and critical thinking to form sound judgments and inform evidence-based decisions
Strategy implementation Strategy Setting i.e. ability to create a clear and compelling strategy and course of action relevant for the context
Global research and analysis Research Planning i.e. ability to formulate appropriate research questions and methodologies based on the information landscape and the available resources

Geospatial Analysis i.e. ability to process spatial data for making calculations, identify spatial patterns, and relationships, including design and implementation of complex analysis (hot spot analysis, raster multi-criteria analysis, etc.)

Remote Sensing i.e. ability to follow remote sensing related procedures and processes, identify suitable tools and data sources, and perform relevant analysis, including intermediate-advanced working knowledge of ArcGIS Pro imagery processing tools and Google Earth Engine
Communicating Data i.e. effectively translate and disseminate research findings through accurate and effective research outputs
Mapping Visualisation i.e. ability to make maps that effectively communicate clear and accurate information, and advanced working knowledge of ArcGIS Pro
GIS Data Management i.e. ability to manage and use GIS data while maintaining data quality, including ability to work with a wide range of GIS databases
Technical guidance and capacity sharing Facilitating Learning i.e. ability to nurture professional growth and individual learning in others
External engagement Writing with Impact i.e. ability to write formally in a clear, structured, and compelling manner for external stakeholders
Speaking with Impact i.e. ability to speak formally in a clear, structured, and compelling manner to external stakeholders

For this position, gross salary between 5’800 CHF and 5’957 CHF monthly (before income tax). NB - IMPACT salaries are strictly determined by our salary grid depending on the grade of the position and the level of education and experience of staff. A contribution to medical insurance of 489 CHF per month is already included in the salary figure.
Insurance covering professional and non-professional accidents throughout the period of employment with IMPACT
Health insurance, life insurance and repatriation assistance in case of field visits/temporary deployments
Enrolment in IMPACT Initiatives Research Foundational Learning Programme within the first 3 months from the start of contract.
Applicants must hold a valid work permit for Switzerland or be EU/EFTA citizens
Up to 40% of remote work on a weekly basis.

4259947865,https://br.linkedin.com/jobs/view/analista-de-dados-j%C3%BAnior-s%C3%A3o-paulo-sp-at-shopee-4259947865?position=1&pageNum=0&refId=L6AvJwu5TAOicwtYO1olsQ%3D%3D&trackingId=Rli78gtZZ%2FUOPQHNblQWRA%3D%3D,Analista de Dados Júnior - São Paulo/SP,Shopee,"São Paulo, São Paulo, Brazil","Job Description

Aqui na Shô, acreditamos que cada membro de nossa equipe é fundamental para o nosso sucesso, e que diversidade de perspectivas e vivências são essenciais para movimentar nosso negócio e impulsionar o nosso propósito de mudar o mundo para melhor.

Fazer parte do nosso time é a oportunidade de se desenvolver dentro de uma cultura de muita agilidade. Se você ama assumir grandes responsabilidades e fazer o que nunca foi feito, a Shô é seu lugar. Aqui você terá grandes desafios, trabalhará em colaboração com um time diverso e contribuirá para o futuro do e-commerce no Brasil, criamos impacto positivo na vida de milhões de pessoas.

Adotamos um modelo de trabalho híbrido, esse modelo permite que as pessoas ajustem seu ambiente de trabalho de acordo com suas necessidades pessoais, ao mesmo tempo em que promove a colaboração e interação no escritório.

Fornecer suporte analítico de dados para diversos casos de negócios e demandas ad hoc, acompanhar os resultados dos projetos, coletar informações e feedback diários de diferentes stakeholders e apoiar em estudos para melhorias de processos e economia financeira.
Como será o seu dia a dia
Preparação e consolidação de diferentes tipos de base de dados
Realizar análise exploratória de dados além da criação de relatórios e dashboards
Automatizar e gerar melhoria de processos ETL
Auxiliar no desenvolvimento e acompanhamento de KPIs relacionados a projetos mapeados
Identificar padrões nos dados e apoiar a equipe na identificação de oportunidades
Acompanhar reuniões e registrar os principais pontos discutidos
Monitorar e documentar o andamento dos projetos mapeados.
O que você precisa para assumir o desafio
Conhecimento em ferramentas de visualização de dados (Looker, Power BI, etc)
Conhecimento de contexto logístico é um diferencial
Assistência médica e odontológica, estendendo-se aos dependentes
Vale Transporte, Vale Mobilidade ou Estacionamento no local
Bônus anual discricionário, atrelado à performance.

4243337903,https://br.linkedin.com/jobs/view/analista-de-dados-at-ita%C3%BA-unibanco-4243337903?position=4&pageNum=0&refId=L6AvJwu5TAOicwtYO1olsQ%3D%3D&trackingId=nat9DZDOP%2Fi%2FTIsAeyFvPQ%3D%3D,Analista de Dados,Itaú Unibanco,"São Paulo, São Paulo, Brazil","Você que busca trabalhar com propósito e engajamento social, venha fazer parte do Instituto Unibanco em prol de uma educação pública de qualidade :)
A diversidade é um de nossos valores e, por isso, estimulamos a candidatura de pessoas negras e LGBTQIAPN+ em nossos processos seletivos.

Você será responsável por organizar, analisar e transformar dados educacionais em informações úteis para apoiar decisões e melhorar a qualidade da educação pública. Atuará em projetos que envolvem modelagem estatística, visualização de dados e desenvolvimento de indicadores, sempre em colaboração com equipes multidisciplinares.
Coletar, limpar e integrar dados de diferentes fontes (como Censo Escolar e SAEB)
Criar modelos estatísticos e preditivos para entender padrões e apoiar decisões
Desenvolver indicadores e dashboards sobre desempenho, equidade e aprendizagem
Apoiar pesquisas e testes com análises estatísticas e simulações
Produzir relatórios e apresentações para públicos diversos
Trabalhar com engenheiros, cientistas de dados e gestores de produto
Contribuir para a melhoria de produtos digitais com base em dados reais
Atuar como Data Steward, respeitando as diretrizes de gestão e governança de dados da instituição, em relação ao ciclo de vida dos dados sob sua responsabilidade, incluindo a catalogação.
Formação em Estatística, Ciência de Dados, Computação, Engenharia, Economia ou áreas afins
Experiência com análise de dados em larga escala, especialmente na área educacional
Domínio de Python, R, SQL e ferramentas de machine learning
Conhecimento em nuvem (AWS, Azure ou GCP) e visualização de dados (Power BI, Tableau)
Familiaridade com boas práticas de engenharia de dados, gestão e governança de dados e governança de dados sensíveis.
Experiência no setor público ou terceiro setor
Conhecimento em Git, CI/CD e integração com sistemas educacionais
Conhecimento de práticas em Gestão e Governança de Dados
Noções de LGPD aplicadas à educação.

4251531178,https://br.linkedin.com/jobs/view/analista-de-dados-e-melhoria-cont%C3%ADnua-s%C3%AAnior-at-shopee-4251531178?position=5&pageNum=0&refId=L6AvJwu5TAOicwtYO1olsQ%3D%3D&trackingId=kYIxnbkjtCMNRFXrP1N7Aw%3D%3D,Analista de Dados e Melhoria Contínua Sênior,Shopee,"São Paulo, São Paulo, Brazil","About The Team

Aqui na Shô, acreditamos que cada membro de nossa equipe é fundamental para o nosso sucesso, e que diversidade de perspectivas e vivências são essenciais para movimentar nosso negócio e impulsionar o nosso propósito de mudar o mundo para melhor.

Fazer parte do nosso time é a oportunidade de se desenvolver dentro de uma cultura de muita agilidade. Se você ama assumir grandes responsabilidades e fazer o que nunca foi feito, a Shô é seu lugar. Aqui você terá grandes desafios, trabalhará em colaboração com um time diverso e contribuirá para o futuro do e-commerce no Brasil, criamos impacto positivo na vida de milhões de pessoas.

Adotamos um modelo de trabalho híbrido, esse modelo permite que as pessoas ajustem seu ambiente de trabalho de acordo com suas necessidades pessoais, ao mesmo tempo em que promove a colaboração e interação no escritório.

Será responsável por desempenhar um papel fundamental ao longo de toda a jornada operacional, desde o momento em que o usuário busca por um produto na plataforma até a entrega final: monitorar e analisar indicadores chave de desempenho em toda a região, realizando análises aprofundadas sempre que há variações na performance da operação. Além disso, oferecerá um suporte excepcional para compradores e vendedores, garantindo a experiência positiva em todas as etapas.
Como será o seu dia a dia
Construir e manter dashboards e relatórios estratégicos, transformando dados em insights acionáveis para a operação
Garantir a consistência e confiabilidade dos dados para as operações, identificando desvios e investigando motivos para resolução de problema nos dados
Atuar em projetos de Melhoria Contínua, participando do planejamento, execução e acompanhamento das etapas, dando visibilidade aos principais stakeholders
Conhecer os processos da área e da empresa para suportar a tomada de decisões assertivas com base em dados
Conduzir reuniões semanais com a liderança, reportando análises, avanços e próximos passos
Identificar padrões, desvios e oportunidades de melhoria a partir de análises de dados.
O que você precisa para assumir o desafio
Formação superior em Administração, Engenharia de Produção, Ciência de Dados, Estatística, Engenharia, ou áreas correlatas
Experiência com análise de dados, construção de relatórios e dashboards (ex: Power BI, Google Data Studio)
Capacidade de identificar padrões e desvios em ambientes com múltiplas variáveis
Organização e habilidade para gerenciar múltiplas demandas em um ambiente dinâmico
Familiaridade com métricas e indicadores operacionais de CS
Habilidade para trabalhar com diferentes áreas e níveis hierárquicos
Conhecimentos em Python ou outras linguagens de análise de dados são diferenciais.
Assistência médica e odontológica, estendendo-se aos dependentes
Vale Transporte, Vale Mobilidade ou Estacionamento no local

Aqui na Shô, acreditamos que cada membro de nossa equipe é fundamental para o nosso sucesso, e que diversidade de perspectivas e vivências são essenciais para movimentar nosso negócio e impulsionar o nosso propósito de mudar o mundo para melhor.

Fazer parte do nosso time é a oportunidade de se desenvolver dentro de uma cultura de muita agilidade. Se você ama assumir grandes responsabilidades e fazer o que nunca foi feito, a Shô é seu lugar. Aqui você terá grandes desafios, trabalhará em colaboração com um time diverso e contribuirá para o futuro do e-commerce no Brasil, criamos impacto positivo na vida de milhões de pessoas.

Adotamos um modelo de trabalho híbrido, esse modelo permite que as pessoas ajustem seu ambiente de trabalho de acordo com suas necessidades pessoais, ao mesmo tempo em que promove a colaboração e interação no escritório.

A posição de Analista de Projetos e Operações é responsável por entender oportunidades de melhorias operacionais dentro de projetos, entendendo em colaboração com áreas de Produtos, Logística e de Business quais os pontos chave necessários para o sucesso de cada projeto, criando e acompanhando indicadores, levantando oportunidades de melhoria sistêmicas através de análises de dados e de experiência.
Como será o seu dia a dia
Mapeamento de gaps e análises de melhorias
Gestão de projetos junto às áreas internas e externas
Análise de dados para identificação de oportunidades e problemas
Elaboração e apresentação de propostas de melhorias em fóruns internos
O que você precisa para assumir o desafio
Graduação completa em Administração, Logística, Engenharia ou áreas correlatas
Conhecimento no Pacote Office (word, excel, powerpoint), principalmente Excel/ Google Sheets
Forte pensamento lógico e analítico, organização
Experiência em mapeamento e melhoria de processos operacionais e gerenciamento de projetos
Desejável experiência em gestão de processos e/ou operações.
Disponibilidade para atuar no formato híbrido (presencial 3x por semana na região da Faria Lima/SP).
Assistência médica e odontológica, estendendo-se aos dependentes

4266810845,https://br.linkedin.com/jobs/view/analista-de-dados-pl-remoto-at-picpay-4266810845?position=11&pageNum=0&refId=L6AvJwu5TAOicwtYO1olsQ%3D%3D&trackingId=7Xeq6TSyGlNGapnqAMw%2FzA%3D%3D,ANALISTA DE DADOS PL - REMOTO,PicPay,Brazil,"Sobre o PicPay

Com mais de dez anos de história, o PicPay é um ecossistema completo de serviços financeiros e não-financeiros que tem como objetivo atender as necessidades diárias de milhares de pessoas e negócios, tornando-se a sua principal conta do dia a dia.

Fundada em Vitória (ES), a empresa já conta com mais de 35 milhões de clientes ativos e faz parte do grupo J&F, um dos maiores conglomerados empresariais do Brasil. A companhia atua em diversas frentes, como Serviços Financeiros para Pessoa Física, Serviços Financeiros para Pessoa Jurídica, Investimentos e PicPay Shop.

Pautados pela nossa cultura, seguimos no propósito de dar muito mais pique para a vida de milhões de brasileiros. Conheça nossos valores: Atitude de Dono(a), Disciplina, Determinação, Disponibilidade, Simplicidade, Humildade e Franqueza.

O respeito, a ética, a busca pela equidade e a valorização da pluralidade são elementos inegociáveis e fazem parte da prática no nosso dia a dia aqui no PicPay. Por isso, esta vaga está aberta para todas as pessoas, independente de gênero, religião, etnia, deficiência, idade, orientação sexual ou qualquer outro fator.

Estamos buscando um(a) Analista de Negócios Junior apaixonado(a) por transformar dados complexos em insights acionáveis para impulsionar nossa área de Atendimento PJ. Se você possui um forte domínio de SQL, habilidade analítica apurada e gosta de gerar valor para a tomada de decisão do negócios, essa pode ser a sua próxima grande oportunidade!
Analisar grandes volumes de dados de diversas fontes.
Desenvolver e manter modelos de dados robustos e eficientes para suportar as necessidades da área de Atendimento PJ.
Construir dashboards e relatórios interativos e de fácil compreensão.
Realizar análises exploratórias para identificar oportunidades de otimização de processos e melhoria de KPIs.
Comunicar de forma clara e concisa os insights e tendências identificados.
Colaborar ativamente com as áreas de Atendimento, Back-Office, terceirizadas de atendimento e outras áreas de negócio para entender suas necessidades e fornecer soluções de dados eficazes.
Garantir a qualidade e integridade dos dados utilizados nas análises
Experiência prévia como Analista de Dados.
Experiência com dados e indicadores de Atendimento (NS, TPR, TMI, TMR, TME, TMA, NPS, Aderência, Qualidade, Treinamento, etc).
Profundo conhecimento e domínio de SQL para manipulação e extração de dados de bancos de dados relacionais.
Experiência na criação de visualizações de dados impactantes utilizando ferramentas como Databricks SQL, Tableau ou outras.
Habilidade de traduzir dados complexos em informações claras e acionáveis para públicos diversos.
Boa comunicação verbal e escrita, incluindo a capacidade de apresentar resultados de forma eficaz.
Proatividade, autonomia e capacidade de trabalhar em equipe
Programa Lado a Lado, com apoio jurídico, social, psicológico e financeiro
Cartão de crédito PicPay Benefícios, com ampla aceitação, onde você recebe seu saldo de Alimentação/Refeição e Mobilidade ou Teletrabalho (de acordo com o seu contrato de trabalho).
Licença Maternidade estendida de 6 meses, e de Paternidade também estendida de 20 dias.

Programa ""Novo Ser"", que acompanha nossas mamães durante toda a gestação e no retorno da licença. Falando nisso, ao retornar da licença maternidade, as mamães ainda contam com a ajuda do Auxílio Creche e também os papais que possuem guarda unilateral ou compartilhada.
Reconhecemos resultados: PPR- Participação nos Resultados do PicPay.

Sobre o PicPay

Com mais de dez anos de história, o PicPay é um ecossistema completo de serviços financeiros e não-financeiros que tem como objetivo atender as necessidades diárias de milhares de pessoas e negócios, tornando-se a sua principal conta do dia a dia.

Fundada em Vitória (ES), a empresa já conta com mais de 35 milhões de clientes ativos e faz parte do grupo J&
column2:
F, um dos maiores conglomerados empresariais do Brasil. A companhia atua em diversas frentes, como Serviços Financeiros para Pessoa Física, Serviços Financeiros para Pessoa Jurídica, Investimentos e PicPay Shop.

Pautados pela nossa cultura, seguimos no propósito de dar muito mais pique para a vida de milhões de brasileiros. Conheça nossos valores: Atitude de Dono(a), Disciplina, Determinação, Disponibilidade, Simplicidade, Humildade e Franqueza.

O respeito, a ética, a busca pela equidade e a valorização da pluralidade são elementos inegociáveis e fazem parte da prática no nosso dia a dia aqui no PicPay. Por isso, esta vaga está aberta para todas as pessoas, independente de gênero, religião, etnia, deficiência, idade, orientação sexual ou qualquer outro fator.

Sobre a vaga:

  • Estamos buscando um(a) Analista de Negócios Junior apaixonado(a) por transformar dados complexos em insights acionáveis para impulsionar nossa área de Atendimento PJ. Se você possui um forte domínio de SQL, habilidade analítica apurada e gosta de gerar valor para a tomada de decisão do negócios, essa pode ser a sua próxima grande oportunidade!

Responsabilidade e atribuições:

  • Analisar grandes volumes de dados de diversas fontes.
  • Desenvolver e manter modelos de dados robustos e eficientes para suportar as necessidades da área de Atendimento PJ.
  • Construir dashboards e relatórios interativos e de fácil compreensão.
  • Realizar análises exploratórias para identificar oportunidades de otimização de processos e melhoria de KPIs.
  • Comunicar de forma clara e concisa os insights e tendências identificados.
  • Colaborar ativamente com as áreas de Atendimento, Back-Office, terceirizadas de atendimento e outras áreas de negócio para entender suas necessidades e fornecer soluções de dados eficazes.

O que oferecemos:

Saúde e Bem-estar

Construção de storytelling para apresentações de resultados e recomendações estratégicas.

Realizar atividades de extração, manipulação e visualização de dados,
Participar da criação de relatórios e painéis para apoiar nas tomadas de decisão e aprimorar a profundidade das análises da área.

Vivência em projetos de mídia de performance.

Perfil analítico com capacidade de interpretar dados e transformar em insights

Capacidade de alinhar o design com os objetivos do negócio.

Plano de Saúde e Plano Odontológico

Estamos em busca de um(a) Analista de Insights (Performance) que deseje desenvolver habilidades em análise de dados voltada para projetos de performance, além de atuar em iniciativas de inovação e transformação digital. Nesta posição, você fará parte da equipe de Aquisição, contribuindo com análises, automatização de processos e melhorias internas. Esse profissional será responsável por automatizar dados provenientes de canais de mídia pagos e orgânicos, integrar plataformas de Analytics e criar dashboards.

Responsabilidades e atribuições

  • Suporte no acompanhamento de dados de performance, garantindo a precisão das informações.
  • Desenvolvimento de análises e insights para otimizar estratégias dos canais de aquisição (Mídia e SEO).
  • Atualização e manutenção de dashboards e relatórios nas ferramentas de BI da companhia, especialmente Looker Studio e Qlik
  • Construção de storytelling para apresentações de resultados e recomendações estratégicas.
  • Integração de dados de diferentes fontes para suporte à tomada de decisão.
  • Colaboração com equipes de mídia para definir estratégias baseadas em dados.
  • Realizar atividades de extração, manipulação e visualização de dados,
  • Participar da criação de relatórios e painéis para apoiar nas tomadas de decisão e aprimorar a profundidade das análises da área.
  • Manter-se atualizado(a) sobre as ferramentas e metodologias utilizadas pela equipe.


Requisitos e qualificações

  • Formação Superior Completa
  • Experiência em áreas de marketing digital.
  • Conhecimento em Excel /Avançado e/ou Google Sheets e Google Analytics.
  • Domínio pacote office.
  • Conhecimento em SQL e manipulação de bancos de dados.


Desejável, mas não eliminatório:

  • Conhecimento com Big Query
  • Conhecimento da ferramenta Supermetrics &

4262897649,https://br.linkedin.com/jobs/view/analista-de-dados-jr-at-synoro-neg%C3%B3cios-inovadores-4262897649?position=15&pageNum=0&refId=L6AvJwu5TAOicwtYO1olsQ%3D%3D&trackingId=yScS%2FeTAnB4iWGEJEg7%2FVQ%3D%3D,Analista de Dados Jr,SYNORO Negócios Inovadores,"São Paulo, São Paulo, Brazil","Sobre o Grupo Synoro

O Grupo Synoro é formado por empresas especializadas em dados, tecnologia e inovação, entregando soluções de alto impacto por meio de metodologias ágeis e times altamente qualificados. Atuamos em diferentes frentes para transformar dados em decisões estratégicas.

A TDW, empresa do Grupo Synoro, é referência em projetos de Business Intelligence e Analytics, oferecendo inteligência de dados para apoiar grandes clientes em decisões de negócio com alta performance e precisão.

Buscamos um(a) Analista de BI Júnior com interesse em crescer na área de dados e inteligência de negócios. A pessoa será responsável por apoiar a criação de dashboards e relatórios no Power BI, além de contribuir com análises e organização das informações que apoiam a tomada de decisão.
Apoiar o desenvolvimento e atualização de dashboards e relatórios em Power BI
Ajudar na coleta e organização de dados de diferentes fontes
Colaborar com equipes de negócio para entender necessidades e transformar dados em informação útil
Aprender e aplicar boas práticas de visualização e estruturação de relatórios.
Conhecimento em Power BI (criação de relatórios, DAX e Power Query)
Interesse por análise de dados e inteligência de negócios
Perfil proativo, curioso e com vontade de aprender.
Noções básicas de modelagem de dados
Experiência com Excel avançado será considerada um plus.
Modelo de contratação: CLT – pela TDW (Grupo Synoro)
Formato de trabalho: Híbrido – Zona Sul de São Paulo (SP)

Estamos em busca de um(a) Analista de Dados Pleno para integrar nosso time de Business Intelligence. Aqui, trabalhamos com dados para impulsionar decisões estratégicas de marketing, mídia e performance. Atuamos com uma cultura analítica forte, conectada diretamente aos objetivos de negócio dos nossos clientes.

Você fará parte de um ambiente colaborativo e desafiador, com acesso a grandes volumes de dados e ferramentas modernas de análise. Procuramos alguém com raciocínio crítico, capacidade de resolução de problemas e visão de negócio, que saiba transformar dados em valor.
Criar e manter dashboards e relatórios de performance em Power BI
Explorar e manipular grandes volumes de dados em BigQuery e Databricks
Conduzir análises ad hoc com foco em insights acionáveis para mídia, marketing e negócios
Desenvolver pipelines de dados e garantir a confiabilidade das informações utilizadas nos reports
Atuar em parceria com diferentes áreas da agência, traduzindo necessidades de negócio em soluções analíticas
Participar da definição e monitoramento de KPIs estratégicos.
Experiência prévia em análise de dados, preferencialmente em ambientes de agência, consultoria ou marketing
Domínio de SQL (BigQuery) para análise e modelagem de dados
Vivência com ambientes de dados em nuvem e notebooks (como Databricks / PySpark)
Domínio em Power BI, incluindo modelagem, medidas DAX e publicação de relatórios
Forte capacidade analítica, pensamento crítico e orientação a resultados
Facilidade para comunicar insights de forma clara e objetiva para diferentes públicos.
Conhecimento em métricas de mídia digital, CRM e atribuição de campanhas
Familiaridade com versionamento de código (Git) e boas práticas de engenharia de dados

A área de dados do Banco tem crescido rapidamente e é protagonista nos novos modelos de negócio. Prezamos por um time de alta qualidade e valorizamos profissionais com perfil multidisciplinar, forte capacidade analítica, curiosidade intelectual e disposição para trabalho duro, sempre buscando resolver desafios complexos com excelência. Temos oportunidades para atuar junto a diversas áreas do banco, como Banking, Investimentos, Crédito, Asset Management e Plataformas Digitais. Buscamos profissionais motivados, capazes de trabalhar de forma autônoma, que gostem de desafios, sejam naturalmente curiosos e desejem atuar em um ambiente dinâmico, com forte impacto no negócio.
Realizar estudos e análises avançadas utilizando técnicas e ferramentas de Big Data
Manter e otimizar ETLs garantindo a integridade e disponibilidade dos dados
Desenvolver dashboards claros e intuitivos, facilitando a tomada de decisões estratégicas.
Graduação completa em Engenharia, Computação, Matemática ou áreas correlatas
Disponibilidade para atuar no modelo híbrido (3x por semana) ou presencial no escritório de São Paulo (Faria Lima)
Experiência sólida em Python e SQL
Conhecimento em soluções e serviços AWS
Domínio de ferramentas de visualização de dados, especialmente PowerBI
Excelentes habilidades analíticas, capacidade de resolução de problemas e curiosidade intelectual
Conhecimento prévio do mercado financeiro (investimentos, crédito, banking, etc.) ou plataformas digitais é um diferencial
Conhecimento e experiência prática em inferência estatística é um diferencial.
Planos por adesão como Previdência Privada e Seguro de Vida
Licença Maternidade e Paternidade Estendida – empresa Cidadã.

4265260357,https://br.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-iii-at-banco-bradesco-4265260357?position=28&pageNum=0&refId=L6AvJwu5TAOicwtYO1olsQ%3D%3D&trackingId=ZDPiFqnfxmYCIGbl3%2BcmJg%3D%3D,Business Intelligence III,Banco Bradesco,"Osasco, São Paulo, Brazil","Sobre o Bradesco

O Bradesco é um dos maiores grupos financeiros do Brasil, com uma história marcada pelo pioneirismo e inovação. Por meio da nossa carteira amplamente diversificada de produtos financeiros, serviços bancários e de seguros contribuímos com a realização das pessoas e o crescimento sustentável de empresas e sociedade. Venha fazer parte do nosso ecossistema financeiro e impactar a experiência de milhões de pessoas!
O que é o nosso time de Estratégia de Cobrança?

É responsável pela estratégia de cobrança pessoa física. Missão: Desenvolver as melhores parâmetros de cobrança com base em dados, de forma a maximizar o resultado, proporcionando a experiência ideal aos diferentes perfis de clientes.
Como será seu dia a dia?
Sendo Business Intelligence III, atuará na gerência Estratégia de Cobrança e suas principais atividades serão:
Realizar estudos analíticos por meio da manipulação de grande volume de dados
Fará a interlocução técnica com os times de Ciência de Dados ou Engenharia de Dados para especificar modelos ou soluções analíticas de interesse da área
Dar suporte no gerenciamento de projetos, desde a construção das ferramentas analíticas até sua implementação e uso em produção
Apresentar resultados de estudos e soluções analíticas, por meio de relatório técnicos e apresentações
Utilizará indicadores para fazer a gestão do segmento e definir prioridades de atuação
Interagir com uma ampla rede de stakeholders internos
Auxiliar na difusão e aplicação das melhores práticas, técnicas ou comportamentais, compartilhadas pela liderança
Gerar insights e elaborar storytelling consistente.
O que você precisa ter ou saber?
Experiência com manipulação de grande volume de dados e desenvolvimento de soluções analíticas
Conhecimento intermediário em estatística e técnicas de ciência de dados. Noções de MLOPs
Excelentes habilidades analíticas e capacidade de disseminar informações com atenção a detalhes e
Conhecimento macro dos processos de recuperação de crédito (Estratégia, operação, Segmentação etc)
Conhecimento avançado em SAS, Python, Databricks (cloud/azure) e Power BI.
Será um diferencial se você tiver:
Ter atuado na área de recuperação crédito ou cobrança
Graduação em ciência de dados ou mestrado/doutorado em estatística ou áreas correlatas.
No Bradesco valorizamos a saúde e bem-estar, oferecendo um extenso portfólio de benefícios a todas nossas pessoas funcionárias:
PLR ou Bônus: Conforme a elegibilidade de cargo*
Descontos em produtos e serviços em empresas parceiras
Previdência Privada (adesão opcional, com participação financeira da Organização Bradesco)
Viva Bem Bradesco: programa de saúde, bem-estar e qualidade de vida
Isenção de Tarifas: condições especiais em diversos produtos e serviços
Licença Maternidade de 180 dias, acompanhamento assistencial da gestação até o pós-parto
